Summary: Don't be put off by the exterior of the building, it is currently undergoing a much needed renovation.  Inside is perfectly OK and suitable for your needs with spacious rooms and facilities.  The Manager Mr Khan was very polite and extremely helpful with our requirements. Overall a nice stay.

Location was fantastic! Right at the beach! We were down visiting family and wanted something close to Belmont Shore… So we gave this a try…  As other reviewers have noted hotel location is fantastic…property needs some serious TLC…. Dated and worn..  But the staff were great!

Amazing location, friendly helpful staff, outdated overall appearance. Hotel just feels run down. Pretty clean. I wished the room had screen door so you could leave the slider open and not worry about bugs.

Manager Nazrul Khan accosted me right outside of my room as I was trying to leave/checkout from hotel.  He asked me if I had a pet (pets are not allowed).  I answered "no, we have an ADA licensed service dog (Yorkshire Terrier).  He then snapped, "did you declare this!?"  I said; "yes, in fact I phoned Edgar (Front Desk) about our service animal we would be bringing the day before we check-in".  Steadfast, Mr. Khan bellowed "why are you hiding your dog?"  The dog was in her carrier clearly visible.  Yet, he continued loudly repeating his question, "why are you hiding the dog, why!!?"  I said, "look, I am in a hurry and you are harassing me!!".  He laughed, looked at his housekeeping staff saying, "I have witnesses right here who can see I am not doing anything".  I said, "you

Summary Heading: Best price for being so close to the beach
Summary: We stayed in the ocean view room.  The Good: room size is good, It was clean, at night you can hear the ocean, parking garage with no parking charges. Price is high, but low compared to other hotels this close to the beach.  The bad: hotel is old and outdated, bathrooms are small. It looks like the only renovation done was floor tile was put in, poorly done though.  No breakfast.

The floors in the room were filthy like they had not been mopped in quite some time. The bed was very hard and uncomfortable. Carpets in the hotel hallways were stinky. The hotel definitely needs some updating and maintenance. The best part of this hotel is where it’s located.

Summary Heading: Great location.  Pretty run down. Good value for on the beach.
Summary: Lovely spot.  Was super easy to the beach and good food.  Check in and out was great. Parking was great.  Rooms were pretty depleted and not exactly up to date.  Carpet and bathrooms were kind of worn down, but the location made up for it.  For the money and location, would do it again.  We booked another night for the return trip, but they refunded my payment without me knowing and we had no place to stay.

Very rude. My mother who had a brain aneurysm lost her speech and has gained some of it back. She tried to get another night stay since I was coming into town.she checked the night before and in the early am they where busy and unable to do so at the time. So she came back at 8am and they had booked the room out. She then explained she didn't understand because of her stroke and he said I don't care, if your not out by 11 am I'm calling the police. It's very upsetting when people can't find the time to he kind to others who have had a brain injury. He did try to say he was sorry that he couldn't accommodate her, but the damage had been done. Also the carpets are discussing I took a shower and walked on the carpet and my bare feet where filthy. It does have great access to the

Summary Heading: Meh…pay for an ocean view or be upset!
Summary: This hotel is in a great location. It also seems to be relatively clean given what the housekeeping crew has to work with. If you don’t pay for an ocean view, it will be a complete disappointment. The property is in complete disrepair and has been neglected for decades. Apparently a few rooms have been renovated but the rest of the rooms and hotel have not. The decor and furnishings are extremely dated, dark and uninviting. Walking barefoot on the carpet left the bottoms of my kids’ feet black.

No breakfast at all even though advertised. Right at the beach and restaurants. Room very clean and everything worked. It is very expensive for what you get, but the location was what I needed.  Will stay there again.

We stayed here for one night on a road trip. Location- great!  It's literally across the street from the beach.  On the other side is a shopping center with a few solid restaurant options. Rooms- The room seemed renovated, as it didn't have carpet.  The bed was really comfy.  It had a fridge.  We were on the street side and the traffic noise was pretty intense. Bathroom- fine.  it had just a shower, no tub. Internet- bad enough that I couldn't take a Zoom call from my laptop. Parking- We felt fine in the parking garage.  Not suitable for larger cars.

I made a reservation by phone (714 421-4451) I asked booking travelodge Huntington beach but she made the reservation in Travelodge Monterrey. I call every day since 03/12/2022 to refund my money and nobody can solve my problem until now !!

This is the worst place I have ever been to.  My family and I travel all the time.  I am a teacher with 2 little ones and went during our vacation .  We asked to move rooms because we were in a room that was not renovated and had carpet.  The carpet looked like it never been cleaned, and the carpet had caked dirt on my kids feet.  I have 2 year old . so she loves rolling on the floor. When my husband asked if we could move, the owner got mad and said we could just leave then.  He kicked us out!  He told us to get our belongings and leave, and called the cops.  I have NEVER felt like a criminal.   We asked for our closing receipt and he refused to give it to us.  I called the cops myself because I was scared that they wouldn't hear our side.  We agreed to leave, but wanted the

The hotel is not kept up well and we had bugs in our room.  While it is near the beach, it is not worth staying at this hotel.  We had no internet access in our room.  My wife had to talk me into not leaving in the middle of the night for another hotel.

This hotel was OK priced you get what you pay for. I stayed at this hotel because of the short walk to the beach. This hotel didn’t serve breakfast which was the only hotel out of four that I stayed at that didn’t,  But they would come in and clean your room daily if you stayed there for multiple days which is totally opposite from other hotels.

This is a nice hotel with Ocean Views.  It's just a quick walk to have your feet in the sand!  The property is a bit outdated, but the rooms are very clean .  We were disappointed that Breakfast has been discontinued.  We were glad to see the elevator working well.

Summary Heading: Keep on traveling find something better
Summary: It will be very hard to find something good to say about this place. We checked into three rooms one was supposed to have three queen beds it only had two queen beds and a rollaway that was not good at all. Return to the desk was told they didn’t have three queen beds we were stuck with what we had. There was a couch in the room that look like it was 30 years old dirty, scary and we were not even going to consider sitting on it. There was mold in the bathroom. Was told breakfast was provided but on the door it said because of Covid they’ve canceled breakfast. The garage under the building was too small for my 15 passenger van and was told I needed to find my own place to Park it, in an area where parking overnight was not allowed in any places it was very difficult to find a

Summary Heading: Great location at a great price
Summary: We have stayed at this property twice, once in 2019 and over this weekend. We have not been disappointed either time. This is definitely an older hotel but the rooms are clean and the staff is excellent. You won't get a better deal for an ocean front property.   The front desk clerk Edgar was extremely friendly and professional. He was being berated by a horrible woman and he kept his cool the entire time. I was very impressed. We had an issue with our fridge and they were quick to replace it with a new one. The maintenance guy even put our food and drinks away for us and wrote us the nicest note. This will definitely be our go to spot for Huntington beach.

Summary Heading: Best bang for your buck for ocean view!
Summary: Staff are great . rooms recently remodeled and very clean. good people staying there, comfortable and safe. location awesome , 2 minute walk to water. patio with table and chairs. everything you want for ocean front view.

As for the staff ok but not clean at all carpet was wet and needs to be removed and shower doors fell on us , toilet seat was peeling all bad they need to remodel asap Don’t stay find another location

Rooms with carpet are very dirty. Bathroom had moldy corners. If planning to stay here, I suggest booking an ocean front room. More expensive, but you won’t have black feet from sticky carpeting. If staying in their non-ocean front rooms, I suggest bringing shower shoes or house shoes to walk around in and plenty of sanitizer for personal use.

Arriving at Travel Lodge in the parking garage there were beer bottles and human feces right next to were I parked. The whole parking structure stunk of urine. Upon going inside, I Could see how outdated the hotel was. Looks like it has not been remodeled in 20 years. Carpet was stained and torn, just very run down looking. Staying in Huntington beach at the price per night I was thinking this hotel would have been gorgeous with the beach right there. Also, the window must be very thin, I hear traffic all night, staying in a hotel, I would think it would be a peaceful night stay. Nope..... not a good experience at all. Wish I could have gotten a refund since I basically did not sleep.  Recommendations to start with- You should install an electric gate so the homeless do not go

great location, close to many bars and attractions. most everyone there was very personable. the views in the ocean side rooms were excellent, i would definitely go back to this location again in the future

The service sucks. When I was checking in, the staff made me wait as he looked like he was watching TV. The parking was also an issue as we had two cars and they had a policy of one car per room and there was no alternative as to when we can park, And I also felt attacked by the worker when i went down saturday with regards to the parking as their disabled parking was not clearly marked and he was very abrupt and not friendly. No customer service at all.  Not returning to this place. Unfortunately, you get what you pay for.

Good little beach spot. The beach is pretty quiet, get the balcony view or its just a view of jack in the box. Rooms are good, nothing fancy but the location makes up for it. Hotel is quiet and has little private balcony. Ice machine worked and water pressure is great. Beds are on the firm side. Parking is convenient. Beware beach closes at 10 and almost all food closes around 9.

I used Priceline to book 3 nights at $140/night for a nearby wedding.  What I walked into was NOT what was represented online.  The positives: the staff is kind.  The room was clean.  The negatives: hostels are better furnished than this room.  TV with 5 channels.  We booked a 'suite' which was supposed to have a sitting area, table and rollaway bed for more people to stay.  the rollaway was an ancient mattress with springs sticking up through it and extremely short.  All beds were tremendously uncomfortable.  The couch looked like it came off the street - sprung cushions and the pull-out was zip-tied so it couldn't be used.  One day of maintenance could have helped, but no-one apparently cares.  See pictures below.  Priceline has refused to help.  Stay away from both until they

No continental breakfast even though it’s advertised. The room was clean and spacious. No tub in the bathroom. Communal microwave and water provided on the first floor by the lobby. The access to the beaches and food options was a major plus. Everything was walking distance for us.

Summary Heading: Stay away from this place!! Beware!
Summary: We stayed here and encountered the local police department and sheriffs department at our hotel. We later found out there was a prostitution operation down the hall from our room. Will never stay here again stay away from this place. Also, the view from our second story was of homeless drug addicts sitting in the grass area behind the hotel injecting themselves with heroin. Again, another reason to avoid this place especially with a family.

We could see the beach from our room, which was clean & had a beautiful view. I went next door to the fast food place and got us a quick breakfast and we could see dolphins while we ate, which was super cool. The air condioner worked really well. Across the street is a great tasting Mexican restaurant and more food options like pizza. Our only complaint would be the mattress was not very comfy. We would definitely stay again!

Nice staff,Room was big and clean.Large patio,walk to beach.under ground parking.Felt safe there.Alot of older kids hangen out but at 10pm cops come around and move all the noise away from beach and around the hotel.Will come again.

Horrible stay. The manager at the front (big big guy) was a horrible person. Not friendly at all. And get this!!!!....... NO RUNNING WATER WITH NO REFUND!!!! YES, during COVID they gave us NO running water to wash our hands. Ooooo I can’t wait to give this to the news. NO WATER DURING COVID TO WASH HANDS!!?? And then the general manager wouldn’t return my call. I’m taking this as far as I can. Anyone wants to help please reach out.

At the last minute I decide to take the family away for a weekend getaway. We have always passed this Lodge but always thought it was out of our price range, but after a quick check it was totally in our budget. I didnt read everything about the room and was very surprised ir came with a balcony facing the beach!

Clean spacious rooms, underground parking, close to the beach, several food options across the street, nice balconies with table and chairs. My only complaint is that the elevator was "temporarily" out of order. According to other reviews it has been out of order for several months.

Summary Heading: Best view for the dreaded taxes!!
Summary: My family has been here many times! I would say it's our go-to when we go to the beach. It is very close to the Seal Beach shops by the pier. There is kayaking and boats close by. There is a Jack in the box right next door. Parking is great. And the ocean view is beautiful! The room has free WiFi, an office area downstairs and free breakfast. I brought my Roku and it worked great! They have Chinese delivery, Postmates, and Uber Eats for any delivery needed. Our room was the 2 queen ocean front. Fridge, microwave is downstairs Plenty of room to get away and do some work if you need to!

Summary Heading: I stayed here while I worked in Orange County for a few days
Summary: Nice location. Bring slippers the floors are tile. Breakfast, ey nothing to write home about. Silly things I noticed were there is no light over the bathroom mirror and no task light at the desk so I literally put my make up on with the flashlight on my phone. The building is old, the decor is worn out. The elevator is broken. It does have free underground parking. They need to upgrade their system, they take a carbon copy of your CC. I tried to find out what they did with it after I (and everyone else) left but couldnt get a straight answer. Seems very unsafe to me with identity theft being so popular. I probably wont stay here again unless Im going JUST to be at the beach.

The elevator did not work.  There was a toilet failure.  The breakfast was terrible.  No door locks for the building; anyone can walk into the hallways.  This was very disappointing.  The location is nice (by a beautiful beach) but the hotel is poor.  Lots of traffic noise.

We've stayed at the location for years and love it! You can't be the location to the beach, free parking, and free breakfast. Our only concern this trip was that the homeless population has seemed to increase and they hang out close to the hotel parking area and use the parking garage at night to camp out. This is one reason why we may not choose this location again. The entire back part of the parking garage was used as a camp for about 10+ people and their tents and belongings.

I stayed here for 5 days. Lets start with the good... Location to beach is 200ft walk away from beach. Room was clean, bathroom has a wonderful shower that was easy to use, I personally liked the breakfast room and options they had even though they didn't have eggs or bacon as options but they did have an easy to use waffle maker. the bad... Broken elevator, homeless sleeping in the under parking lot that smelled of urine, homeless hanging around the Sunset beach wall, other then the rooms the hallways and exterior need some updating, room facing street can be bothersome, the tv's are HD put the cable box is outdated and does not have HD channels and have to use two remotes to control TV on/off and the other the cable box. For the price your getting a nice room and very easy

The hotel is conveniently located to the beach.  The parking garage had a horrible urine smell to it, the elevator was out of order and the hallways/stairwells need an upgrade.  We requested an ocean view room and could not be disappointed by the view we had...our balcony even came with a table and chairs which made watching the sunrise very comfortable to sit and enjoy.  Will definitely consider staying here again when we are back in town

Love the view, was very convenient walk to the beach. Lots of food chooces surrounding property. Room was clean, beds could use an update as they were squeaky..like metal scraping. Will definitely be staying there in the future as it is a 2 minute walk to the beach.

I would not stay here again it was not clean and many items needed attention. Things in the bathroom were not in proper working order and appearance was not good. Elevator needs to be fixed, as well as the Front door leading out to the main street. It doesn't stay closed.

Exterior needs some TLC but the rooms were clean.  The elevator was out but it only has 3 floors so it was not too bad.  The interior of the lobby and hallways need to be updated and the access doors from outside to inside need to be repaired.  The location is a 10!

I like the location of this hotel its next to the state park where we attend a event every year. Its convenience of being able to walk right to the beach and the location of all the restaurants are easy to walk to.

It was a very nice hotel for what we paid. You could go out to the balcony which surprised me that it had one and see the beach from there. Also we had forgotten our toothpaste and thankfully they had some! Which is awesome! Overall great hotel would recommend.

The hotel is pretty dated but the room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff were amazingly kind, friendly, and accommodating. The location could not be better - a short walk to the beach, good restaurants near by, just thoroughly enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Not paying much, so don't expect much
Summary: The accommodations weren't horrible, but with the lowest price of locations actually on the beach, we were happy. The rooms, especially the bathrooms need a serious remodel and some new decor. The elevator was broken. For us, no problem, but upon check-in, because of that they offered us a free cancellation if we didn't want to stay. Like I said, no problem, but what if a disabled guest was staying, and couldn't even get up the first flight to the registration desk to even try to check in. The hotel doesn't have that many room. I would suggest calling guests to inform them of would could be a serious inconvenience.

The property was nasty carpet was sticky in room 212 had mold on the shower door and the room smelled like mildew. Security doors were broken and the elevator didn't work. the staff didn't speak very much english except the check in guy

The elevator never worked and I am handicapped.   The service was slow and the breakfast room wasnt stocked or clean.   The staff weren't very friendly,  overall it was a bad experience,    we have been here before but Wil not return.

I really didn't expect much for the price I paid. I needed a quick getaway for myself, so being that it was next to the beach and just needed a place to sleep, shower, etc..., I took a chance and glad I did. The parking is secure. The staff at check in was very pleasant and when I realized that I forgot my phone charger, they had one handy to lend me. Room was clean with a mini fridge and microwave. What really impressed me was the bathroom. It looks like it was recently remodeled and very clean. The hotel is basically on the beach with easy access. My room was on the PCH and a little noisy if you left the window open, but not so bad with it closed. Plenty of places to eat and drink within walking distance or a very short drive.

Great location.   I have stayed here before and liked it.  I am not sure if they have new management because a few things have changed since March.  They no longer have a microwave in the room and a few days we did not get our room clean but other then that it was all good.  Room is large a d clean location is wonderful.

Stayed in a upgraded room so that helped.  The breakfast was very basic but filled the hole.  The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.  They do need to keep the homeless out of the parking garage.

Summary Heading: Worst Place I have ever stayed
Summary: I have stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world and I have never checked into a hotel and checked right out as soon as I walked into the room I became itchy sorry for no photos I was only in there for ten minutes maybe. There were stains on the floor and it looked like an 80’s hotel room

This was our second year staying here.  The beach is right across the street from the hotel.  The area is away from all the hustle and bustle of Huntington beach.  4 great places to eat right across the street.  Parking is a non issue, always had a parking spot.  The front desk staff were super, friendly, met all of our needs.  Super Mex restaurant across the street has amazing food, our favorite spot when we stay here.  We will gladly come back for a third year!

Summary Heading: Great beach location for a great price
Summary: I like to stay here every time I visit Orange County. It's a small quiet hotel on the beach. You could go down the street to the main part of Huntington Beach and stay in one of the large resorts for twice the price and on the opposite side of PCH but that doesn't make much sense to do.

Summary Heading: Nice view but not nice hotel
Summary: Great view but it’s an old building and needs remodeling. The mattresses are not comfortable. The patio furniture should be updated instead of having plastic chairs. I think anything over $200 should be decent.

Summary Heading: Walk out the door to the beach
Summary: Exceeded expectation for a 2 star hotel booked online. You can literally step outside to the beach. Our only problem was it was 60 degrees in July and we had to wear jackets to do so! We recommend this hotel, would stay there again.

This is a true old beach hotel.  Located on the ocean side of PCH. There is only parking for 1 vehicle but it is free. Balcony room was great. This is not a fancy Hyatt type hotel. If you like the Hyatt or similiar type hotels then this is not the hotel for you.

Great place, friendly, clean, 2 minutes to the beach. 20 minutes to Knotts Berry Farm. Walking distance to places to eat. Park your car in underground parking. Would stay there again. Very pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Walk to the beach and  free breakfast!
Summary: Walk to the beach and continental breakfast are huge perks for travel with family! Staff was very nice too! Let my sister park there while she visited with us   on the beach. We will totally stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel right on the beach!
Summary: Great Service, nice size rooms, friendly staff. Hotel is basically on the beach, just inches from the sand. Great ocean view from your room. Walking distance to restaurants and bars. The Board walk is great for a nice bike ride to downtown HB.

Summary Heading: Best view around at a reasonable price
Summary: the ocean view is great and the proximity to the beach could not be better. No busy streets to cross, just a couple hundred feet and your toes are in the sand. The place is clean and havebeen recently upgraded since the last time I stayed, and the rooms are very quiet.

Location was super close to the beach.  Beds/pillow were Not comfortable.  Free breakfast was average.  Location overall was Super!!  I'm not too sure we'd stay there again but in a pinch it would be ok.  $$ was fair.  Staff was nice.

Summary Heading: Location is walkable to the Sunset beach.
Summary: Older as expected, but made up for it with location and balcony view of the water..   Sunset beach is walking distance and easy to find on the Pacific Coast Highway.   Clean and well staffed with any parking...smaller and well priced for this location

Although the beach area is very private and much less busy than those of downtown Huntington Beach and the price of the rooms are much more affordable I would not stay here. In fact we left early. I was very disappointed that the other reviews I read were actually not living up to what they said. Room was overall clean but run down and dark appearance. I barely slept for fear someone might come in my room. Dodgey.  Free parking and free Wi-Fi definitely not worth it.

WE booked this, Travelodge in Huntington Beach at Sunset Beach Park for 15,000 Wyndham points. We had requested two beds and when we checked in we asked for the second floor, as the hotel was right on the ocean. When we went up to the room it was on the street side. “Duh”! So I went back down and asked if we could get a room on the ocean side so we could watch the sunset. The desk clerk, Alfonso said he had one but he couldn’t give it to us because we’d booked through Wyndham. So I called Wyndham customer service, waited on the line for quite a while, finally got through, and they said they could refund the 15,000 points and we  could book again using them but they had to transfer me to the reservations desk; I had had to wait on the line again. It took over an hour for them to

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price!
Summary: The outside of the hotel looked old and dated but don’t let that fool you. The room looked to be newly remodeled and the balcony with an ocean view was awesome. Typical hotel breakfast but kids loved the waffles and all the different choices of food. It was a good price considering you can just walk out onto the beach!

It could have been worse. Very basic. Room was dark and dated. Bathroom was so tiny the toilet touched the bathtub. It was right along the beach, only a 2 minute walk. To be that close to the beach for what we paid, I think the price was reasonable.

It’s perfect location . Walk over to beach . Friendly environment. Than drove out to Long Beach aquarium for the day . Would definitely make a trip again to hotel since the beach is only yards away . Just for a getaway over  night

The hotel is a little outdated, but in the process of renovations.  It is very convenient to the beach and there are places to eat within walking distance.  I have stayed here numerous occassions and I really like staying here.  The staff is always friendly.

We stayed two nights and had a great time. The room was clean and updated. It had a beautiful view of the ocean with a private balcony. Breakfast was great for the kids. The beach was wide open as well.  The exterior of hotel is a little shabby, and some of the common areas could use a little TLC, but for $120 a night on the ocean, I'd say this place is a great value for families looking to for beach vacation on a budget.

Summary Heading: It's not even worth to even stay the night...
Summary: My friend and I slept there last night.  We couldn't get a view of the beach because it was during Spring break, but that it was an additional $50 to have an oceanfront view.  There wasn't much to see anyway.   We walked into our room, and the room smelled musty and it was stuffy inside.  We had to turn the A/C on.  The bathroom was small with the toilet and shower.  (The shower door wasn't working properly.  We had to call to have the maintenance come up to fix it.)  The hairdryer was super ancient from another time period.  The hotel room needs to be updated.   And when we tried to turn the TV on, we got no signal until we realized it was on the wrong channel in order for the cable to come on.  The breakfast wasn't the greatest either.  The traffic was very noisy on PCH, and

This motel was great.  It was so close to the beach it was almost attached to it!  We only stayed one night because we had a cruise out of Long Beach the next day, but we will be back for a longer stay.  We are so happy we found a great clean place. The room was clean, the bed comfy, and it had parking underneath the building.

It was ok.  For a beachfront hotel, it's worth it (ok, there's a parking lot between you and the beach).  The rooms were nice, but the beds were bad.  Get ocean front to avoid Pacific Coast Hwy noise.  Staff wasn't unfriendly, just not overly helpful on a couple of requests.

I loved the view from the room and hotel location.  Was a beautifully clear couple of days.  Wish I had had a bike to ride down the beach.  The sunrise was amazing as well and local restaurants are close enough to walk to. The riip brewery is a nicety to have across the street as well.

We have been coming here for over 20 years! It is nivmce that it is on the beach side and if you have an ocean view room you can sit on the balcony and drink coffee and watch the waves or watch the sunset in the evening!! It is just steps away from the beach!

I was here Jan 24 2018. Room smelled SOOO bad. Remotes didn't work. Mini fridge was essentially a prop and smelled horrifically inside. Outlet near bed would not hold a plug unless propped up. They literally just fell right out. Had to have windows open all night. The desk ignored me upon telling them. Literally ignored me. Too bad they don't capitalize on the location. Better off sleeping on the beach

Summary Heading: Great property close to the ocean.
Summary: Great value, basic hotel but very clean with friendly staff.It’s location is everything with the ocean steps away. Dont skimp on your room selection, pay the extra dollars for an ocean view room with a balcony. We enjoyed sitting out there with our morning coffee and evening sunsets.

The location was ideal. Traveling on business, I didn't have time to visit the ocean, therefore I stayed on the beach to squeeze in an hour before my work day and at the end.  This hotel also made great renovations and my stay was very comfortable.  The hotel's exterior is worn from being older as well as the salt water; but very easily overlooked due to other attributes.

Location is in need of a remodel.  Room was small and cramped, and had barely enough room to walk past the bed and tv/dresser.  Need better signing to direct to the parking area, due to having to park in the parking garage, then go upstairs to the check in desk.  It is an older building, and it shows.

By no means is this something to write home about.  The service was fine, the room was clean, there was a balcony with a view of the ocean, refrigerator, and microwave. Basic. The best part was that after a long day at Disneyland, the next morning my young daughter was thrilled to be by the beach!!

Cheap place to stay by the beach, close to the pier and good priced restaurants. Will stay here again . But if you want a 5 star hotel for a cheap price this is not for you . To stay in the beach every day, perfect hotel. It’s not busy and not crowded.

Can't beat this beach front property deal.  Has everything you want if you're looking for that getaway at the  beach with fun in the sun, and good, laid-back vibes.  Clean, tidy rooms with decent toiletries, and spacious, relaxing balconies.  I would come here again and again.

We stayed here for the Jeep bath 2018 perfect location to stay beach is right there and location to restaurants was perfect. The hotel could use an update but we will definitely be staying there next time Wish they had a hot tub

Summary Heading: There is only 1 reason to stay here...
Summary: The location. It's across the street from the beach, which is nice, but so many things wrong with this hotel I'd never stay here again. Across the street is a bus stop where multiple buses come and go all day and all night. The street itself is very busy, no peace and quiet anywhere. There was mold in our shower. The vanity light was not only missing, but the wires were exposed and sticking out of the wall. They quoted me $149/night, which when I left, ended up being $149 for the first night and $199 for each of the next 2 nights. The walls, doors and carpets were very dirty. Our room had a horrible musty smell. Will definitely stay somewhere else when we come back.

Great location! Right on the beach. Balcony looked out towards the beach. Bike path was right there so we rode to Huntington Pier. Staff was very nice and room was clean and everything seemed like the recently remodeled. View from our balcony.

Nice view of the ocean from the balcony. Lots of parking in the garage at the motel. It is a bit noisy because it is across the street from the bus stop. Within walking distance of a few restaurants. Few homeless people in the area.

The hotel was exactly how it was described.  We had a awesome view of the ocean across the street from the hotel.  Had easy access to the boardwalk to be able to ride our bikes.  My only issue was the running of the public transit bus stop that circled in from of the hotel.  I knew from reading prior reviews what to expect, but didn't realize just how noisy it would be all night.  Other than that, I would stay there again.

We love staying here, it is right across the street from the beach and close to so many restaurants. the rooms are comfortable and clean. the continental breakfast is just that a continental breakfast nothing fancy, but the food is fresh and the dining area has a nice atmosphere. the only problem is parking. we booked two rooms with 4 adults and 4 children, but could only get one parking space per room ( we had 3 vehicles). So my daughter had to drive around for over 30 minutes trying to find a safe place to park overnight on the street, that wouldn't get her car towed or stolen.  other then that this is a great place to stay.

We were blown away by how nice this place is! It is right on Sunset Beach. Our room was amazing. It was very clean and spacious. It has a large flat screen tv, upgraded mini fridge and microwave. The bed was pretty comfortable and we slept very well. I believe we had one of the renovated rooms so if possible, ask for one of those. The flooring has been updated to tile and the bathroom is super clean! For the price and the location alone this place is worth it. But adding in how clean it is exceeded our expectations. They also provide a pretty tasty continental breakfast and the customer service was great.

After reading review we almost cancelled our trip and I am so glad we didn't! I Was pleasantly surprised at the location, and the interior of the motel. Our room was clean and spacious. Parking was easy, and it was so convenient to be so close to the beach. For the price and location this is a steal! I did see a room with carpet so if possible ask for an upgrade no carpet room facing the beach. The pizza place and super Mex food places across the street is really yummy. Don't leave windows down in the parking structure, there is a hotel mascot raccoon that likes to go through the trashcans.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This is definitely an older, run down hotel. Firstly, the negatives. Rooms are very old and worn, carpet was sticky, I had my flip flops on the whole time, bathroom was so old and shower was stained with bathmat glued to the shower floor. Like another reviewer said it smelt very musty in the room and the bathroom was worse. The first thing I did was buy a couple of air fresheners and put them in the room. We were in Room 206 which is not a renovated room! I never saw a renovated room so ask for one when booking. The hairdryer attached to the wall was from the seventies. Seriously remove them, just a cheap hairdryer from Walmart would do the trick. We did have a very old, worn and dented bar fridge which looked 30 years old. Just upgrade with a newer cheaper one. It is the little

Summary Heading: Quirky Old Hotel, but what a location!
Summary: First of all the parking is great. Right under hotel, lots of spaces and you walk right up to the room. The rooms ar pretty roomy but very dated and worn. Interesting books and crannies all over common areas.  Unbelievable location, steps from the beach. Could not be more convenient. Also, great balconies facing water, where you can enjoy coffee in am and drinks at sunset.  Right across street are several very good local restaurants and a Circle K for convenience. Overall a great visit.

The hotel is right behind sunset beach. It is older but not dirty. My not as nice as our usual hotels but the location and ocean views made up for it. The musty smell was my biggest complaint. They need to get rid of the carpet and upgrade more of the dated furnishings.

Nothing extravagant, but a really nice spot.  Room was clean and did the trick. Across the street from Sunset Beach, and close to Sealegs on the beach if your looking for a drink.  We upgraded to the balcony with the ocean view for not a lot of extra money, and it was well worth it. Our room looked right out onto the beach .. well ... there is a street between you and the beach, and there is a bus stop right there, so it can be a little noisy, but again for a couple nights to be right across from the beach. It was just what we needed and within our price range.   Free parking is available, and we felt safe the whole time we were there.  You will need a car (or bus) to get to Huntington Beach, but we found street parking there for not too much money.

The location could not have been better! The rooms were nice and clean. The breakfast could have had a little more of a selection and the pillows were not that great, but over all I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Casual beach hotel and great location
Summary: Friendly staff, quiet room and great location! Easy in and out access, as well as access to walking distance from the beach and other local establishments. Highly recommended for the casual traveler! Great bang for the buck!

We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting family in Huntington Beach.  The hotel is older, but for staying at the beach, it probably the best value.  The free breakfast is mostly cold foods with waffles.  Parking is definately a problem, but after asking the manager for help, he provided a remedy - just double park.  All hotel parking is under the hotel and if you return late at night, all of the spaces will be gone on a busy weekend.  The manager showed us where to park and all was good. The rooms have been updated in the past and ours was fine.  We had a small balcony to sit on to watch the people on the beach, which was also fun.  Don't come for the room, come for the beach and just sleep in the room.

We had a great stay here.  Loved the location and being so close to the beach. The beach was clean and not too crowded. There are lifeguards and the sunsets are amazing.  Close to some restaurants that were really good but not far from Huntington Pier if you are looking for more action.  Recommend a balcony with ocean view.

This is our second year in a row to stay here. It is a WONDERFUL hotel!!! Right on the beach (you can walk to the beach from your room) -- FREE parking (which is $40/ night elsewhere); FREE breakfast (which would easily be $10-$15/person; no resort fee; and lots of extras conveniences!! It's quiet with an amazing owner who has been SO nice to us both times we stayed!!!

The location is great but the motel needs updating and hard surface floors in the rooms. Smoke alarm kept going off and at 12:30 am was just taken out. Not a place I would spend more than a day or so. Bathroom was extreamly small and needed updated. A few improvements would make it do much better.

We reserved a room with an ocean view. Although we did have an ocean view, we also had a view of the homeless people who camped out in the parking lot between the hotel and ocean. We made sure that we were in the room by dark.

Summary Heading: I would suggest you look on down the street there are better choices
Summary: Well let's get started the beds are shaped like an old horse they sag in the middle and if you decide to go to the bathroom you better put it in reverse and back in it is so narrow you can barely turn around in it the location is good as far as being close to the beach but the pictures on the front of the ad are extremely deceiving we showed up for one room that said it had a sofa and that is not the case it was strictly a king bed with a desk so we asked to upgrade I like I say if I had my choice I would have kept my money and went down the street and paid a little more but my room reservation was non-refundable

I stayed here for two nights last weekend.  It was awesome.  I would have liked a beachside room but I wasn't disappointed.  The room was well insulated and I hardly heard any road noise.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  It was right across from the beach.  I would definitely stay here again...

Room had traffic noise all night long this hotel is old the rooms are nice but there is a lack of care for the customers. The location is great the building is old and it shows. Do not waste your time on the joke of a breakfast they offer.

Close to the beach and food.  Weather is always nice.  200 is a lot to write, 200 is alot to write, 200 is a lot to write.  free parking.  beach has sand, a lotof sand. walking paths near beach.  200 letters is alot

Good place can’t beat the cost and it is right on the beach. Lots of history here. You get free breakfast. Nice clean rooms . Comfortable beds. Rooms are good size. Bathroom small. Lots to do in walking distance.

Summary Heading: Nice little motel on Sunset Beach.
Summary: This is an older motel that could use an update. However, everything was spotlessly clean and we were happy with our ocean view balcony room. Our only real complaint was that, on the first night we stayed, buses started pulling in right outside our window before 5:00am and the noise was astonishingly loud and unrelenting. It made sleep quite impossible. The next night was better. I would recommend requesting a room as far away from the bus stop as possible. The free breakfast was typical for this type of hotel. The hotel is almost right on the beach and this is a much quieter area than the really busy areas a few miles south.

Oceanfront Travelodge is close to Huntington Beach and all the action.  Sunset Beach is quiet and peaceful,  and we would definitely stay there again.  We attended a wedding in Huntington Beach and we were very happy with our accommodations.

Although the room had a good view it was very basic. We have two queen bed‘s and one of the beds/linens had to be changed to the hair on the pillow and sheets. Thank goodness we always bring our own pillows and possible .

Old smelly hotel room. $170 a night and it was a room I didn't want to sleep in. The room was from the 80s decor needs really updating infact pull the whole place down!. Smelt of damp, Tv old and only one channel viewable couldn't even plug my laptop into tv for more options.breakfast was terrible, inedible waffles and funny tasting orange juice. Never ever again, drive up road a little to Hampton inn same price much more luxurious.
Room 113, ocean view room, view blocked by city buses. Room was next to the entrance of the main hotel...heard the door being slammed all night long.

When I read all of the reviews I was worried. Taking my family on this trip had me a little scared about how this hotel would pan out. I was SO wrong to be worried. The location was amazing and the beach access was to die for. Our room was so nice. The staff was so helpful. Yes the outside of the hotel makes you a little worried but our room (223) was amazing. We had an amazing beach access room. The breakfast was awesome. Fresh made waffles and other fresh options. You really can’t beat this beach access.

Summary Heading: Fantastic view but only worth in summer
Summary: We were here in april ‘18. The floors were freezing cold and the air inside the room was so damp and moist. What I do appriciat was the view, rather new interior and cleaning. No madras for babycrib!?

Summary Heading: A bike ride with my granddaughter
Summary: we had a wonderful time . the place was clean safe and our needs were taking care of. we'll be back again, we were happy

Great location.  Our favorite place to stay.  Our secret while in the wall. They have a new breakfast area.  The inside is looking better then the outside now.  The backside of the building needs some paint.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for the price. It was the only way we could stay...
Summary: Good hotel for the price. It was the only way we could stay near the beach. The breakfast was great!

Check in and out was very easy. The facility was older and recently remodeled, but there are some things you just can't change. Being located in a coastal area the room was musty. The bathroom was dated and very small with an extremely low shower head. With that said, everything was very clean from the bathroom, room, hallways, breakfast area and parking area. Coffee and shampoo etc were refreshed daily. We had a large ocean view room with an extremely large balcony that would have been enjoyed by a family. We were thankful that we booked an ocean view because the PCH side would have been loud with traffic. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of seating. This hotel in in a good location with plenty of places to eat near by. This isn't the fanciest place in town, but the rates are

We loved this place! Don't know why there are any negative reviews. You get what you pay for! Sure this is an older property but there are clean rooms, continental breakfast, free fast wifi, and a free parking garage underneath the building. What more do you want? Our room had a private balcony with ocean view. Also many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Best part is you are steps from the beach. Was a little chilly for us to swim but we enjoyed walking the beach. We will be back in the warmer months ;)
Way overpriced hotel.that is rundown/dirty. You hear the traffic all night long. Couldn't even remotely see the ocean.

I truly cannot understand why there are so many positive reviews of this place. Our room was so gross we checked out after our first night.  It's a Travelodge, so it's not like we were expecting the Ritz. And we ignored the creepy dark stain in the carpet in the middle of the room, and the hair dryer from the 1920s that was attached to the wall and was like someone gently blowing in my face (took me 25 minutes to dry my hair).  We also ignored the hassle it took to ask for an extra pillow, and that there were no places to charge devices anywhere in the room. It's not like we were in Huntington Beach to sit in our hotel room.   But when the room filled with cigarette smoke around 3am and stayed filled with smoke through the next morning, that pushed us over the edge. They really

Summary Heading: Ocean View - Wish I could spend more time here!
Summary: We stayed here the night before our cruise at the end of February.   After a comfortable night, we enjoyed the continental breakfast and then went for a walk on the beach. I would recommend getting an ocean view room.

Summary Heading: As a Wyndham Rewards Gold member, I requested a late...
Summary: As a Wyndham Rewards Gold member, I requested a late check-out upon my check-in.  I was given the run-around by the hotel receptionists.  The receptionist during the check-in asked that I discuss with their daytime receptionist.  The daytime receptionist then asked that I discuss with the receptionist on my check-out day.  The receptionist was nowhere in sight to request a late check-out in the early morning of my check out day.  I ended up with no late check-out.

Summary Heading: We love this place it was so great right on the water it...
Summary: We love this place it was so great right on the water it was perfect we recommend this place over any other place in Huntington Beach it was fantastic

This hotel is not a fancy hotel it looks like it was built in the late 60's or early 70's.  The outside of the hotel and inside interior hallways are dated.  When we stayed at this hotel we stayed in a newly renovated room it was very spacious and clean.

Convenient for one time in town. We basically just slept in the room and were gone most of the stay. Bathroom was incredibly small. Didn't offer early check in upon arrival and there was no hot water when we decided to take showers in the morning. Very disappointed with water issue but reasonable price and close to ocean.

It's across the street from the ocean, so your balcony treats you to the sights and sounds of traffic, rather than soothing ocean waves. Also, the breakfast is very meager and should at least include some protein, even if only hard boiled eggs.

Beautiful location with simple and comfortable amenities. The internet was just slightly confusing to connect to, but it worked great. This is a central location to absolutely everything you need for a relaxing beach vacation.

Hotel is really close to the beach and also lots of shops and fast food places. The bed was comfortable but the room was very old fashioned. The carpet was dirty and felt very sticky. The shower was very low you had to bend your back quite far back to get your head under. The tv was rubbish, poor signal and wouldn’t even turn off. I think it’s overpriced and needs updating.
Good location, the hotel overall is a little weary looking but staff were very cordial and helpful.

This hotel is more about he location than the rooms. Seated right at the oceans front door, who could want anything more. The price is right for a decent room. I would definitely stay here again. This is just a basic room with a bathroom. It's not big, but when you stay on the beach, this should just be a place to sleep. The breakfast is decent and I feel overall, it was great. It is just your average hotel.
I would have to say we were pleasantly surprised how nice this hotel was. Every was nice and clean and had a great balcony/patio looking over the beach and ocean.  We would stay there again for sure.

Summary Heading: Nice and Close To The Beach
Summary: Very nice motel.  Clean with good service.  Very close to the beach.  I will definitely be back
The Travelodge is the place to stay when you want a great room for reasonable rate. Thank you so much for making our stay memorable.

What a great location! Close to the beach, restaurants, shopping and our destination, Disneyland! We had a wonderful stay in our comfortable room with a balcony and view of the ocean. Plenty of parking and the hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Not happy with reservation, charged for room before I arrived.
Summary: About an hour after making the reservation I checked the email from Wyndham to see if all was ok. I found that somehow the date was wrong , it showed that I booked the room 1 day prior to my arrival at the location, i.e. I was reserving for the next night but the email s date showed check in on the same date i.e. that the reservation was made. I immediately replied to the email saying that a mistake had been made [by the syxtem ?] and t please change the date. The next day I arrived to check in and was told that my credit card had already been charged for one night. When my wife and I explained that their was a mistake the man said we should have phoned him the night before And that he could only make a change if only a sfew hours had passed after the reservation and the phone

Rooms are average.  Very clean and the staff extremely friendly.  Best feature is the location of this hotel.  Steps from the beach.  Can sleep with the sliding door open on the patio and fall asleep to the waves.  Great value for ocean front hotel.  Easy parking. Close to down-town Huntington Beach.

Summary Heading: WE LOVE THIS PLACE. THE LOCATION, CONVIENENT TO GREAT RESURANTS SHOPPING,  THE VIEW  OF THE BIG BEAUTIFUL OCEAN :)
Summary: The title says it all.. enjoyed everything and everybody connected with this travel lodge. We have been more than once and its always clean and friendly and comfortable. The friendly competent front desk, the housekeeping staff, friendly and accommodating, The Continental breakfast ladies that take care of a large open breakfast room are nice and their breakfast Fun with a make your own waffles machine if y feel like a waffle :) ... And  If you don't there is plenty of other choices. Fresh fruit,  milk,   juice, coffee,  tea, , cereal,  bagels,  toast,  Yogurt ... and all the goodies that go with em  real butter, cream cheese,  jellies .. even  peanut butter. Not fancy just for us wonderfuly clean and comfortable. Try it.

The service was ok... Room was fine with beach/ocean view except toilet backed up on first use so they provided us with plunger that did not fix the problem and created a mess on floor so they moved us next door. The location is great, near restaurants and pacific coast hwy. The breakfast did not include any fruits only carbs like cereal, breads and waffles. We there for a local hockey tournament and needed to shower after game but were not allowed late checkout and extra 30 min is all we needed. Computer did not work... The best thing is the location, 2 min walking from room to beach.

This property is better than all other Travelodges I visited before. It still felt like a 2 to 2.5 star motel but the room was clean and the wood floor (not carpet) was a smart choice. We paid 50% more for an ocean-view room and it did not disappoint us. The motel was very close to the beach. The only problem was that I could hear people talking and singing in neighboring balcony the whole night way past midnight. Luckily we were tired so we could sleep amidst the noise.
twin queen size room was large enough for four adult. had a nice ocean view balcony. room was cleaned, area secured, free parking under hotel, nice breakfast.

Not a fancy hotel by any stretch.Just a simple beach hotel with free parking. We watched the sunset right on the beach while dolphins played and the ships went into Long Beach.    Had a room on the street which wasn't as noisy as we had thought. Generally not bad. We skipped the breakfast. It didn't smell great. Maybe someone had been fishing that morning, but still.  I paid about $113 for the night. Seemed fair.
The location was great.... walked straight to the beach.  The price was decent to stay for the two nights we were there.  The room are lil outdated but didnt bother us....

The room was big, I loved the ocean view from balcony, comfortable beds, I just wish blankets were warmer as I like the room ice cold, AC worked great, walk to beach overall a beautiful room, can't wait to stay again.

Summary Heading: Hotel just needs a updated paint job. Inside and out. It is...
Summary: Hotel just needs a updated paint job. Inside and out. It is right on the beach and close to plenty of restaurants and bars.

Summary Heading: outside maybe a 4, inside 7.  I will stay there again and take my grandkids
Summary: The pictures are better than the real thing as far as the exterior is concerned.  Inside the rooms are very nice, very clean, my room had a bathtub which is always a plus.  In this case the stopper for the tub didn't work but that was ok because everything else was a pleasant surprise.  Wow, a place to park included right next to the beach.  That alone is almost worth the price of the room.  The staff was very polite.  The room was cleaned well during the day.   The parking was semi secure but had no problems.  They have cameras in the covered garage.  Next door the Jack in the Box didn't smell very good so I went back to the hotel and had their waffles, yogurt, cereal, bagels, muffins, real orange juice.  Again very clean.  I will stay there again and take my grandkids

I was in a corner room with so much much noise coming from outside. Buses passing by every 15 to 20 minutes, lots of traffic and people talking loud not the mention I was right next door to Jack in the box and could hear people in the drive thru ordering their food. I didn't get much sleep.My refrigerator was not working and they had to send the maintenance guy to replace it with a new one. When I asked for another room they said they were booked up. The only reason Im giving 2 starts is because the room was updated and no smoking. I will not be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Great location, hotel needs some work.
Summary: The location is awesome!  However, the interior of the hotel is pretty ichy.  Plus we had an issue with our tv not working the first night.  It was really late and we wanted to watch a few minutes before bed.  The man on duty came down and "fiddled" with it for a very long time before getting a new box which he still could not get working.  No apology.  He just said that someone would be in the next day.  Someone else came in the next day and fixed it, but it wasn't great having someone in our room for so long that late at night.

This hotel was a great place to stay while we were on Vacation at Huntington Beach, CA. Walk across the parking lot and you are on a beautiful beach. Our room had an extremely comfortable King bed. The room had a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  The room was large as well. They have a continental breakfast every morning offering waffles, cereal, coffee, juice, fresh fruit, etc. The staff was very friendly too! We stayed here because of the location being close to many Southern California locations that we visited. You can pay more, but why? Enjoyed the stay!!
You can't beat the location and the ocean view. At night you can fall asleep listening to the waves. It's clean too. I think that's enough said.

Summary Heading: A Day and Night at the Beach
Summary: I like this motel. Its on the beach and close to Huntington Beach and Seal Beach. Its close to restaurants and bars. The staff is very helpful in setting up the accommodations I've asked for. I'll be back.

We stayed on the first floor ocean view that had 2 queen beds and was very spacious with a large balcony (divided by a sort of wall but you can say it was a shared balcony with the room next door). The room had a mini fridge that was super old and a super old wall installed hair dryer that is probably the original from when the lodge was first built lol. It was outdated yes but right across from Sunset Beach which made up for it I guess. The included breakfast consisted of waffles, yogurt, fruit, toast/bagels, cereal, coffee and juice. The breakfast area was up to date and looked very modern compared to the rest of the lodge. Overall this place sufficed for our short getaway this summer and even better we didn't pay a cent since we used our points for free nights. It was

Summary Heading: Being  a Wyndham Rewards member I expected an Ocean View .
Summary: We reserved our free stay here. I thought we would have a view of the Ocean. Instead we were at the last room on the 2nd floor with a street view.  We were very disappointed about not having an Ocean view. When asked about it we were told it was a free stay even after we were willing to pay for an Ocean view room. We were brushed off. Otherwise the stay was ok

Summary Heading: The staff was great, the hotel was clean and they were able to assist me with my questions
Summary: Very clean. Staff was great.  Good continental breakfast, i.e., bagels, waffles,  cereal.  Location is right next to beach.  Great scenic walk to pier.

Nothing like being at the beach for a short getaway! We stay here annually for our anniversary and always have a ton of fun at the beach... the hotel makes it that much easier to enjoy. Its not perfect (e.g., this year, there was giant stain in the curtain and hold in blanket), but good enough!
Best location for sunset beach.  Great balcony view of the ocean!  Very friendly staff and easy parking. We will be back :-)
The room smelled nasty and it was extremely dirty!  The beach is right across the street but the price and the dirt was not worth it!

The room we had was an ocean view 2 bed suite. The view and the balcony was great; but the room itself definitely needs some upgrades. The entire room was out dated, and the shower was extremely short and uncomfortable to use.

The lodge is deceptive from the outside.  The rooms are very nicely remodeled, with tile and glass bathrooms.  Everything was clean and well maintained.  The only thing I wish is that the check out time could be a little more flexible.  Since it is on the beach, 11am is hard to do.  Will definitely stay here again.

I loved everything about this hotel, the prices are just right, the receptionist had great service and always helped me out when I needed something. I got the room with my balcony having the view of the beautiful ocean. I will go there again.
The room was old and dark. Lights didn't work in the bathroom. Carpet was disgusting. I won't stay there again. The only good thing about this property was the breakfast.

Summary Heading: Good location but that's about it.
Summary: Great location, right on the beach. But our room was very old and appeared dirty. The air conditioning wasn't on when we checked in so the room was hot. The bathroom was very tiny. Shower head was extremely low. Front door didn't always lock. We were extremely concerned about the cleanliness of the beds. Luckily had to stay there for one night!

The room was small but sufficient, very clean,  and nicely remodeled.  It goes without saying that the area is nice and the hotel is walking distance to restaurants, as well as being moderately priced for beachside.  The reception area and halls are plain (old hotel) but clean and the breakfast room was nice.

Summary Heading: Don't Judge a Book by It's Cover!!!
Summary: Do Not let the outside of the building fool you. We had a GREAT experience!! We asked for a renovated room (we paid for ocean front) and our room was Amazing!! The FREE parking and FREE breakfast was well worth it!!! Anywhere else... those two together would easily add another $100-$150/night!! The convenience of this hotel is AMAZING!!! You walk right out of the building, across the driveway... and you're on the beach!! We could even sit on our balcony and watch out kids on the beach. Nights were quiet and we had no noise problems what-so-ever!!! The hotel staff was more than helpful with anything that we asked. The computer was broken and Nazim even printed our boarding passes for us!!! The lighting in the bathroom is a little dark -- and when they remodeled they didn't put

I stayed here for free with my Wyndham rewards points, it has great access to the beach which was my main point for choosing it. The only problem was that the underground parking is only up to 6 feet! There is no where else to park, you can only park at the beach til 10. The clerk told me I could try to ask the AmPm across the street if we could park there,No where did I read about parking and google maps shows a parking lot adjacent to the travelodge which is really the beach lot So it was my 28th anniversary and I stayed while my husband went home, I did not want to lose my Wyndham points which were not refundable , Also internet did not work at all,and breakfast was a waffle iron, cereal, milk juice coffee toast blueberry muffins and oranges, slim pickings even though it was

Summary Heading: Great location.  Hotel showed its age
Summary: Great location by beach. Hotel showed it's age.  The from we were in smelled very musty.  The bathroom wasting and very narrow.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Summary Heading: Rate promised by Booking.com was not honored.
Summary: The hotel was great.  However, Booking.com offered the room at $159 (before taxes) and I was charged at a rate of $210 (before taxes).  The owner said he didn't know what I was talking about when I told him it was supposed to be another rate.  Booking.com did not include a proof of the price I booked at in my email, so I didn't have a way to argue it.  However, I looked up the room again and it's still being offered at the lower rate.  I blame booking.com, but of course there's no way to contact the host to complain.

Location is great! Price per day for the room we'd stayed in, not so great. It's old, smells old, and rarely vacuum. Internet only works with an Android. Wasn't able to connect with an Iphone due to WiFi's low security.

The carpet really needs to be removed from the rooms.  I rented three rooms for my family.  After showering our kids, their feet were black within 30 minutes from the carpet.  The location is perfect though. I can see that they are remodeling some of the guest rooms to include tile floors, we were just not fortunate enough to get any of them. I have stayed several times in the past and did have remodeled rooms.  If I had known ahead of time that they weren't all remodeled, I would have requested them.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Newly Renovated Room and as always Fantastic Staff!
Summary: Don't let the outside exterior turn you away, this place has the best ocean views and  5 star service. We have been visiting this establishment every year for the past 12 or more years. Yes one year we tried a new spot down the street, it was not even close in comfort or the service we receive at this Travelodge. The room we stayed in on this visit was newly remodeled to excellence. The Breakfast  the  would do better to have a few more choices, adding more fruit would be nice for those who have food allergies.

My parents and daughter enjoyed a nice stay here in one of the ocean view rooms. There's a Subway across the street and Jack in the Box next door for easy eats when spending the day at the beach. The rooms could use a little updating - a few more easily accessible outlets near the beds for cell phones/laptops would have been nice. The bathroom was kind of tiny and dimly lit, but the room was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

When we drove up it was a little scary.  The outside is very rundown.  When we walked in it wasn't much better.  We had 4 renovated rooms and two not yet renovated.  The two not renovated were very nice.  They were very clean and had nice bedding, lots of room and and bathroom  clean.  The renovated were very nice and clean.  Had tile that looked like wood on the floor.  We had three balcony rooms that looked at the ocean.  My husband is disabled and loved sitting on the balcony watching people and the ocean.  We loved the ocean and our family spent a lot of time at the beach.  There were 24 of us.  We chose this hotel because it was right on the beach.  Now for the bad part.  The desk people were very rude and mixed up our bills.  I was charged twice and my son not at all.

Yes, the hotel is right on the beach, which is fantastic.  But it's so run down and the service is subpar, so I wouldn't return.  Our AC didn't work and the room was muggy -- my glasses kept fogging up as I sat on my bed.  Tile covered the floor, which some people prefer, but it became sprinkled with sand as we came from the beach and then it was just gross to walk on it.  There was no tub, which made cleaning our little kids difficult.  Our room had been remodeled somewhat; however, the rest of the hotel was so outdated and dumpy and dirty.  The front desk manager was snippy when we asked for an early check-in at 1 pm so our baby could nap.  And he promised to call me when the room was ready but didn't and then ignored me when I came back at the 3 pm check-in time.  He really

Horrible experience.  I knew that this was going to be a so so motel but the location was excellent!  The desk clerk at check was unfriendly to the point of being rude!  We asked for extra pillows and we denied. Asked for towells and were treated like children and were told not to use them at the beach! For gods sake there were 4 of us in this room.  The bathroom had a barn door mounted on the outside so there was no privacy while using it.  We opted to use the bathroom down the hall which was filthy!   Could not wait to check out!

The building is dated. The ocean view rooms seem like the first one being renovated. The price we'd paid is nothing to compare to "high end" hotel(s) nearby. This is the closest chain hotel where the beach is within few feet compare to those "nice hotel." Our room was large and neat but not thoroughly clean. It was dark requiring more lights. During our week of stay, only once was vacuumed. Before we leave our room for the day, we tidy it up by ensuring our thrash is inside the thrash can, soiled towels are bunched up into one for easy pick up, and our stuffs are out of sight for "easy" clean up by the housekeeper. What we expected when we come back was our old and smelly room carpet get vacuum everyday...beach sand and others. We even put a room deodorizer to control the smell.

We absolutely love staying at the Travelodge in Sunset Beach. The staff is always friendly and the rooms are kept in great condition. The location is second to none as you are across the parking lot from the beach. We have been coming here for years and will be coming back for years to come!
Accomodating staff in a great location mere steps from the sand. Rooms are recently redecorated and sufficient  Dining choices are varied and very nearby.

Summary Heading: Travelodge Ocean Front at Sunset Beach CA in mid-July
Summary: Quality and service at this hotel are just above those of a motel. The total cost for 1 ocean view room (across a parking lot) with 2 double beds is a little less than $1000 for 4 nights that was booked 4 months ahead of stay.  Could be more expensive if booked later!

Summary Heading: July stay at Travelodge Sunset Beach.
Summary: We had the most amazing stay. The room was super, albeit a bit noisy facing the street but bearable. The breakfast was adequate, the beds were extremely comfortable. The room was cleaned daily to our satisfaction. Proximity to the beach and ameneties was fantastic. Would definately return.

We stayed here for 2 nighrs and love the location. We enjoyed our dinner overlooking the beach.  Then it's a bonus to eat  good complimentary  breakfast-waffles, yogurt, muffins, cereals, fruits and coffee every morning.  What a treat!

We came for the horseshoe tourney. Hotel was right next to beach. We reserved room for 3 days at a good rate of 210$. We wanted to stay an extra night. We were charged almost 300$ for extra day. Front desk claimed it was because of occupancy. There were more people there Friday thru Sunday than tthat extra day on Monday. Also the beds were like sleeping on a wooden box spring.

Summary Heading: Had a nice stay here with the grandkids.  Plan on another visit soon.
Summary: Although this hotel is older, we still come back because it's so close to the beach, and with little ones with us, it's much easier getting to the sand and ocean without  a huge hassle.  We've stayed at this hotel several times.  We enjoy it.

The location can't be beat. The room we stayed in had tile floors, a fridge & microwave. The gentleman that checked us in was very friendly as was the housekeeping staff. The main areas were a little outdated but clean. The continental breakfast was standard but also had waffles. I couldn't connect to the wi-fi because of the non-secure network. Nothing fancy but perfect if you want to be across the street from the beach.

Summary Heading: Outside not so nice, but good rooms
Summary: This hotel is all about location.  We stayed her after attending a wedding across PCH at the yacht club. There aren't a lot of options in Sunset Beach that don't look completely run down.  Parking below the hotel was included in the rate which is nice because otherwise it's a nightmare in that area.  The hallway definitely needs some updating and had a strange smell so as we headed to the room I was starting to get a little frightened.    I was pleasantly surprised to find the room had been somewhat updated with laminate flooring instead of gross carpet and the bathroom was bright and clean. Our room had a patio facing the ocean which was just steps away, but was also right on the corner above the Jack in the Box drive thru so we had a lot of noise until well after midnight.

Hotel was about as close to the beach as you can get.  Hotel is older, but like others have said, the room was updated and clean. I wasn't a fan of the sliding bathroom door. Not sure if all the rooms have that. Seems like it might have been a space issue.  I would stay here again.

To offset the cost of a nearby resort, we also booked this Travelodge location, BIG MISTAKE This location needs to be totally redone. The hotel is in awful shape - it smells, the room finish-out is poor and I felt that I could easily be robbed (or the car would be vandalized). I am not being dramatic. So bad that in less than an hour, I checked OUT of the hotel after negotiating a deal to RETURN to the other hotel for the rest of our stay.  Travelodge: this location needs to be removed from your rotation

Summary Heading: Dogs Barked all Night next door,and whats the smell today?
Summary: Stayed in Room 203 June19-24*.  Problems  #1- ROOM TYPE: No Ocean Veiw room  is an extra 160.00 for the week! #2-ATMOSPHERE: What is that weird odor-(changed everyday) #3- NOISE:Right out side our Window was the roof of a Tattoo shop where two white Pit bulls barked non stop ,I complained the reply "I have been here 17 years and No one has ever complained about dogs barking" and " I wont call the police , but you can"  #4-DAMAGED WALL: wall had water damage and they were replacing the roof while we were there. #5  FLOOR:Carpet had burns from the iron on it. #6 -BATHROOM:The shower head was so low it was almost comical. #7-PARKING: Caution to passenger cars with lower ground clearance on entry and exit. very hard if you have a low car.My BMW just barely cleared it! #8-CUSTOMER

We stayed 2 nights. Great location to the beach and the rooms were very nice. Couldn't get the TV to work but no one was ever around for help. It was like no one worked there. No one ever came to the room after the first night to get towels, clean up, soap , etc.. Couldn't find anyone

Nice location right near beach with beach view. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Good value overall. Hotel is just really warm down and old looking. Needs some serious upkeep. Our room was by the glass door entrance and it banged all day and night as guest entered. Friendly staff but service was pretty slow. Worth staying and enjoying ocean and restaurants just don't expect much and you will be fine.

Every time I come to the LA area I stay at this travelodge it's always clean and has a nice view of the beach and is really close which I really like their new breakfast program is far better than it has ever been only problem I had with this stay that I never had before was this time I needed to pay cash this time but was told there was a large fee if I was to pay cash and the gentleman running the check in had quite an attitude when I asked to pay cash then to top it off when I asked if there was any upper level rooms available was given another attitude filled "nope" but other than the check in experience everything else was great check out was smooth and that gentleman answered all the questions I had even with my rewards points will definitely continue to stay here

My boyfriend and I had a view of the ocean which was nice. The only thing I would say is that breakfast can use more options and to make sure the waffle maker is always filled. Breakfast doesn't end until 10 but the waffle machine was empty by 9:30 and no one came to re fill it.

Summary Heading: Inside is better than the outside!
Summary: I used to live close by to this property and always thought it looked a little dumpy from the outside. On a recent visit to HB I really wanted to stay on the beach and for the price I couldn't pass up this run down hotel. I was so pleasantly surprised with the updated and beautful rooms as well as the lovely breakfast space. On a whim I booked a second night, but had to move to an older room. The room was still fine, but definitely needs the updates that are coming. The whole hotel will be getting a facelift, but don't let the outside deter you from staying at this place which is almost directly on one of the nicest and quietest braces in HB. Service and GM were exceptional.
Hotel is super outdated, did not match online description, smelled moldy, looked dingy......overpriced!!!

The room was clean and so were the beds and linens. They just replaced the carpet with tile in the rooms but really need to paint and repair the walls too. They have an area now for breakfast but the selection is very small. The beach access is great. As for the updates they still have a way to go to get rid of that tired rundown hotel feeling. The staff is not the most attentive. Always had to wait for someone to appear at the check in counter.

If you want a cheap place to stay close to the beach this is the place. It wasn't very clean and the wallpaper was coming off in some spots. There wasn't a variety of food selection for breakfast. It was just okay.

Ugly. Rundown. Old. Horrible. Will never come back.   Elevator is useless. Looks abandoned.  Should cost half what it does. Are all Travelodge this bad?  Receptionist cold and impersonal.  Close to the beach but feels like a highway motel.

Summary Heading: We really enjoyed our stay, extending it an extra night...
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay, extending it an extra night! Great location, very nice room. The staff was friendly. The only thing that could be improved was the quality of the food at breakfast.
Its a great location, but it is an old hotel and is in drastic need of a renovation. All in all if you looking for a place to sleep with nothing fancy, this is a good place to stay.

The hotel was clean and good location.  But we were on first floor and could hear everything from room above.  Sounded like people fell out of bed... Loud thump ... Maybe Dropped the soap several time ... Loud thump.  You could hear them dropping stuff.

The room was dirty. Looked like there were small bugs beneath the sheets. My wife broke out in hives having been in the room for only 30 mins. I lodged a complaint with the manager and insisted I pay for the room having only been there for only a few minutes. STEER CLEAR.
