Summary Heading: Great price for right near the ocean.
Summary: This hotel is pretty old but they are working on renovating it.  We had a renovated room with a deck facing the ocean.  Breakfast was very good but there were not many tv channels so with little kids that might be a problem.  They do have free wifi though.

Summary Heading: Skip this place for buisness travel
Summary: Located on PCH, beach access is great, traffic noise is unacceptable. A request for a room not facing PCH will result in an answer of "Sure that's  $30.00 more per night" what a  BS policy. The place was probably built in the Sixties and it shows.

We stayed at your resort, the parking garage is kinda dark and there is a large drain area there and it was over filled with gross dirty water, there was no sign to warn of a wet floor, My step mother slipped and fell into the gross water, 2 of your workers saw it happen and then when we told your deskclerk he stated and I quote " Maybe she should not have stepped in the water". Not is she ok or anything. Then when I called to speak to the manager this is how the conversation went. I called and asked for the managers info, the person I was speaking to gave me the manager's name and then I asked for his number, he said to call the same one I just called so I then asked , well then is the manager there, he asked what is it about, I proceeded to tell him it was about a fall and

I was a bit skeptical about this property based on some of the reviews and pictures on here...but it is awesome! We took the chance and got a king room with ocean view which turned out to be a newly remodeled room. Great view of the ocean. Literally a stone's throw away from the beach. Balcony has a little patio table and chairs. Sliding glass door, lighted mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot, hairdryer, desk/chair, huge closet lots of mirrors. Nice bathroom, very spacious. Modern bedding/curtains and hardwood floor. Located right next to a Jack in the Box, gas station across the street, Subway, Taco place and Mr B's Liquor store. Everything you need for a couples/friends/party vacation. Coin laundry place a mile away. We had our reservation for 2 days and ended up staying 5

Summary Heading: Great views & easy access to the beach
Summary: Our family stayed here in May for Memorial Day weekend and loved it. It's nothing fancy- just a basic hotel but had easy access to the beach without crossing any main roads. The staff was friendly and breakfast was great!

We have stayed here a few times each summer. Some of the rooms are remodeled but the one we got last weekend was not no AC/heat ,paint peeling in bath room. We like it here the beach is right there and very big also a great place to start bike rides.

Spent a night . Stayed in a updated room . Was nice , not sure what older rooms look like . Looks like crap from the outside and kinda old interior . Breakfast room was nice , food basic but it's free so not complaining. Close driving distance to the Huntington pier. Right across from the beach but it was not the best beach , lots of garbage .  I would not recommend staying more for one night . Maybe stay closer to the pier ? All staff we met were nice
Room smelled of mildew. Very outdated furnishings. Uncomfortable mattress.  Not a bargain by any means. I'll never go back. Ever.
We loved staying here the few times that we have. Great pricing and value for the location. We love the ocean view and will be back soon.

Not moden. Shower didn't work. Toilet horrid. Rooms very dark. Charged for 2 nights, booked for 1. Aircon old/loud. Door rattled all night. Tv didn't work. Extremely RUDE manager. Book any other hotel

Summary Heading: When we arrived at the  hotel we didn't see any other guest...
Summary: When we arrived at the  hotel we didn't see any other guest  it was kind of creepy.   The location was great right next to the beach

Summary Heading: Great Location......average service and average accommodation.
Summary: This hotel has a great location. It is odd that they have not upgraded to get more travelers. The bathrooms are below acceptable. I felt like it might have been a closet at one time. Carpets are worrisome, as they are stained and dirty. Beds were pretty comfortable, and you  Can't say enough about location.
Everything was good except the electric plugs do not hold the electronic chargers well. Mine kept fall out of socket. So my phone did not charge the first night.

Exterior of building is very much in need of paint and updating.  The rooms were much better than expected when we checked in.   Hotel was very overpriced.  Have paid less than that at a Resort on the beach in Florida.

The staff at this Travelodge was very friendly, very helpful. The room was nice, clean, and very comfortable. I highly recommend the rooms facing the ocean as the traffic on the other side stays quite busy. I will definitely stay at this hotel again on my trips to this area. Easy access to everything.

After driving all night to take husband to UCLA med. and then driving to huntington and after waiting for LARGE group of teens to check in almost 30 minutes, we had tried to book online it kept kicking us out. So at midnight afer 30 minutes waiting in a very aged stairwell/lobby.  Stood thru entire check in process (with him holding my credit card and id) only to go to pay and OH no chip no check in their machine wont run anything but Chip readers!  He tosses my cards back at me and smirks, i ask if I can pay cash, since my husband and kids were already unloading in the scary underground parking, he said fine but its a $300 deposit plus $200+ for NOT the room that I was trying to book and still showed avail. online!  So because their machine wont take my normal card I had to put

Summary Heading: It was a wonderful time!  I would recommend it to anyone...
Summary: It was a wonderful time!  I would recommend it to anyone and everyone !  Very quiet!  Good places to eat both directions !
For the price and area I wasn't expecting a whole lot. The hotel lost power and I was glad I used my phone as a back up alarm.

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by it's cover
Summary: When we first pulled up, we were wondering what we had in store.  The outside appearance of the hotel is poor at best.  But, we had booked the room using Wyndham points and decided since it was not costing anything to go ahead and check in.  The end of the hotel next to the Jack in the Box had an unobstructed view of the beach.  The other end looked out on a parking lot and some homes.  We opted for Jack in the Box.   We spent an hour or more sitting on the balcony, people watching.  The Orange County buses pull into the cul-de-sac regularly for the drivers to take a potty break at Jack in the Box.  Bolsa Chica State Beach begins just across the street, and the was a constant flow of people jogging, riding bikes, surfers and dog walkers going both directions.  Also, there was a
This place is a little dated. But for the price and location not bad.no frills just good location in relation to beach.
Everything was VERY dated.  A lot of sand in the stairwells too.  The tub had a slider door for the slower that made it difficult to get the kids in the tub and the elevator was downright scary.
Outside needs work however, the rooms were immaculate and for the price and location you CNNOT go wrong

Nice hotel located on an awesome spot right next to the beach! Right next to a jack in the box opened 24hrs and adjacent to a small shopping plaza. Great location, only thing is that its only cheap during the week.
Very dingy, dirty hotel. The only reason to recommend it woul be it's easy accessibility to the beach. Otherwise it was creepy and depressing.

Summary Heading: Hire someone who knows customer service please
Summary: The customer service rep is not helpful in fixing problems regarding computer and printers. He is probably tired of his job or perhaps he is overweight that he cannot move much or walk to the see what was going on with the computer and why it is not printing. About the breakfast do not offer anymore if you cannot offer the best or better.
This hotel was great! Nice clean rooms and bathrooms, tile floors, comfortable beds and a good breakfast! The location was amazing, a quick walk to the beach! We will stay here again!
Right on the ocean. You can set in the small balcony and take your breakfast. Excellent parking.   Other than that a motel style facility.   We will come back for th location and price

The Travelodge at the Ocean Front is a hotel with a nice view and location at Huntington-Beach. The service is good but the price is a little bit expensive because the rooms and furniture are a few years too old and it would be good to renew something's.

This hotel looks a little rough on the outside.  But it was fabulous on the inside.  I had a king oceanview and it has just been newly renovated and was facing the ocean.  I left the balcony door open and heard waves all night.  The beach is literally steps away from the hotel.  For the price - the location is amazing.  The bike and walking path run right in front of the hotel.  The people were nice.  For the type of hotel it is - I gave it the highest rating.  Is it the Biltmore?  No - but I wasn't paying for the Biltmore.  Drawback was waiting to check-In or talk to the front desk (but they were very helpful when it was your turn) no bathtub and I did have a little trouble with the internet.

Hotel is old and in need of some upgrading. We stayed there just to sleep but the oceanview room with a balcony was great. The bathroom was very small. couldn't hardly even dry off and get dressed in it. beds were ok. nothing fancy but the ocean is right there. If you're hungry there is a jack in the box right next door. I wasn't really happy with the check out process because I wanted to pay cash for our room but they had put it through on my credit card even though they said they wouldn't. At checkout he said it would take up to 2 weeks to credit my card back so I just left it on there. not a biggy but they didn't do as I had asked. I don't know why hotels in Vegas can hold on a card and they you can pay cash and there is no charge to your credit card. ??

Summary Heading: Very Nice Room with a great view
Summary: Room had a balcony with an awesome view of the Beach. I could have soaked int he views for days.
Staff was very friendly. Updated rooms on main floor were very nice. Would recommend this hotel. The breakfast bar was very good as well.Internet was not consistent but okay.

Great location,  friendly staff,  big room. .. But, room was smelly,  carpet was filthy, bathroom very small, continental breakfast was carbohydrates, lack of some protein  ... we would have stayed longer than the 1 night if the room / carpet would have been clean

Summary Heading: If it wasnt for the location I would have left after checking in.
Summary: The only reason I stayed was because my whole trip was planned out in the area and the hotel was on the beach.  My family only spent about 9 or 10 hours in the room, mostly for sleep.  There were stains and rips in the carpet, it smelled old, like wet dog. The furniture looked 30 years old, the bed was too hard, and i Like a firm bed, the bed was loud and squeaky.  The whole place looked like it sat for 20 years and they just opened it up a week ago.  There were some nasty hairs on our towels when we got there. WTH!! We traded them for new ones.

I took a chance on this property in spite of a few bad reviews.  I found the room itself to be large, clean, and comfortable.  We stayed in an Oceanview Room and it was TOTALLY worth the upgrade!  We had a balcony with seating looking over the ocean.  Out our door, down the stairs, and across the parking lot and you're on the beach!  It was such a great experience we are going back again next month.  The outside of the building shows some age, but for being right on the ocean that is to be expected.  The lobby and front desk experience was not always perfect - we had to wait about 15 minutes for a desk clerk to finally show up, but it was worth the inconvenience of sub-par service to enjoy the proximity to the beach!
This is our 3rd time staying hear over the years. It is a great place right by the beach nothing super fancy but plenty of room and the rooms we're clean and had been updated since our last stay!

Summary Heading: Great loacation and updated rooms in a building with character
Summary: With the location and an updated room, you cant go wrong staying here. Stayed twice already and will be back again.

Summary Heading: Location is the only thing this property has going for it.
Summary: Booked this property completely aware that it is a 2 star hotel but based upon the reviews I was optimistic and it was not inexpensive. We mentioned that we wanted an ocean view to the guy at check-in. The property was empty so we thought our request might be accommodated. When we got to our room it was overlooking the highway. This is fine as this is the level of room we paid for, but at no point in time was the offer made to us to pay to upgrade. There were also several issues with the property itself. The elevator still moved after the doors were open, the metal drain in the shower was off completely and sitting beside it and lastly the water would not get hot. There were 3 of us staying in the room and none of us showered on our day of departure due to this. I would not

Hotel was okay. Proximity to the beach was the main reason for booking this hotel and honestly was the best feature. We booked a double queen suite for the extra room. Room size was only slightly larger than that of a regular hotel room, so not sure the extra price was worth it. Pros: -close to the beach!  -Beds were comfortable -Room was clean -Room was updated -Parking was available but is underground with a clearance of 6'8 -Fridge in room -Breakfast provided: Coffee, juice, waffles, cereal, bagels.   Cons:  -Main part of the hotel was outdated and could definitely use some upgrading -Wifi did not work and there was never an option to sign in with given password -Water never got hot in the shower  -Windows had no screens and opened fully which was a little surprising.

I have stayed at this property multiple times. However this time I had just had a baby. It takes me a little longer to get ready and get out for the day. So if you run a little behind don't expect them to be lenient.They called my room at checkout and said you gotta go, i asked them for 25 min and was told I had 10 minutes to get out. They also do not let you check in until 3 PM, so plan your vacation and you showing up to the city by 3pm. So expect on arrival day not to have a room until then. Otherwise the room is close to the beach and the breakfast is alright.

Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms overlooking Sunset Beach. Loved it. Breakfast was great. Parking under hotel. Loved it. Outside and some rooms are still dated but remodeled breakfast area and other rooms very nice. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Perfect location for access to the beach. I walked out on the beach and watched the sun go down. Breathtaking.  I believe management is trying really hard and I wish them success with their renovation. I would definitely go back but I am spoiled with the remodeled room with a beach view

I booked this hotel somewhat last minute while I was in California and am bashing myself for not researching a bit more on it. I booked through priceline (who I love) but when I got to the hotel it fell farrrrr too short of my expectations, which weren't even high to begin with considering its a Travelodge. The room was disgusting and we could barely get the window open - it reminded me of an old musty motel that I could of paid half if not less than half for. There were bugs crawling in the tub and there was barely any light in the rest of the room (probably beneficial to the hotel so you are unable to see how gross it actually is). I immediately went back down to the front desk where only one man was working and asked to be refunded as I was not going to stay there. I was told

that was the worst room I have stayed in in last 5 years. it had no outlets to plug ANYTHING in anywhere.  The table for my laptop had no way of finding any outlets on any walls.  do you expect every device to be plugged into one bathroom plug next to the sink???

Summary Heading: Week-long stay at Travelodge Ocean Front
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 8 days in early February. We chose a king bed non-ocean view room which had been renovated in the past couple of years. Our stay was to help family prepare a house for sale following a death, so we mainly had breakfast and returned at night for sleep. Clean, bed was comfortable. Service and friendliness of staff  was very good. Price was good compared to other hotels in area.

Summary Heading: I'm so sorry to have stayed her until..
Summary: So according to the site it said 3.5.. ok, so it's ok right!?..Noooo.. the pictures show illuminated rooms, fresh and airy. It was nothing but that. After a long ride we got in after midnight, we had to be at the convention center early.. just setting the picture. We got in our room and musty blew us away..carpet was old n a bit sticky with stains, the sink had Crack and rust, the shower was old and out dated, it looked like a scary motel! The curtains were so old. I was embarrassed to bring my guest with me! So I layer a towel on the shower tub liner..yes. it was so old.. shower nozzle had rust stains..i wanted to cry.. trying to mk best out of it. I hurried open the sheets..old with little balls as if from the 80s, dingy, we had hooded sweater on..my guest said..im trying

This was by far the worse hotel experience that I have ever encountered. The room was filthy. We were overcharged 400.00 dollars. Also did not receive the room that we originally had booked. I highly recommend keeping your distance from this delapitated hotel.

Summary Heading: Beach balacony view in unique room
Summary: Family stayed one night. wish it had been longer. We had a nice ocean view of Sunset beach from a surprisingly large balcony that had 2 tables seating 6. The room was nice with wood tiled floors a beautiful sliding white barn door for the bathroom (oddly it did not lock or close to inside though). The room was quite spacious and newly remodeled but beds were much too firm for our liking. Breakfast was the usual "continental" food found at most mid range hotels.  Staff was friendly. They were quite accommodating for our last minute request of a roll out bed and were welcoming of my service dog without question. It was clean and quiet. Free garage parking that has security cameras. The building is old and it is noticeable but there is a certain charm to it and its uniqueness. One

The location can't be beat. Write on the water bordering on Bolsa Chica state park. We particularly like corner room 224. On the downside the breakfast is awful. The great location makes it all worthwhile

Summary Heading: Elevator from parking area to reception floor did not work. Couldn't carry suitcase upstairs.Lukewarm water.Heater noise
Summary: No, I changed hotel after one night due to elevator from parking area did not work-was told they had to reset it from time to time. Shower water was lukewarm-was told it was for children's safety. Heater was noisy.

Summary Heading: We had an amazing stay at the Travelodge. The room was nice...
Summary: We had an amazing stay at the Travelodge. The room was nice and renovated. It's steps away from the beach and conveniently situated around many restaurants and stores. Staff was helpful, room was clean, comfy beds and most importantly it was quiet and peaceful. We will most definitely be back.

The best thing I can say is that's it's very close to the water. The beach is just across the street. The hotel itself is average at best. Everything about it is dated and the bathroom was made for tiny people. My daughter, who is not even 5-foot tall, complained about the height of the shower head. It was also difficult to access the internet. It was a free stay through Wyndham Rewards and it was on the beach. If not for those two things, I would have been very disappointed.
The room has an amazing view of the sunset. The room was newly refurbished in tasteful decor. The beds are not the most comfortable but it doesn't take away from the trip.

I have stayed here several times but my last visit I found the personnel unresponsive  I wished to change my room from street to ocean view and they quoted me an additional charge of $40 a day but when I went on line to their website I could get the upgrade for $20 a day.  Similarly the rooms have not been upgraded well and the amenities non-existent
Our room needed repairs on ceiling.  Some water damage. Very clean room. Very spacious. Lots of room. Breakfast was waffles, fruit, cereal, and muffins. The ocean view was excellent.

We stayed only one night, but had liked to stay longer. Rooms were modern, clean and updated. Laminate flooring and a walk-in shower. Nice breakfast room with plenty of space and breakfast with hot waffles. Parking in the open garage beneath the hotel. Hotel is situated on the beach, a few minutes walking from the shore line. We enjoyed the sunset, the beach is called Sunset Beach for a reason. Walking and bicycle paths at the aft side of hotel. Front side of hotel is situated on Pacific Highway but we did not experience noise from traffic. Across hotel some restaurants for lunch and dinner options.

Summary Heading: Great stay with excellent beach location
Summary: We have stayed at this location multiple times  great beach view and staff  We return 2-3x per year.
The room was wonderful. The view was amazing. The sound of the waves crashing on the shore created a perfect sleep environment.. The breakfast choices were good and the waffles were tasty.

We came to this motel after a long drive from Las Vegas, NV.  The motel was rather old and needed some remodeling.  The check in was quick and the gentleman was nice.  The room was nice and roomy.  We got a room facing the PCH so the traffic was loud during the evening rush hour.  It quiet down after around 9 PM.  The only thing that didn't work was the bathroom light.  We ended up using the heat light with the timer for illumination.  Breakfast was okay.  Just waffles, cereals, and pastries.    The best thing about this motel is the location.  Walk pass a parking lot and some houses and you're on the beach.  If you pick the ocean view, you'll have a balcony with a beach view.  You do have to pay extra for that.    This place has potential.  Improve on the breakfast items, do
Some of the hotel is dated, but they are obviously remodeling.  Perfect location if you desire a beach view.

I stay here every 3 months and have a blast with ocean frontage, sunset views, and dining near by.  Plus the rooms are newly renovated and the team is super nice to accommodate any special needs.  The price is a great value for ocean front rooms.  Stay there and enjoy the fresh ocean breeze and water.
Wonderful beach view and walking path  Was not able to make an out of area phone call from my room.

Great location from the beach. We had a ocean view room. Price good but not for a outdated room. Needs some updating in the bathroom and the sink is in the room its self. Blow dryer worthless, original as the place I'm sure. Original shell sink I think too and the bubble lights.. lol. Staff was friendly and covered parking was great too.

Only hotel i know between Sunset Beach and Newport Beach that is on the seaward side of the busy California 1 highway. It is only a short walk to the beach across a car park. Friendly and welcoming manager on reception. Rooms large and clean. I would recommend a room on the seaward side of the hotel as was peaceful and we had a balcony with a view of the sea. Free parking beneath hotel.

Very unhappy with my stay.  One of those hotels where you feel like you have to wear your shoes in the room so that you don't have to walk on the carpet or tile.  I actually stayed here for free because the last time I stayed at a Wyndham property is was horrible, including graffiti on the mirror and several large holes in the walls.  Giving them a second chance at this location was completely disappointing.  I will not be staying at Wyndham properties any longer.   The only thing going for this property is the location.  The only way to make it better is to tear it down and start over.  The walls are super thin so you can hear cars racing by all night.  I think the only thing they've updated in the room is the bedding.  Everything else looks like it must be original.

Not really on the ocean/beach, but nice centrally located mid-priced motel. We stayed in a renovated room which was well done- property old but we'll kept. Bkfst was not great. If your room is facing PCH be prepared for a lot of street noise.

Summary Heading: Close to the beach, but not very clean.  It was mid weak...
Summary: Close to the beach, but not very clean.  It was mid weak and empty, but they wouldn't let me stay late till my flight.

Summary Heading: A Nice, Reasonable Hotel, by/on the Beach
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel twice and were happy both times. The rooms are nice, the distance to the beach is awesome, it is located off of the California 1, so very easy to get to.

The hotel calls itself oceanfront, but isn't.  It fronts a very busy street, and the back faces a big beach parking lot and small green belt.  I was on the 2nd floor and I couldn't even see the ocean.  It's an easy walk to the beach, but nowhere near oceanfront.  The hotel is old, dated, and definitely needs a remodeling.  The bathroom was so small, it didn't have a sink.  The only sink was in the living area where the coffee maker and mini-fridge are.  You will have no privacy, while you wash your face, put on makeup, etc.  The room was basic, dated, but clean.  Shortage of outlets; we had to unplug the TV in order to charge our devices.  When I checked in, the clerk was in the backroom.  I had to shout "hello!" To get him out.  When he came out, U got no greeting at all.  He

Summary Heading: Location was great and access to the beach was quick...
Summary: Location was great and access to the beach was quick.  Quieter than main downtown, with bus access to downtown I'd you didn't want drive

this is my 4th year at the Travelodge for family reunion. Loved the newly remodeled rooms and the Breakfast with make your own waffles. Will be back next year. Manager is very accommodating to my family.

My family stayed here for two nights. I called and requested a renovated room beach side and they delivered. I even called the morning of and they reserved me a baby pack n' play. The location was great! Steps from Sunset Beach and a 5 minute drive from Huntington Beach. The breakfast in the morning was also an added plus! If you are considering staying here do it. The only con is our room was located outside the main lodging area and when guests would go in and out of the hotel the door was pretty loud. Never woke us though.

disappointed with check in. security of cars in parking lot. was given two keys to room but only one parking sticker. There was plenty of room for both my cars for one night. I will not be coming back again :(

Summary Heading: Sunset Beach CA - Travelodge Ocean Front
Summary: Excellent location for a beach hotel.  With limited hotels in Sunset Beach, this was the only one that had beach access without a busy street to cross.  Hotel was dated, but they were renovating some of the rooms during our stay.  Hotel manager was kind, courteous.  He gave all our family members renovated rooms.  We got ocean view rooms which were a little more expensive, but worth the sunset views each night.  Maid service was excellent, and rooms were clean.  Complimentary breakfast was OK, just not a lot to select from and it was the same food every day.  We stayed 6 nights.  Lots of restaurants close by, even some right across the street.  We came to hang out at the beach and this place was close - just a 3 minute walk to the water.  I would stay again.

Right on the beach is a good starting point. Friendly staff, nice parking, clean. Great breakfast. Only problem I had was the bed was just too hard. I'd go back if they said they had more comfortable beds. :)

Summary Heading: Great Location for family holiday getaway!
Summary: Great location for our itinerary - museums & beaches!! Clean rooms and helpful staff!! A bit pricey but it was a holiday weekend. Rewards helped.
The room was beautiful the location was beautiful and the service was great.  The manager, Nazrul Khan,  went above and beyond the call of duty.

Summary Heading: Great option for family beach vacation.
Summary: Rooms are large. Loved the balconies with ocean view. Staff is friendly and helpful. Restaurants within walking distance. Best of all was being so close to the beach!

Summary Heading: Don't forget anything in your room
Summary: I spent a night in this hotel to get some private time so I could finish up a load of paper work   The room was great very big room large patio  huge bathroom I think they are in the process of up grading there rooms and this one was very very nice   BUT   I left around 10:00 am and was a bit behind schedule.   I made several trips putting my belongings in my car, I cked out and got to my car and I remembered I left a charger in the wall when I was about 15 miles away and my liscence was not in my wallet I had it when I checked in   So I call up the place and got a gentleman  I asked him if the house keeping found my charger and liscence he quickly said no   I asked him if he could go look he put me on hold and in about 15 seconds gets back on the line and said no I did not

Nice large room but the toilet and bathtub was so tight and in such a squeezed area you could barely sit in the toilet due to the toilet paper holder.  Also the hotel was almost empty so the staff would be wise to give complimentary upgrades to ocean views in a situation like that to promote good customer relations.  After all a bed is a bed when cleaning a room by housekeeping.

We enjoyed staying at the Travelodge Ocean Front.  It was clean and the rooms nicely done. Sometimes hotel pillows are flat but these pillows were nice and plenty of them too.  This is important to me.  Modern floors to make it nice coming from the sand of the ocean.  Breakfast was good and nice and friendly staff.  The price was right too being so close to the beach and ocean.  We want to come back soon.
Nice rooms and very clean. Only downside was the faucet leaked causing a little water on the counters. A few homeless people would hangout in front but never seemed to bother us.

I gave this four stars because the price was very good for the quality.  Overall this Travelodge is in need of a fresh coat of paint, and a lot of updating, but our room on the west side was clean, quiet, and comfortable for my grown son and me.   Staff was polite and helpful.  I suspect the east side would have been less pleasant because of the much more busy Pacific Coast Highway.   Lower level parking under the hotel with entry on the west side was very convenient.    Walk across the non-busy side street on the west side and you will find Sunset beach.  There is the beginning of a very long blacktop walking/running/biking trail along the beach.   Here in August, we expected a more crowded beach but we just didn't experience this, with long stretches with very few people in

Nice. Greeted nicely, got a late check out due to marathon. Room nice. But the dead bolt did not work. Not good. And my late check out was not communicated to the next day manager who called me telling me I was in trouble because I had not checked out at 11.   But other than that others good.

Summary Heading: Room was very comfortable. Only problem was the elevator...
Summary: Room was very comfortable. Only problem was the elevator was nor working. We have problems with going up stares.
It was a good room and decent area. Beds were comfy. It was nice being close to the beach! I would stay again!

I had stayed at this hotel in April and the room was sufficient, not great but it worked.  This stay in August was not even average.   The bathroom was not very clean; it was so small that the sink had to be in the bedroom area.  There were no outlets by the table that I used as a desk so the desk had to be moved by the door in order to access Wi Fi for work purposes.  The beds were fairly comfortable and having the sound of the ocean in the room helped bring my rating up.
We absolutely loved that the hotel is literally right on the beach!  The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy!

Located right on the beach, with ocean views, family friendly, liquor store across the road for when mom has a breakdown, next to a Jack in the box for quick meal emergencies, and you're not having to spend a fortune like some of the other beaches. Its not luxury but very good value.

Summary Heading: The upgraded rooms are very nice but the older rooms are...
Summary: The upgraded rooms are very nice but the older rooms are dingy.  This is a great location and the staff is friendly.  I hope the hotel upgrades the remaining rooms soon!

The property is old and the room was very dated but clean. Just a small parking lot to cross then you are in the sand. Air conditioner unit was low so it blew directly on to one side of the bed. I booked this early so it was an affordable price for the location. No pool.

Booking was very simple and cancelation policy was explained and very helpful The staff was please to work with front the front desk to the breakfast assistants. It was obvious the rooms had recently been remodeled. What a pleasant surprise. Great view from the balcony of the beach and Pacific Ocean. The Hotel is location close to our annual beach party. Will be back next year for sure.

Unfortunately the only good thing about this property is it literally sat on the beach!  You could walk out and in less than one minutes be on the sand and in the waves.   The hotel is in need of an overhaul and update, rooms very dated but clean for the most part... It does offer a "continental" breakfast of breads, waffles, cereal, some fruit, don't get excited.   The front desk help tends to "hide out" in the back office so getting help is somewhat daunting.  After staying in La Jolla at a Travelodge, and anticipating the same level of service, it was a very disappointing stay!

Good:  The front desk people very nice. Housekeeping ladys very nice. Continental breakfast very nice. Distance to the beach great.   Bad: Hotel common areas not clean. Bathroom vent not clean. Windows not clean. Sink not clean, full of hair. Bed sheets with holes and not being replaced everyday. Parking lot not big enough for pick up trucks.

The room, breakfast, location, and staff were great.  I was pleasantly surprised by the condition of the room.  The shower was great!  The breakfast was hearty and they have a fresh yogurt dispenser.  The building could use some fixing up and the street side rooms get a lot of traffic noise.
Good location. The hotel could use a few updates. The breakfast buffet could be better, eggs and bacon & sausage would be a nice addition to the waffles and cereal.

This hotel has a lot of potential! (It could easily be a 4.) We had an double queen, ocean view room on the second (topmost) floor.  The room was quiet and spacious with a nice little balcony (containing 2 plastic chairs) with a great view of the ocean over a small parking lot.  (Hotel parking is under the hotel.)  The bathroom was tiny, but adequate.  That being said, the decor, etc. was dated and there was a mild odor.  This particular room was not yet updated, as supposedly other rooms are gradually being updated elsewhere in the hotel.  If it is a good update, this room will be fabulous!  Breakfast was nothing special (waffles were the highlight), but the breakfast room was updated and clean and the offerings were more than sufficient.  Reception area needs updating and the

Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had!!!! The only thing decent about that travel lodge was the view. We had to fix/ plunge our own toilet. The check-in staff was unbelievably rude. Wanted en explanation of why I wanted more towels and and said he was only authorized to give no more then 3 little bottles of shampoo. So I guess my wife and daughters got to shompoo but I did not. My request for a cot was denied and I was told it's only a request, it's not going to happen. On a personal note: I could have stayed at the grand Hyatt in Hawaii for less then we spent on that room!!!!!  Really hope someone reads this!!!!!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on the beach
Summary: This is a simple older beach hotel, but it is about as close to the beach as you can get for a reasonable price.  We had a private balcony that looked out at the ocean.  That made the trip for us!
It's a simple hotel with a prime location.  The south side rooms have a balcony and ocean views to include the strand.  Sunset and sunrise are very nice.

The reality of this hotel is that the pictures online make it seem WAY, WAY better than it actually is. Kudos to their photographer for framing it to look cleaner, bigger and newer than the 60s style motel it is. Also, it says it is in Huntington Beach but is 5 minutes north of the pier, in a slightly seedier section called Sunset Beach. My wife was probably a little harsh calling it the "murder hotel" but it had burn marks in the carpet AND door to the bathroom, and had an entire portion of the parking area under the hotel boarded up. So it really was a little bit of a shock to me based on how much I paid. I had read reviews before booking this hotel but it seemed as if most of them said that it just needed some updating, but that is not totally the case... It looked run down

I entered my nephew and two grandsons in a  half marathon, that started maybe 100 yards away from the hotel. the hotel is actually in sunset beach but part of the marathon walk/run path continued onto the Huntington beach. beautiful day beautiful path. relaxing beach. the hotel is right on the beach, it was a bit dated, but the boys enjoyed the free breakfast that they offered and  had roll away beds  for an additional fee , we all had plenty of room. The staff was very nice and accommodating and the price for a beachfront property that cannot be beat. If you spend a lot of time in the room, then for a substantially higher rate, the more updated and modern rooms on the beach at Huntington, Newport, etc. are out there as well...

I booked this hotel through TripAdvisor/Booking.com. I should have believed what the reviews said about this hotel. I got a fair rate when I booked it. A few days before checking in I called to confirm my reservation. I asked the man not to put me on the Pacific Coast Hwy side because of too much noise from all the traffic on that side. He said you booked with Booking.Com and that rate is always on the PCH side. He said for $50 more I could be on the other side with a balcony and view of the ocean. I felt like I didn't have a choice if I wanted to get any sleep so I paid more.  I noticed that the outside of Hotel looked old and run down.When I arrived at 1:00, I knew I was early but thought I would check to see if my room might be ready or at least go ahead and check in. The man

We've been coming here for 4 years.  In the past year they've updated the rooms and the breakfast food/room.  It is RIGHT ON THE BEACH with covered parking.  There are great restaurants across the street.  A nice place if you want a quiet vacation (as opposed to the congestion of Huntington Beach).  A nice place....

Nice older hotel with great beach access.  The exterior of the hotel is slightly run down but the rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was good and in a nice eating area.  The beach is literally across the parking lot with great bike paths right outside the hotel as well.  We actually skateboarded  all the way to the Huntington Beach pier and back (12 miles total) and watched all the fireworks from the beach on the 4th of July...AWESOME!
We had a wonderful time.  Rooms were recently updated and balcony view of ocean and people watching was worth it. Staff very accomadating and friendly. Breakfast was better than expected.

Summary Heading: Old, good hotel if ure not going to stay there all day
Summary: When I got there I was kind of disappointed of the outside feel the only thing that was good about it is that it was on the beach the TV was fuzzy I had to wait for somebody to fix it and it was late and I was tired the water pressure was not that great air conditioner didn't really work well the elevator was scary In the sense that it was old you  felt like it might not work. The breakfast was only cereal and waffles no eggs no sausage nothing really good the people were not that nice I'll never stay here again. Also the Wi-Fi did not work till the last day it was tricky to get on the Wi-Fi we had to go down and asked for help once again it was late and we were tired

Staff is rude,. Never brought us necessities for the bathroom, paid for an ocean view room received a partial barely, breakfast staff was rude and not stocked. Never told about wifi internet.  Hotel needs to be updated and friendlier staff that's for sure!
freshly redone room , balcony facing the ocean (great for morning coffee)  exceeded our expectations.  front desk mgr.  was very pleasant.
it was an older hotel, smelled like pee and old stuff. the only good thing about it was the open access and distance to the beach.

Ocean view, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, breakfast and dining area was updated and very inviting. Walking distance to beach, weather was good a little overcast. Only complaint is no early check in and owner needs to make some upgrades to rooms. Exterior of building is in dire need of repair and curb appeal. WiFi was offered but very poor server, could not access internet most of the time.

Summary Heading: This hotel is well located right on sunset beach. Clean room, friendly staff, good breakfast.
Summary: We liked this hotel mainly because you could walk right out to the beach. Room was small but big enough for everything. We were on the Pacific Hwy side of the building so it was noisy with the traffic going by but we didn't mind it at all. Book the beach side if traffic bothers you. We also liked the convenient below hotel parking area with a elevator up to the rooms. Overall, this hotel was a good value and we would come back again.
Last minute booking . Called wyndham customer service to get a room next to Cal State Long Beach  and couldn't of asked for a better hotel  next to the beach .

Summary Heading: Very noisy and did not get a good sleep. Convenient to the...
Summary: Very noisy and did not get a good sleep. Convenient to the beach just a few minutes away though

I have been there many times with my parents and siblings growing up, then with friends now with my family. The ownership changed and I saw better things. The hotel workers are always courteous and friendly! I love parking right underneath the hotel, I always get a beach side room if possible for the view. So nice and close great for just relaxing on the beach weekend. Nothing is brand new, but never had an issue with clean or comfy. Great gem for the price, near great food.

We dropped off here by chance as other hotels were all full, it was nt our choice of place to stayas it doesn't have a pool, the reception area needs an overhaul but the rooms are adeuate only snag us one chair in room r 2 people but we got another one no problem, staff all friendly and brekfast room spacious itch essentials, we have stayed  here twice now as rooms good and easy walk to Beach and bars, sas and mothers,

Summary Heading: Motel 6 quality for much higher price
Summary: Just know that you are paying for the amazing access to a great beach, not a great hotel. It is comparable to a Motel 6. Beds are comfortable enough. Bathroom is so small it's nearly impossible to turn around--a real challenge if you have to help a 5-year-old bathe. There are minimal electrical outlets in the room, and no outlet by the bed. So, no overnight charging your phone bedside. And, the bedside clock didn't work... The downstairs bathroom had no soap in the dispenser--lots of water, but no suds. I can't imagine the logic in saving money by not providing soap in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet's crowning item was the waffle maker.

I have been to this location about 5 or 6 times already. The first time I visited there I was in a room that was not renovated. But, I still felt like the room was pretty accommodating for my visit. As long as the facilities work and are in order. Im fine. I usually stay here with my friends and pre-game before getting an uber to the bars in Downtown Huntington. Its a quick get away, I always reserve for the rooms with the balcony even though its a little pricier, I think the view in the morning is worth it. Now every time I go I request a renovated room. The renovated rooms are much nicer with laminate wood floors and a sleek dark design. I always recommend this location to family and friends. I'm sure I will be back soon.

The elevator was out of service and all rooms are up at least 1 flight of stairs.  Rooms seem to have been redecorated but lobby (check in desk) is small and shabby looking.  Breakfast was gone by 8 am and no one was attending it to restock.  The rooms hovever are clean and updated and the location is good.  Rooms on PCH side somewhat noisy.

Overall, the facility is managed poorly. Room 215 for this stay had poor A/C, and a very uncomfortable bed.  The water was turned off each day for 3 hours. First 2 days, no notice, after that, management left a note in the room. The breakfast was terrible and very unsanitary. Bread is just loaves left open to handle with bare hands. Milk was sour due to small fridge not working. No eggs, or additional sides available.  Housekeeper left a small ragged towel in the room for a hand towel. When I reported it to the manager, he scoudled her very loudly and unprofessionally, leaving her in tears. It could be heard down the hall. The existing manager should be working at a convenience store in another country. Very unprofessional and out of place. Not becoming of Wyndham requirements.

Summary Heading: Great location and staff were very accomodating.
Summary: Located right on the beach you could go out and walk every morning.  The staff attended quickly to any issues we brought to their attention.  The manager went beyond helping fix an issue with our personal computer.

Check out my other reviews. I am NOT a complainer. I like to give credit where credit is due, but unfortunately I can give zero credit here. I feel the need to warn you. Don't book here! IT IS DISGUSTING!!!! First, the positives... it is close to a beach. If you don't book ocean view though, you will be staring at a strip mall. Not bad, could be worse. However, it gets worse. This place is filthy. The pillow cases are itchy. Bed uncomfortable. Traffic noisy. The elevator made me fear for my life. I can imagine places rented by the hour being cleaner. See the photos of all the stains, mold and gunk. The front desk tried to charge me more than the price I booked. I only needed to stay for the night and I got in at 2 am... I still couldn't get out of there fast enough. Trust me...

Summary Heading: Very poor experience with this hotel!
Summary: Based upon the ad and the pictures and to proximity to the beach, we had planned to stay with this hotel for 4 to 6 days.  Unfortunately, the actual experience was quite poor.  The room was very poorly furnished and not entirely clean.  The bathroom sink had no cold water.  When my husband turned on the faucet under the sink the water ran onto the floor. The bathroom door was an old door on a track which did not close all the way. The balcony was adequate in size but very dirty and only had a KMart variety plastic table and two plastic wobbly chairs.  They agreed to fix the sink and did so and we cleaned up the balcony.  The next day we were informed that if we wanted to stay on we had to pay forty dollars more than the price quoted (and charged the first night) and move to an

This ocean front, fair priced hotel made for a great weekend on the beach for our daughters birthday. Only half the hotel is remodeled; we didn't have a updated room but we did have adjoining, ocean view, rooms with balconies which I requested. Two out of the three front desk staff were friendly and helpful - can't win them all.

Summary Heading: Our room and view was amazing! The staff was nice and...
Summary: Our room and view was amazing! The staff was nice and friendly. And this is the perfect location to not have to just walk to and relax on the beach! We loved it!

The manager was businesslike but nice.  The problem is the hotel itself.  Very outdated.  Good location and clean.  But that's about it.  Considering the location I would think the real estate alone is worth more than the rundown appearance of the place.

It's nice to stay here because it's a few steps from the beach. You don't have to cross but a small parking lot to get to beach. It's nice if you have kids. Check in is 3pm and check out 11am. They are very strict on check in and check out times no exceptions. This last visit is was pouring rain and they made us wait to exactly 3pm to check in. The rooms are not bad but not sure they are cleaning the rooms. We had to ask for extra towels since we had 3 people and they acted like it was a big deal to want extra towels. We stayed in Ocean view room which I highly recommend versus the other that looks at Pacific Coast Highway (no view of anything). We like stay here for the location to beach and it's nice to sit on the balcony and watch the beach goers. I have come to this hotel
For a Hotel built in the 60"s on the Beach, this place is a great afforable no frills place to stay. Clean and cozy but best of all it's literally 50 yards from the sand of Sunset Beach CA.

The location is so perfect ! But I do have a few suggestions .  1. Please hire nice employees , because you a bearing the Wyndam Brand  2. The breakfast was ok , however some travelodge I've been is way better , plus , stop using styrofoams, they're more expensive and it's not good for the environment  3. I hope they change the late check out policy .

Summary Heading: The Location Is The Only Salvation for This Property
Summary: It is unfortunate that this property is part of Wyndham.  I picked this property first and foremost because of its location, across from Sunset Beach.  Secondly, the pics I saw online was not half bad, however, I was very dismayed when my family and I arrived.  We got there at dusk and even then, you can easily recognize that the property is rundown.  We were even more disappointed to find that the rooms are dingy and dark (and smelled moldy).  The AC unit was not working in our room and we had to tinker with the cord and plug to make it work.  The only area that was recently refurbished was the breakfast area and we were hoping that the quality of breakfast matched the "newness" of the room, but the offerings were just as disappointing as the rest of the property.  The property

The room was rather large, but décor was date.  Shower and toilet were in a cramped, separate room.  The complimentary breakfast was limited to waffles, toast or bagels, 3 different cold cereals and oranges.  For the price it was okay

The room was nice. There was remodeling in progress, so there was debris from the construction that should've been cleaned up in the hallways. Breakfast was adequate. Sunset Beach has a large homeless population, which unfortunately was viewed from our balcony. I don't fault the hotel for this. Our room had wood floors which weren't swept, so there was sand in the floor, which got into our beds. And every day we had to shoo pigeons away which were building a nest on our balcony. Also a lot of bird poop on the chairs and tables from the pigeons.
This hotel isn't fancy but the location is AWESOME! We had an ocean view. The parking is free and breakfast is included. There are restaurants across the street ( a vegan one too!).

We arrived a little before check in time and most hotels are ok with you being a little early but we were very rudely told to wait until 3 on the dot. So we had to sit across the street in the parking lot after an 18 hour overnight drive with a 9 yr old, 8 yr old, and 3 month old twins to wait for our room. I'm sure you can imagine how exciting and convenient that was. We were not in a renovated room so things were dated and the shower would turn left for hot 1 day and right the next (I know that sounds ridiculous but I promise it's true). I'm sure the renovated rooms are very nice.  Breakfast was wonderful. Waffles, coffee, juice, bagels, oatmeal, a big selection.  Although the weather was cold and we didn't get to enjoy the beach it is very close to the beach and within a very

Summary Heading: Overnight stay.  Would definitely come back.
Summary: We were attending a concert at Don the Beachcomber and wanted to stay someplace close by.  I compared rates and the Travelodge came out the best.  Wasn't expecting anything too fancy but it definitely exceeded my expectations.  It was nice to be able to check in an hour early.  Got a quiet room in the back (not an ocean view) that had been completely remodelled.  Apparently, they are doing the upgrades bit-by-bit...but if this is an example of what is to come...it'll be very nice.  We really liked how close we were to the beach and will be returning again at some point to enjoy the surf.

The Travel Lodge ocean Front Hotel was fantastic!  it is an older hotel but our room was remodeled. Very clean and very nice. Right across the street from the beach !  That's just what we wanted !  Five minutes from the busy hustle and bustle of Huntington Beach .  And you couldn't beat the price of the room !  We can't wait to come and stay there again !  The only disappointment was the breakfast, we are used to a larger selection
Clean, quiet & comfortable room.  Nice staff.  Free breakfast is a plus.  Location is great - we had a full view of the beach/ocean and its a short walk to restaurants & nightlife.

Visit was nice, Hotel room was clean, newer tile on floor, which was way nicer than carpet.  the bathroom was updated with stand up shower.  The balcony was also nice with a table and chairs.  Plus the hotel manager was helpful and worked with me on a recent booking, and made everything whole.  Overall A+

Perfect location with the grankids.  Beach access was a BIG plus for the whole family.  No need to drive to find a beach.  Just walk across the small public parking area for the beach and you're on the sand!  Just a 35 minute drive from Disneyland and we're back for a dip in the Ocean before bed.  Stayed twice now and am looking forward to a third.  Highway side room a bit noisy but ocean side rooms are great!

Summary Heading: Eh, ok for price, great location
Summary: Most reviews say their room has been updated but ours was not.  Mold in the bathroom,  bedside lamps that didn't work,  light switches that didn't work and cords that had shortages. Found trash behind bedside table.   My sister met me at the hotel and the front desk told me they only allowed one parking spot per room and website didn't reflect that policy.  There is no other parking near by due to beach,  housing and business's.   The location is the best!  It's worth overlooking the mold and shady wiring for a walk to the beach.  Most rooms look out over the beach but ours didn't. It actually was on the noisy side with all the traffic. Didn't bother us, but if you can upgrade to a beach view room,  I'm sure it's worth it. Second floor room would provide an even better view. The

This was an inexpensive motel right on Hwy 1. The lobby was a little sketchy but the room was renovated and comfortable, but there was a lingering smell. We were given directions for the Internet but it didn't work. We asked about local restaurants and the person at the desk didn't know. It turned out there was an excellent Italian restaurant almost across the street!  Complementary breakfast was unimpressive. Instead of butter packets there was I Can't Believe It's Not Butter spray. A man in a suit who appeared to be the manager strode through as we were getting our food. He didn't greet us or even look at us, much less ask us about our stay. He said, "Maria, bring out the (some kind of) bread."  She said, "But it's old."  He barked, "I don't care. Bring it out anyway. " Then

Summary Heading: Great location and price right at the beach!
Summary: The rooms have recently been renovated and the staff is very nice and helpful. I was happy to be so close to the beach and not have to spend a lot of money for such a great location.

Summary Heading: Room was recently updated and beautiful,  Bath had floor to...
Summary: Room was recently updated and beautiful,  Bath had floor to ceiling tile and was spotless.  Beach was a short walk across the road.

Summary Heading: Good Value and Location, Rooms Average
Summary: If you are looking for an ocean front hotel on the ocean side of the PCH, this hotel is a very good value. We upgraded to an ocean view room and were glad we did - we were on the south end of the hotel and had a clear view of the beach and ocean. There is a lot of traffic in the area all day but it settles down at night.  It was great to be able to walk out the door and be on the beach. The room was pretty run down but we knew this was an older hotel and expected it.  The beds were very comfortable and we had very comfortable bedding. The breakfast was just okay - some cereal and granola bars, and many donuts and packaged items. This hotel is a good value for the location, and since we weren't in the room that much it worked for us.

Summary Heading: ocean front travel lodge Sunset Beach Ca
Summary: Couldn't beat the price for being so close to the actual beach. Rooms were ok we had one facing the street so it was a little noisy other than that it was ok. The bathroom is REALLY small. Location Location Location definitely good if you want to be right on the beach maybe 100 yards away from the actual beach. Good value for your $
The rooms were pretty decent.  The hallways could be updated a bit.  The mattresses and pillows need to be changed desperately.  It was like sleeping on cardboard.

This hotel seems to be slowly remodeling as it is an older place. We have stayed there several times and love the ocean view and friendly staff. The room is always clean and out top choice when we visit the beach. One other bonus is thick sound proof walls.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for less
Summary: We stayed here with friends on new years eve. The hotel is walking distance from the beach, and close to local resturants. It's a great place to stay if looking for a clean  room , with a mini refiigerator and a complimentary breakfast.  The rates are reasonable and the staff friendly.  They offer free parking. It's a no frills hotel but great for one or two nights. The large hotels are less than a mile away for visiting and enjoying the frills.
Old hotel, clean, great location. Friendly, helpful staff members. Adequate covered parking.  In a safe area. Need to upgrade their electrical connections.

We came to California to visit friends and have children experience ocean. We were pleasantly surprised by the accessibility of the beach and other services in the area.  Hotel exceeded our expectations.

Our family had a pleasant stay here.  We stayed for two nights.  We had two rooms.  They were older but clean.  The breakfast was great and room recently renovated.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The best part is proximity to the beach; very close and beach views from balcony.

This hotel is in a great location on the beach , while the hotel is old it is kept up reasonably well . The beds were comfortable and the room was clean for the most part although I did notice mold along the top of the shower door . the lighting system is old and should be updated. The staff I had contact with were friendly . I would stay here again mostly because of the location.

The location is the perfect place to watch the sunrise and sunset! Walking on the beach was so relaxing! The breakfast was tasty, but it needed protein. Just carbs and fruit were provided. Internet did not connect. I did not report since I was there just one night.

This hotel is right on Sunset Beach at the end of Bolsa Chica State Beach and their nice biking/walking path.to Huntington Beach.  The place is generally pretty run down, but no bugs and ok continental breakfast in a renovated dining area.  I stayed in a room I've stayed in several times before and could not get hot water for the shower - turns out the plumbing was installed incorrectly, and hot water could be obtained with the shower control in the cold position.  They have installed nice new windows, but my room had no screens and the drapes had no "sheers" I.e., a layer that would admit light but provide privacy.  They are simply blackout curtains.  The accommodations are clean and tolerable, and if they'd just complete their renovations and hire a professional staff, they'd

The hotel location is fabulous, on Sunset Beach and walking distance to Bolsa Chica wetlands.  The rooms are clean but there was a strange odor when we first entered. The bed was firm but comfortable.  The car noises on the PCH kept us awake all night.  If we were to stay here again, we would upgrade to a beachfront room to escape some of the car noise.  There is free wifi and covered parking which were a plus.  A free breakfast was included but we did not try it.

Excellent location on the beach!  Very old hotel with the smallest bathroom I have experienced in thirty years.  The free breakfast was almost a joke -- shrink wrapped danish and dry cereal with some apples and bananas.  An excellent Mexican restaurant and sushi restaurant directly across Pacific Coast Highway--two minute walk.  Very slow elevator.  Two remote control devices needed to operate the tv.  Staff was friendly and responsive.
Was a little skeptical at first, but was pleasantly surprised at what a great value this room was for the location. We will definitely stay at this hotel again in the near future.
Nice hotel in a great location. Staff are warm, friendly and helpful. The price is great for being right at the water. Rooms are large and balconies make relaxing in the evening easy.

Summary Heading: Hotel in desperate need of upgrading
Summary: The hotel is old. The carpets are dirty, the tub is peeling, beds are hard, wallpaper is dated. A milky substance was draining from the top floor onto our balcony. The best thing was I had an ocean view, which I paid for... Don't want to be on street side because of heavy traffic noise.
Pleasant, clean, private room.  Everything worked. Window faced Pacific Coast Highway but it really wasn't too loud.  Staff very pleasant.

Summary Heading: Great location but outdated rickety hotel
Summary: While the staff was very nice and accommodating, this hotel is very outdated and poorly decorated.  The bathroom was small and the sink was in the main area. Wall paper was peeling and from the 60s.  If you're looking for luxury or even close to luxury this is not the place.

Great location to stay at if you want to be by the beach.  There's a Jack in the Box nearby but drive out into the area and eat at the Restaurants they have to offer in HB.  I absolutely loved how relaxing it was to stay at this location.  The room is a bit run down and out dated but you get what you pay for and that's not too bad when you're by the water.  This trip turned out to be such a relaxing one.
Room was smelly (moldy type of smell) and carpet was too old. Just didn't give a clean feeling. Otherwise, it was roomy inside with a huge balcony and a decent view of the ocean.

This hotel was right on the beach. The staff was friendly but the building was old with paper thin walls and loud plumbing. Beds were clean but hard as a rock. They could have a little gem of a place with some updating. The rooms had really large balconies overlooking the beach and that was a plus.

The room was 5 feet from a 4 lane highway. It was a 4 way intersection with a 7 11 on the corner. The road noise was endless. It was impossible to sleep or even hear. Emergency vehicles all night. I asked 3 times to move to a different room with no help from the registration desk. This room should not even be used. I left forfeited my money just left so I could get some quiet.

Although the guest rooms appear to have been recently remodeled the public areas of the hotel need attention badly.  Decor is old and shabby, painted services are long overdue for a coat of paint, and the street noise is horrendous (all of the non-view rooms overlook the street).  The ONLY thing this hotel has is a great location.

I can't believe Travelodge even allows this hotel to operate.   The price was right, the location was fantastic.  The place is in such disrepair that we had a concrete tile shingle come crashing onto our patio in the middle of the night, we had a gush of soapy water come splashing into our patio from a drain that was specifically designed to drain into that patio from the one above with cleaning water!  Gross!  We could have been sitting out there.    I know they are renovating but seriously these rooms should be closed until they are renovated.

Summary Heading: NOT a 5 **star** hotel but basically on the beach!
Summary: has everything you need:  clean sheets, some breakfast items in the AM, towels, and TV.  there is really nothing around this hotel in walking distance:  across the street at a very weird angle is a quicky mart and surf shop.  but it's a pretty cheap place to stay on the beach---just have to walk across the sunset beach parking lot at the end of warner.

I was looking for a lower priced hotel that's close to the beach. I know that's hard to do and was willing to accept lower quality hotels. This Travelodge was in a very good spot (right on PCH and next to the entrance of Sunset Beach state park). Sunset Beach is still a little behind in gentrification like Huntington but that's okay. The restaurant's are still very good and close. This hotel is well managed but is outdated. Rooms are secure, parking works well and the continental breakfast is pretty basic. They are updating rooms slowly but I'm sure that will most likely raise the rates. Carpet is old, woodwork /paint need attention, air conditioning is old but works. Bathroom fixtures need help. Just an old place that was CLEAN but if you can't handle NEW everything you better

Summary Heading: The area where travelodge is located is beautiful. There...
Summary: The area where travelodge is located is beautiful. There are many great choices to dine in within walking distance. We felt very comfortable, overall it was a nice stay.
Access to the beach is excellent.  A beach hotel that can have much more to offer other than the winged bugs in my bed and pillow.

Newly remodeled rooms and great location within walking distance to beach.  The rest of the motel needs to be updated to match the quality of the rooms.  Not much curb appeal or lobby appeal, time for a remodel of the rest of the facility.  I would stay here again based on the location and rooms, great value.

No bath tub in $135 room was a surprise.  It looked like it had been modified (formerly did have a tub)  I just kept staring at it as I had been looking forward to a bath!  Otherwise GREAT hotel, this one is ALL about location, just steps to the beach, great views, and ocean air breezes throughout the hotel's corridors. Most of the hotels in this area are on the east side of PCH so walking to the beach is not simple.  This is on the west side of PCH, i.e. beach access for real. Covered private parking, vending machines for quick snacks.  Enthusiastic & helpful manager and staff.

Summary Heading: Not luxury, but had everything I want!
Summary: I chose this motel for it's proximity to the starting line of a marathon that my family was participating in, and I was pleasantly surprised at the overall accommodations!  Though this place is far from luxurious, it was a very comfortable and quiet place to stay.  The room was very spacious, with a very large balcony, everything worked, beds were comfortable, there was ample free parking, and it was very quiet at night.  Also, it was very close to the beach (just steps!).  The continental breakfast was free, and not good, but still fine with me.  I had trouble connecting to WIFI, but we even got that working.  I would definitely stay here again.  The price was right, and it had all the things that are important to me.  Again, not at all luxury, but I felt safe and was very

Summary Heading: old property, low quality breakfast, good location
Summary: needs a remodel, pricey for the amenities offered.  breakfast is limited. packaged pastry only. wi -fi did not work.

Average hotel, good price last minute. No bath tub in the rooms with 2 queen beds, be careful if you have kids that don't use a shower. The beds linens are outdated. The room was clean. The parking spots are small and very limited.  When we had called to add another car, there was no one at the front desk answering the phones, so we just left a note at the front desk that we had a guest that was parking their car there for a couple hours.

This was a great place to stay for the money. The room was bigger than you average hotel room, however the toliet and shower room was very small. The water pressure from the shower made up for it being so small though. Took the sand right off of you. Due to shortage of water, the showers at sunset beach were off. This hotel had one though right outside which was very nice. Parking was great. We had ocean view with a very large balcony. Room 106. My family and I felt very safe being here. The front desk staff was very friendly and we even got to check in early. The a.c. in room 106 was amazing. We went to the beach left it on and when we got back it was about 60 degrees..I also had a playpin with me that we set up in the room. It wasn't even in the way, the room was that big. Of
Got a room with an amazing view -  room wasn't updated like some of the others - and it smelled funny Bathroom was cramped - but the room itself was spacious.
Hotel needs some tlc but location and view made up for it. Wifi did not work with my iPad. Staff said it is an Apple thing.

The location is great ...however does not outweigh the dated facility. The building was musty, bathroom small, carpet very dirty, bed decent, lighting poor...no desk lamp, breakfast offerings decent. Will not use in the future.

My husband and I spent 3 nights here for a beach getaway. We couldn't have been more pleased with the location and the price. Just steps away and we were on the big beautiful beach. This hotel is not fancy and if you are looking for any extras, you won't find it here. Breakfast was extremely minimal. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and attentive. We will be back without a doubt!

I have stayed at this location every September for the last 4 or 5 years.  Right now they are in the processes of updating the rooms and they are doing a beautiful job.  The location is excellent.  The hotel is 200 or so feet from the beach and parking is free, which is not always the case with other hotels that can charge around $20 per day.  This is an older hotel, and it is really no frills, but the internet is reliable and free, the rooms are clean and you cannot beat the access to the beach.  I've only stayed in the ocean facing rooms, which all come with a nice balcony to watch and hear the waves.

They are redoing the hotel and it looks really nice.  But they did not have some little things done, like no towel rack or no handle on the sliding doors.  My husband and I got stuck out side on the balcony and had to call the front desk to let us in. It took 2 maintenance men and 45 minutes to take the door off and let us back in our room.  It is a great location,  right across from the beach.
The room was fine, the view wasn't quite what I was expecting, and the water pressure was a trickle... however they do look like they are updating
Excellent location! Plus the staff was very friendly and accommodating! I will be booking again in the future. The price is also fair! Thank you!
rooms are being renovated  current rooms outdated and wifi does not work well  Also breakfast is juice and dry cereal not exciting

Myself and some friends wanted a fun get away to the beach for a few days and this was the perfect hotel for this. We got a room with an ocean front view which is money well spent. Our room had balcony with a awesome view.    We got a room with two queen beds and the room had plenty of space.  The bathroom had a step in tub shower with a toilet and the sink was separate with a vanity.  Everything was clean and well kept up. Room did have a giant closet and a tv. Loved the fact that the room also was equipped with a mini fridge and in the morning there was complimentary breakfast.   Reasonable prices for the great location. The waves were perfect. The water very warm and the beach had very soft sand. Sunset beach was not very crowded and it was very clean and had great waves for

Summary Heading: My boyfriend and I always go to this hotel and will still...
Summary: My boyfriend and I always go to this hotel and will still continue to be a loyal customers.  We love this place , the service is friendly,  the guests are friendly,  and the beach is literally right across the parking lot.

Summary Heading: a very special find if you're on the ocean view side!
Summary: What a pleasant surprise - was prepared for very iffy stay but wanted to get to know the area -so delighted to find a balcony with unobstructed ocean view in this wonderfully funky beach town . I will stay here often. Ice machine is iffy, abd recommend Woody's for breakfast instead of the cellophane wrapped muffin, but who cares, just enjoy the beautiful day!
If you want miles of beaches to enjoy stay here! Right on the corner of Sunset beach and Bolsa Chica state park. Convenient underground parking

This hotel is located across the cul de sac from the beach. The staff is very pleasant and attentive if you need something. It appears that some rooms are being renovated which is a good thing. While the rooms are clean it is a "beach hotel" which means evidence of moisture and sand. Not the prettiest place but clean, quiet, comfortable and very affordable for nearly oceanfront.

I'm not sure i want the world to know about this little gem, but as a regular guest perhaps I owe it to the staff to show my appreciation.  It's nothing fancy, but it does the job, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and for the price you can't beat it...we go every 6-8 weeks to unwind, eat some great food and ride our bikes and beach it.  The location is the draw, you get a full ocean view, as where other hotels in town have obstructed views, if any.  Nice big patios in most rooms, good for relaxing, playing cards or dominos, and looking at the ocean.  We don't spend that much time in the room, there's too much to do outside, and with the great rates, we can dump $300 on dinner at Captain Jacks..best King Crab on the planet! It's great fun, that's why we go back..again, and

This hotel was walking distance to the beach. It has covered parking which also leads to the beach. You can stash your chairs and umbrella in your car and grab it when you go to the beach. The balcony in the room faced the ocean and was very big. Had enough chairs to lay your wet clothes on. The breakfast was packaged food. But you did have access to a microwave. The bathroom was very small.  Overall if you want to be able to walk to the beach in 2 minutes this is the place!

Summary Heading: AWESOME Location - Right on the beach!!
Summary: We were more interested in the location and getting to the beach than hotel with amenities.  This location is right on the beach!!  When we checked in the manager was very friendly and very accommodating.  The room was better than I expected.  But the main selling feature of this property is you can exit the back stairs and you are at the beach!!  We didn't have to drive or worry about parking to get to the beach.  I would definitely stay here again. Yes it might be a little old - but they are working on updating the rooms!  Ours was new and updated.

The motel needs some sprucing up, but I didn't choose it for its amenities.  I chose it for its location.  From our room we could see the beach, and the beach was only 100 yds away.  I'd would have no problem choosing this motel again.

Summary Heading: In desperate need of a renovation
Summary: The property is not well maintained and in need of a rehab. Everything is wore out and tired looking.  There is not enough parking for hotel guests and nothing avail close by.  The A/C is loud but was needed during the heatwave and the hotel is overall a bit noisy.  Not very relaxing at all. On the plus side, the location is great and staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms a nice size and the balcony is a plus.

Nice little convenient place for a quick stay at the beach. Complimentary breakfast and USA Today  Friendly staff great area restaurants and bars. Little far from Dodgers stadium but that's on me. Bathroom small but clean and shower awesome.

The males who work here are very rude and inconsiderate as well as they yell at you tell you that service dogs are not supposed to make noise or go outside to use the bathroom they made it very difficult on us and I'm retired army with a crushed spine asked for late check out but he yelled said no and that if we were more than 5 mins late he would charge another night on the account the only one who was nice was the lady here and we are here as an employee stay and it was the worse customer service ever they even said they refused to contact a manager for us!!!!

We chose this property because of the location and it was a great spot BUT the hotel was run down and claims the Wyndam name. The carpet throughout was bad, the asthetics were just awful. There is an extreme need for an overhaul with this place. Paint, flooring, window covering, working ice machines, etc. For over $200 a night, its the least that can be done. Otherwise if all you care about is the spot, then you're good. One would think that with all the money made being in Seal Beach that more could be done....the hotel was sold out but just bad otherwise.

Was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews.  However, we were pleasantly surprised.  Our room was new and very clean.  Breakfast bar is nothing to write home about but they offered basics.  The best part was access to the beach - right out the door.  Will stay there again for sure!

If you don't spend any time in the room, this hotel is in a great spot.  If it weren't in such a great location I wouldn't pay more than $59 a night but since it's right across from the beach, I didn't lament too much over a price that was twice that.
