This place is OLD and FUNKY.  The room was OK but definitely needs to be updated and needs some serious deep cleaning. At least it didn't smell and the bedding seemed clean.  There are weird sealed doors in the halls and there was one in our closet.  Kind of a Winchester Mystery House.  I will have to say the double queen room was very spacious.  Plenty of room to move about.  Free wifi and parking and free, though mediocre, breakfast was a plus. Because of the location,  I'd consider staying here again.  (It's across from a less

Although the staff was nice enough the place was a dump...so surprising that a hotel RIGHT on the beach can be such a dive! I was bummed RIGHT when I checked in as I was told I would get an ocean view...I didn't. I checked into the room, it smelled really musty then the bathroom smelled like urine...yes, it's a bathroom but it shouldn't smell like urine in the entire bathroom, smelled like someone hadn't cleaned toilet in months.  The water pressure WAS however decent for CA having a drought.  The carpet was sticky ALL over, as if it had NEVER been cleaned, the decor was extremely outdated and it looked as if they made the bathroom smaller so they could make the bathroom sink like a kitchen sink or something.  Basically, the bathroom had a toilet and shower/tub...that's it...the

We arrived earlier than the allowed check in time.  Mayra offered to call me when the room was ready, and she did.  We had a Ocean View 2 Queen Non Smoking room.  It was very nice.  It had recently been remodeled and was very nice.  Very roomy, clean and quiet.  The beach was right across one driveway from our balcony.  We ate our breakfast on the balcony and watched the Dolphins play out in the water on Sunday morning.  We will be back for sure

It's right on the beach in Sunset Beach. That's the good part.   Negatives:  The room was never adequately cleaned. There was months worth of dust under the cable box. When I arrived the room had no chair. No chair! The clerk explained that the room had been remodeled a few weeks past and they probably hadn't gotten around to putting a chair back in. I guess that no one in that room since had needed or noticed the lack of a chair. They did bring a chair, a nice office type chair.   The refrigerator could better be called a 'cooler' because that's all it did. Lacking a thermometer I'd guess the refrigerator was set for around 50 degrees.   One evening the entire upper floor reeked of marijuana smoke. Not a little. A LOT. I have no problem with marijuana consumption, but I think
The only good thing about this hotel is location!  Run down, dirty, and hard to understand help!  Nothing deluxe about breakfast!  They look like they might be remodeling?

Great location....our room had a fabulous bathroom.  The room was clean; had to ask for a coffee maker and a chair for our room, but staff was very nice about it......we will definitely stay here again.
Had a decent experience at this hotel overall good experience. One thing our room did not come with a remote to the television! Overall it was a good experience!

Fairly nice place to stay considering it is one of few hotels that are actually on the Beach! Rather old, outdated and in need of repair and upgrading but still an OK place to stay for a fair price and have the beach right outside the back entrance.

This property has limited parking available. The low clearance parking garage can not accommodate larger vehicles and the town of Sunset Beach allows overnight parking in very few select spots (up to a mile away walking distance). Hotel staff is unwilling (unable?) to recommend local parking for larger vehicles.

Enjoyed this spot so close to the beach and wish we'd stayed a couple more days.  Older place, not much breakfast, but clean and comfortable beds, helpful staff and, again, when close to beach can pop over there between outings, Disney, etc

We stayed here for 3 nights as we attended a family wedding. It's very modest and a little run down, but it appears they are starting to slowly update it. Our room had 2 queens and a small bathroom with a tub/shower. The sink and counter is outside the bathroom. Check in was easy, free continental breakfast( very basic, no waffle maker, just cold stuff and drinks), free underground onsite parking which you enter from the back. The beach is only steps away, as are restaurants & some shopping. We paid $564.00 through Hotels.com for the 3 nights for 3 people & an infant. The beach & location are great so I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: other than you gave my reserved room away to some one else...
Summary: other than you gave my reserved room away to some one else and a door that would not unlock with my card key,I thank you for that!

My husband and I took our three kids for an overnight trip to the ocean. The hotel was adorable, and the walk to the ocean was REALLY easy with no major roads to cross. The people at the front desk were very kind, helpful, and accommodating. The beds are a little hard, and I would have liked a larger sample of shampoo and conditioner - it wasn't even enough for one person, but those are my only "complaints". Oh and the beach was great, too - not too crowded!

Summary Heading: STAY HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK! Filthy, moldy, dirty! Employee hangs in garage with boyfriend,who lingers around property.
Summary: This review is for room and staff experience only and NOT for proximity to beach. A hotel can be outdated, but should still be clean! Our room, supposedly the "best one available" was the filthiest I have ever been in. The shower was cracked all over and mold was in the grooves of shower door and tub. Pinkish rust/scale was covering showerhead. They clearly do not clean. Floor so filthy the bottoms of our feet were covered in black dirt. Had to walk around in our shoes for the duration of our stay. As for the staff...I will state facts and you can draw your own conclusion (investigation pending). The front desk clerk, Mayra, physically took our credit card and charged all three days in full upon arrival. Most hotels charge at end of stay, in my experience, and only hold card for
You can't get closer to the beach than this.  The hotel is clean, the location is spectacular and the restaurants across the street are delicious.  This is the best location in Orange county.

Stayed here 3 years ago and came back for the unbeatable location.  The room this time was a newly remodeled room and it was fantastic!  Tile flooring that looks like a hard wood, great new bedding, clean and up to date furniture and amenities in room.  The only minor issue was the condensation from the in-room A/C unit dripped a little after we ran it all night.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, even with our unannounced early arrival and need to get into the room to get out to the beach.  I would come back again when our travels bring us back to Southern California.

I realize this is a budget hotel, but I expect at the least a clean room/bathroom. Very outdated and run down. Carpet was dirty and not vacuumed, Bathroom was tiny and disgusting. Very difficult time opening mirrored closet doors. We spilled a water bottle and for the rest of our stay where the wet carpet was made the whole room smell like cat urine. The deluxe continental breakfast was NOT deluxe in any. Will say that parking garage was very convenient with easy access to rooms. Would never stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Decent beachside motel in Huntington Beach
Summary: I needed a place to crash near my office after a long drive, and this fit the bill. Room was decent, large, but has seen better days - carpet was spotted and there was a cigarette hole on the top of the nightstand. Room faced Pacific Coast Highway, with commuter and beach traffic starting at 6am until after 2am. Worst was the in-room coffeemaker - the pot wasn't tall enough to trip the grounds basket lever so coffee could drip into the pot. I ended up with half the coffee in the tray and a scalded finger from trying to fix the basket. Clerk at check-out was disbelieving and didn't seem very concerned about it. It was convenient and nearby, served the purpose.

Summary Heading: Couldn' wait to get out of this hotel
Summary: The location of this hotel is about the only good thing I could praise on this hotel. The desk clerk was obnoxious. The room had a musty smell, not to mention several stains on the carpet and the beddings/towels smelled awful. We were just too tired and it was too late to get a different hotel so we stayed.

This property is always comfortable and clean, not to mention the on-the-beach location cannot be topped.  The staff is consistently courteous and anticipates their guests' needs.  We also had a preview to their soon-to-be refurbished rooms.  (They are BEAUTIFUL, UPSCALE and all wheelchair accessible).  I CANNOT wait to return!!!

First of all, the building itself is pretty ghetto. When you walk in from the parking garage you wait 10 minutes for an elevator that goes up only 2 floors. Check-in was fine. Staff was very nice. However. There was disgusting hairy black mold in all crevices in the bathroom. It looked like the grout hadn't been cleaned since the hotel opened. Sink and tub were not sanitized for our use. As for the room itself there was so much dust I could literally make prints with my fingers. The sliding glass door had so much condensation it looked like someone was constantly taking a shower. The decor was very dated and when you opened the door to the closet, there was a creepy half cut-out wall that looked straight out of a child's nightmare. Though I don't care about those things as much;

Unless you are traveling with a bunch of drunk friends, stay away from this hotel /motel.   It's worth $50 a night at best. Reminds me of the motels you rent by the hour, if you know what I mean. Smells like a damp basement or that moldy smell. Continental breakfast is great if you're 5. Air conditioner is very loud and with the noise from the street you might as well just sleep on the balcony.   The only plus is it is right across from the beach. That was a bonus but the only one. We ended up driving to the Huntington pier and paying for parking as there was much more action, food and fun there (about a 5 minute drive). I could go on but I think you all have gotten my point. Trust me, "Stay away"  P.S. watch the tricky elevator. It's creepy and shuts / opens when you least
In need of urgent up grades! Although, the room was spacious and the breakfast was ok but the carpet needed cleaning also the room needed deodorizing.

Overall I would say this hotel while a tad rundown was very nice. The owner is slowly improving it from what we could tell. The rooms were very clean, but a tad dated and breakfast was more than sufficient for my needs.
A good value. The hotel is aged but clean. We had a beautiful view from our second floor balcony and enjoyed mornings having coffee while watching the surfers
Service was fine. Decor is outdated. Dining area is newly renovated and nice. Walking distance to beach was great!

Summary Heading: Fab location, aging hotel, but getting better.
Summary: This 70s era hotel is being remodeled. It has a great location, right above the Sunset Beach, which is a locals type of place with surfers and dogs and runners. This is not a palm tree vacation idyl.  But the rooms are spacious and those with decks over the parking lot look right out at the beach. The breakfast is adequate and the new breakfast room is very nice. The internet is spotty, but should be getting better as the wiring is replaced and the systems updated.

The property itself is average, it's a little run down, but for the price who cares? We stay here pretty regularly just to get away from the mountains and enjoy the beach, at least every 6-8 weeks we take a trip down to Sunset.  We bring our bikes, and ride all day, up and down the coast, lounge on the beach, and eat at our favorite restaurants..with the money we save, it's no problem to have a $300 dinner at Captain Jacks..which everyone should do at least once,  The staff is super nice at the Travelodge as well, sometimes i think to myself that i might want to stay in a nicer hotel next time, but then i realize that it would cut into my spending money, and why would I want to do that? We're here for a good time,..not a long time. :)

Summary Heading: my family and I had  a great time ,it was close to the...
Summary: my family and I had  a great time ,it was close to the beach ,fast food and dine in restaurants. Everything we needed was with in walking distance great way to get around in Cali.

Summary Heading: Lodge could  use some remodeling!!!  and the continental...
Summary: Lodge could  use some remodeling!!!  and the continental breakfast could definately be better.  The customer service was excellent, look forward to returning.

Location was great and the hotel itself though dated in appearance is clean and comfortable. However the continental breakfast was lacking as my travel mates and I have dairy and wheat allergies thus aside from an apple or banana we were very limited on what we could have for breakfast. I frequent hotels for both work and pleasure on a regular basis and the breakfast at this location provided the least selection of options.

This was our second stay here, and it's just fine for what we wanted. The location in perfect for us.  It's a bit traffic noisy, but the comfortable beds make up for it. We stayed two nights and it was just lovely.

Summary Heading: Bad Hotel - Good View and Beach Access
Summary: Probably the worst $200 hotel I've stayed at.  No hot water despite multiple complaints over a 12 day stay.  Stains in the carpet.  Door lock card reader didn't work 3/4 of the time and had to keep getting new key cards.  Walls very thin.  Bathroom smelled like a sewer.  Half the outlets in the room didn't function.  Easy beach access and great view of the water though.

We went in mid April which is off season. The hotel was quiet, and the staff was friendly. You have a nice view from the ocean view rooms and the hotel is near a nice section of beach. It's being renovated and half the hotel is closed, but it is outdated and needs the update.

It is nice to be just next to the beach. You walk down, have fun, come back when you're done.   Everything else stinks, some of it is literal. The view is not that great, you get either a parking lot with some beach in the distance, or a busy PCH.  The water in the shower smells like sulfur (and so will you).  The rooms are horribly outdated.   However, there are some good restaurants are just a mile north.

So.....the positive first. It's right next to the beach. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean! And they are remodeling so it has to get better!  Now the not so positive... It is soo dated. It makes a motel 6 look fabulous. They still have the original  hair dyers on the walls and they are pretty sad. It has green carpet and popcorn ceilings.  Oh and the water smells terrible and it makes the whole room stink like sulfur when you take a shower.

Loved this hotel.  So close to the beach !!  Awesome beds  !! Very comfortable .   Close to good restaurants. Construction noise not a problem.  A little worn, but worth staying.  My family really enjoyed staying here.

Summary Heading: A diamond in the rough... for me anyway
Summary: To be honest, I thought long and hard about whether to do a review because I have been coming to this hotel for years, and it is my hole in the wall oasis.  But if you are more about the location and view than a fancy lobby and marble fixtures, this place is for you.  Located right on Pac Coast Hwy in Sunset Beach, this is one of my favorite hotels.  The rooms are huge, and getting a view room is a must as they have balconies overlooking sunset beach park and the ocean.  Now, the place could use a remodel, but it is clean and the staff is GREAT!

Summary Heading: Best No Frills Deal on the Beach
Summary: It's an older building so it's not in perfect shape. But our room was super-clean, beds were very comfortable, water pressure was great. Covered parking was great. We had a nice little balcony overlooking the beach; we left the door open and fell asleep to the waves. However, the buses start early, as do the visitors to the public parking just below. They woke us up. Breakfast was as basic as they get, but sufficient. Take some fruit to snack on later! Or go to Jack in the Box directly next door. Seems that they are remodeling. Saw workers but never heard any noise while we were there. Location, as far as on the beach was nice. But it you're there for nightlife, and/or shopping, not much within walking distance.  We were given a wi-fi password, but used our own data, so can't

Was not sure what to expect, prices are so high along the ocean, but it was recommended to us and we sure are glad we trusted them.....the most comfortable beds with an open sliding door to the sound of the ocean waves.....

Summary Heading: A Travelodge but.............On The Beach !,, would recommend..
Summary: It's right on the beach !!!!! good parking, friendly staff. Building was a bit tired but it's getting renovated . A 2 min drive from downtown Huntington beach where there are restaurants, bars , shops etc.   Large rooms. It was ideal for my business trip.

Arrived to this ideal "location" (could truly roll onto the sand from the balcony w/exception of parking lot in between..) not knowing there was construction going on in the garage, and on one of the upper floors for renovations.Travel Lodge did not list this declaration on their website, nor did the hotel booking agent mention this via phone. The front desk staff were nice, however replied with "well, no one else is complaining. we're doing this to better the hotel". Great, however it's a common courtesy notice for guests when booking their reservation to know as many variables as possible. The other down faults of this beach side hotel- buses loop through the parking lot on a half hour basis during the day; the bathroom fan is louder than a Lamborghini and you can hear the

The location was very nice, you can see the ocean unhindered. Overall cleanliness was fine. Mya (the night receptionist) was very, very pleasant to work with. We did have a problem with the television at one point and it required the cable box to be replaced. Sadly, the night receptionist was the only one available in the evening, so it meant she had to leave her post at the desk, and come to our room with the replacement box. Then she didn't have tools to uncouple the cabling, so I went to my car to get tools to finish the job. (This was not a real problem to me, she did do what was necessary to correct the problem in the long run. But it would have been nice to have one more person working in the early and later evening so it wouldn't have been all on one person.) The last

Location #1: You can walk to the beach without having to cross a major highway. Big plus! Location #2: It's easy to access from the Pacific Coast Highway at Warner Street. Location #3: It's right across the street from the wonderful Golden Olive restaurant. Also a big plus!  There were downsides, alas. The breakfast was all sweet things, mostly plastic-wrapped pastries. I opted for the unsweetened oatmeal, but they ran out of that by the third morning. On the plus side, the yogurt was naturally sweetened instead of gunked up with artificial sugar substitutes. Coffee was about all I could stomach after they ran out of oatmeal, but they did at least have fresh fruit, which was good but not sufficiently filling all by itself. (Unfortunately the Golden Olive does not serve

Staffs and customers are well-cared for customer at this location.  Often desired ocean-front hotel and this Travelodge is just walking distance to the beach.  Negative about this hotel is that rate overprice for the condition of the hotel.  Price-wise overate - although positive side is that walking distance to the beach.  Dr. Xiong

Great friendly staff. Great location, the beach is right across the lot which was awesome with a 3yr old and 6 month. great view.  We were skeptical when we first pulled into the garage but glad we stay and would love to stay again.

The room is out dated, along with out dated appliances. Half the outlets did not work. I told the front desk and they said they would check the breaker. Queen size beds are more like full size beds, not your ordinary queen size. Snack bar was located in back of hotel. I wouldn't have even known it was there unless I looked around. The smell was dusty and old.

I've stayed at and reviewed this property before and keep going back. It's somewhat outdated and the bathrooms are tiny as far as cons go but the rooms are clean and its 60 seconds from the property to the ocean on foot! They just added a beautiful new breakfast room and the place is being refreshed in stages. I only hope it retains its laid back beach charm and the prices remain reasonable. My only suggestion would be less firm mattresses as part of the refresh.

Very, very nice Travelodge. Pleasantly surprised. Very large room with a balcony that was the length of the room.  Great view of the Pacific.  There's a parking lot/park/houses also across the street, but did not deter the view. Being on the back side/ocean view, there was very little traffic noise from the PCH. Quiet, even with a Jack-in-the-Box right next door. At first, I'd thought the price was a little high for a Travelodge, but I could not have picked a better place to stay in Sunset Beach. Short drive to Huntington Beach for dinner.  It's a little out of the way for a pre/post-cruise stay, but, again, wasn't a bad drive to cruise terminal the next morning. The front desk crew were very friendly, and unfortunately, I did not get their names. I would definitely stay here

The bathroom was terrible! The sink is in the room and not with the toilet and shower. If you are trying to get ready in the morning and the other person with you is still asleep ...they won't be for long. By time you turn the light on at the sink...then they will be awake..no way to get light at the sink without waking them. Hotel needs a lot of upgrading.

the view was ok,  couldn't really stay outside and try to enjoy it because there was a bunch of people in their cars either doing drugs or having sex in the parking lot right next to the beach/in front of hotel...

Summary Heading: NEEDS Remodeling!!! Do not recommend this hotel
Summary: Beds were hard and uncomfortable, shower nozzle was moldy, room was smelly (like mold and cigarettes) , and pillows were cheap and uncomfortable. Would not recommend staying at this hotel!

Summary Heading: Location. Location. Location.  It's so nice to stay in a...
Summary: Location. Location. Location.  It's so nice to stay in a place that has easy access to the beach.  It's an older property without the glitz.  I just was looking for a place to rest after a day a the beach.  This it.  Clean.  Comfortable.  No frills.  Affordable.  And close to sand and sea!  Sunset Beach is just across the beach parking lot.  The front desk staff was friendly and courteous.  There's a Jack in the Box next door and a liquor store across the street.   I'll be back.

The hotel lobby is non existent; the breakfast should have been called "snacks" , the hotel is very run down! Customer service is terrible; the hotel main door can only accessed by a buzzer that often no one answered; the back doors were left wide open at night!

Hotel was very dated but fit in with the décor of an old beach town like Sunset Beach.  No Frills.  Just the basics.  A great location just one parking lot from the beach.  "Ocean view" balcony overlooked a parking lot as well as the ocean in the background.

This hotel was fantastic. Room had view of ocean. Reasonable price for an oceanfront room in southern california (had 15% discount through internet booking). Parking was covered and very secure.  All of the staff were fantastic. Breadfast was great and there was plenty of food and it was out past ten a.m. Clean room. Immaculate! Walk to beach. Bike path is right there as well. I will definitely stay there again.  Wish all the hotels that i booked sight unseen were this nice.

The hotel itself was fine, very dated, but maintained. The rooms were hard to find, they didn't go in order. We stayed in 220 but we had to pass 218, 219, 221, 222 and then our room. Very confusing and after being in the car all day with a 3 yr old it was not fun. The parking it great because it's right there and in a garage. The beach access is awesome but I don't know if it is worth it. The breakfast in the morning had all packaged processed foods, some fruit and microwave stuff. Not impressed. Our room smelled like old urine. It was pretty bad.

Summary Heading: Returning to So Cal Beach trip
Summary: I return to this location because of the access to the beach.  Also, what I thought from my prior visit under Ramada for the breakfast value, which changed ...no more Egg mcmuffin...that was a huge factor for me. So I ended up grocery shopping instead.   The hotel needs a facelift,  my room was non-smoking but it still reeked of old cigarettes.   I noticed my coffee maker after each use was not cleaned.  The tray/ice bucket were dusty/dirty, even after I moved it off of refrigerator so the maid would at least wipe it down.   The maintenance worker was very pleasant when he came in to help me with the tv...the fact that a guest has to use two remotes is ridiculous.  But my AC was fixed, but never explained to me why it stopped working, in case, I did something wrong.   Someone

The location is awesome in relationship to sunset beach. However it advertises 2 queen beds in the room and it was 2 doubles. As I am 6'5 this was very snug for my wife and myself. Our balcony had an awesome view of the beachh.

Summary Heading: The beachfront location is not worth the terrible service
Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at the Travelodge in Sunset and we will never go back (we live abroad and come in every few months to visit my parents who live nearby). The service is terrible, the hotel is run-down and a beachfront room is an additional $30 on arrival. The first time we booked this hotel after finding a special online; when we arrived, the owner didn't want to honor the deal. We had to come back several times and give him more information and print out more things and were still charged. This time, I thought I left my charger. A few days later I came back and he brought a bag of chargers out and even after I gave him all of my information about the dates I had stayed, room number, etc, the owner still wouldn't work with me, he told me to check back later

This is an older motel that has been nicely maintained, and that has a fantastic location ON THE BEACH !  The rooms a very large, and all have a coffee machine and a refrigerator.  The covered underground parking is a definite plus.  The rooms are very clean, and the staff are great.  A good value for the money.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel on our trip - route 66
Summary: The only good thing was the view and naar the beach. Room was not clean, staff was not friendly and the breakfast was terrible. And the price of this hotel, compare the anemies, way to high. Don' t recommended this hotel to anybody.

We only stayed one night and chose this place due to the great location right by the beach for a decent price. The room itself is very dated and it obviously has not been very well taken care of. It needs a makeover badly.

Summary Heading: We Enjoyed Our Stay Very Much
Summary: I am giving 5 stars for two reasons: location and the very sweet and helpful staff.  We were here a few weeks ago for a 52 high school reunion (yes, omg, we are all 70 years old!) and checked out a bunch of places beforehand before choosing this one.  As far as I could tell, this is the only place in the immediate area that is right on the beach.  This makes a big difference, folks!  The other motels nearby are across the Pacific Coast Hwy, meaning, you have to cross it to get to the beach.  It is so worth it to be on the beach side of the highway.  Also, spend the extra little bit and get an ocean-front room - it is so nice to have that view, rather than the highway.  Reason number two is the very friendly and helpful staff, especially Myra who checked us in, and I hope I am

Pros:  Good location Good covered parking Free HBO (After you figure out how to access it) Cons: There are many reasons to choose a different hotel, here are a few... *This is a rundown hotel in desperate need of regular maintenance and renovation. *The security is poor to non existant- the glass sliding door in my "King Ocean Front View" room would not lock. The Beach-side exit door of the hotel would not lock, or even close! *My  "bathroom" had a toilet, bath/shower but no sink. The sink is located in the bedroom. *My stay was a Tuesday night in September so my "free breakfast" was pitiful compared to the hot breakfast with a varied selection they must offer in prime season. This is well and good except the manager did not tell me this when I upgraded my room from standard to

I was on business in Long Beach and moved to this hotel for the last day so I could surf the next day before I left. The location is excellent right next to Sunset beach and right on the PCH (hwy 1).  You literally walk out the door and across a parking lot and you are in the sand.  I decided to save the money and take a highway room instead of a more expensive ocean view room because I didn't need to be looking at the ocean I needed to be in it.  I read a review somewhere that said to be sure to get an ocean view room because the other side was noisy due to the Pacific Coast Highway frontage but there is a stop light right on the corner so it's not like it's a major highway.  I didn't hear any traffic noise at all ever.    The room was clean and had plenty of space to spread
He and his whole staff. Absolutely a wonderful group of people. Very professional. A great experience for me.

Summary Heading: Great people but old, old, old
Summary: When we had to drive around the building and enter the below ground garage I was a bit leery and it's pretty dark with no security cameras that I could actually see.  We found an entrance door where there was either stairs or an elevator.  We took the elevator but it was creeky and the door opens while still in motion. We guessed the desk would be on first floor as there was no signage anywhere.  Both of the people we dealt with at the desk were very pleasant.  However, for what we paid I expected a little bit better.  The overall smell is just "old".  The bathroom is VERY small and if you're taller than 5' you will have to bend over in shower as the shower head is very low.  The balcony with a view is also very small with a plastic table and two plastic chairs.  The air
Get the oceanview room.  Great balcony to people watch, drink, eat, relax with ocean breeze.  Walk directly onto beach.  We had an excellent stay.
Awesome location and ocean views.  Very pleasant experience that I highly recommend to all that travel in or thru the Sunset Beach and/or Huntington Beach area.

My husband and I came from Az to Ca on a business trip that was very short notice. We got into the area about 2:30 am from the drive. We arrived at the hotel, had no idea how to enter it. You had to drive around the building and enter a dark and gloomy garage and there was a door that lead to stairs that took you to the first floor office. When we get to the desk the employee tells us he had to cancel our room because the credit card did not go through (my husband used the expired card and not the new one when he booked room online). They had all my contact information, phone, email etc and did not contact us to let us know there was a problem. We didn't know if we were going to get to stay or if they were going to raise the price. He did give us the rate from the internet so we

My friend and I were celebrating her birthday in Huntington Beach. We needed a last minute hotel room and this was the best deal we could find. The hotel is only steps away from the beach. The rooms are decent and clean. There was plenty of towels and even a mini fridge. The décor is not as fancy as other hotels I have stayed at but for the price we thought it was good enough. There was free Wi-Fi and we also got complimentary breakfast items like muffins, yogurt, bananas and juice. I would definitely stay here again.

We had a balcony room with a view of the beach which was only across the street which wasn't too busy to cross.  The room spacious.  The only complaint is that the carpets were dirty, the outdoor shower wasn't working, so we were bringing more sand into the building.  Breakfast was cereal, fruit, yogurt and wrapped pastries.  Overall it was a good value for the location.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, not so nice managment.
Summary: Melody and I had a great time sun tanning and being able to run back to the room whenever we wanted or needed. Management was not very nice though.
Might not be 5 Star worthy but well worth the money to be right on the Beach! Staff is very friendly!
It's not a new building but it's a great location if you want a easy beach access , easy parking. Easy to get to and great views from the balcony.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, little bit old ... but
Summary: ... we stay two nights and they didn't clean up the room. Can't believe that the frontdesk woman not interested in this situation. Never stay in any Travelodge again. For this prize I can found better Hotel with daily roomservice.

Summary Heading: Ocean View But Not Much Else!
Summary: This property is oceanfront with great views from the balcony (if you are on the ocean side of the property).  The location is wonderful- but the hotel needs a major upgrade as it looks terrible both outside and inside the rooms in the hallways!  Breakfast selections were limited and not very appealing.

Still being jet-lagged from arriving at LAX the day before from Europe we arrived early (1 pm) at the Travelodge Ocean Front in Sunset Beach. After being told that this was the time for check out, not check in (3 pm), we were offered to leave our luggage at the reception and that our room will be ready at 2 pm. So we decided to take just a few steps and wait on the beach. Yes the hotel and the rooms are not brand new, but there's everything you need to enjoy a stay on the beach... which is of course the beach! The staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast is basic - but why not take it out... for just a few steps... and enjoy breakfast at the beach!

Summary Heading: Hotel is in dire need of updating.  Bathroom was dirty and...
Summary: Hotel is in dire need of updating.  Bathroom was dirty and mold around the shower.  Carpet was dirty and hallway furnishings were outdated and unusable.
needed a hotel close to beach and family.  This hotel provided both at a reasonable cost.  Easy access to attractions as well.

This was a Birthday Trip for me and my husband. The rooms smelled and when we checked in they gave us a street front room. I called to see how much it would be to get beach front room and was $50 more a night, on a tuesday! Really this is not a $200 a night room!   The service was very slow, we stayed 2 nights and our room was not cleaned until almost 4pm.   When we left we forgot 2 shirts and the manager called while we were on the road back to Las Vegas so we could not answer. When I got home I called and they had no clue about our shirts and I was told I would have to call back on Saturday and talk to a manager. Then someone said "oh we do have their shirts" I asked how if I could give them my credit card and the could charge it for shipping, so they could send our stuff to

Beautiful ocean view on a non smoking floor, guess this only means cigarettes because the people next door smoked pot on the balcony every morning and evening. I paid for an ocean view and didn't want to have to close the balcony doors! Other than that it was wonderful,close to the beach,walking distance to fast food areas or a short drive to restaurants. highly recommend Fish Camp restaurant for dinner.

Very noisy from 7:30am-4:00pm and bad odor coming from the street repairs going on outside my balcony. We had the end room #125 on that side of the building. Never told of this construction project !! The room itself had issues. No screen door for balcony slider. Cable wire for TV not properly installed so we would lose picture. Had to call the front desk to try to fix problem but they could not. Thought I would fall through shower/tub bottom which needs to be replaced. Draw curtain to balcony sliding glass door was ragged and dirty. Room should be painted. This room rate was 2 times more than Super 8 and I received no discount for the problems I incurred. Bad business !!!

This hotel is in a great location steps from the beach and was well priced. The room was very clean but the building is in a desperate need of an update. 1982 called and it wants it's furniture back. Bed was too hard for my tastes and when we showed up after 4 our room was still not ready. The potential for this location is immense and sadly not realized.

This is an older hotel, needs a few cosmetic things done, but overall nice.  This is our second stay with them, everyone is very helpful, rooms are clean and neat.  We have only had one incident during our two stays and the hotel was very anxious to make things right.  I would stay again, the convenience of the location is wonderful.

Just came back from a three day beach trip to Sunset-Huntington Beach. I have stayed here several times over the past few years.  Why do I come back? It's right on the beach...  Easy access around Orange County... Lots of fun, small restaurants on PCH you can walk to... And it's clean. This time I had twelve family members (including 5 small children) in three ocean facing rooms, which are great for watching the sunsets. The management was pleasant, rooms clean, and we had a great time. Yes, it's an older hotel. Yes, it has undergone renovation, but... It's great if you want beach, sand, surf, and not break the bank! We are on the beach all day, and we also use the fire pits at the beach in the evenings If you want a resort-spa experience, go somewhere else. If you want a nice

Good for one or two nights and right on the beach.   Could definitely use some updating,  but it is clean and the staff was nice.   Shower was a bit short for anyone over 5'4".   Nice local bar/restaurant two blocks away and was surprised that even with Pacific Coast Highway right outside the window (no beach view rooms were available), it wasn't too noisy. We were however in the second floor.    The breakfast is very basic, coffee and muffins or breakfast bars or apples and bananas.

While this hotel had some really great points i.e., right on the beach, free parking, friendly staff, overall cleanliness, I can only give it a poor rating.  I stayed here with my two daughters on 7/23/14.  As soon as we entered the room, there was an overpowering (not exaggerating) smell of mildew and the area around the sink (it was inside the room, not the bathroom) was soaking wet. We called the front desk and asked for a new room but there weren't any available.  The person who I assumed was the Manager and a maintenance man came in and sprayed some air freshener, but it didn't help.  We put up with it because it was too late to go somewhere else and we were only there for one night.  I guess if I were part of the management team, I would make sure that room did not get

Summary Heading: Ocean view with beach access and handicap accessible
Summary: We were looking for a room with an ocean view and to have beach access. Thankfully we found this hotel. It is older, but the rooms are very soundproof. We paid the extra to have ocean view. The handicap rooms are adequate.  We thankfully got one with the beds on the north wall so I could look at the beach from bed. The private balconies are nice with chairs and a table. Several rooms have larger balconies with a lounge chair and a larger table--we had family in one and enjoyed their balcony. The elevator is a bit slow, but it works, and if there is a problem with the room, the staff is very attentive to making sure things are taken care of--they want 'happy campers'. For the price it is a GREAT deal.

Granted that the hotel is older, and they are doing repairs, for the price and the location you could not do any better.  Our room overlooked Bolsa Chica Beach and we enjoyed hearing the surf.  They have covered/underground parking and it has security cameras so we felt safe.

The hotel overall is not a bad place. My room was very clean with ocean view, parking is easy access to the beach is easy too. We had fun but we could not watch the sunset or the sunrise since it was cloudy.

4 of us. 2 children 8 and 10..they loved the beach and being just across the street from it....we had great time. Friendly staff..reasonable price for beach..limited breakfast...old hotel but clean..we were happy

If you are looking for a perfect place to stay in Sunset Beach (between Long Beach and Huntington Beach), this is it.  The hotel is virtually right on the beach.  We've stayed here twice and LOVE it.  We will definitely be back again.  The staff is friendly, the breakfast just what you need, the location perfect and the rooms clean

I stayed here with my family Saturday night and we enjoyed the Beach View Room, We sit out on our private balcony watching the traffic and enjoying the nice weather, The Free Breakfast  had Jimmy Dean's cheese sausage biscuit , cereal, honey buns.  Not bad for the price we paid. I felt safe walking around with my family. It was a great location and they had clean rooms. It was the perfect location watching the sunset. My 7 year old son woke up early the next morning and found plenty of seashells.

While some of the reviews have read as unfavorable, I would suggest quite the opposite. While this isn't a 4 star place by far, it is clean and so very close to the beach. Room 211 has a fabulous view. The shower heads are mounted a bit low but not so much that they don't function. Staff was pleasant and helpful when needed.  It was a super great place to stay. If you are looking for upscale and posh go somewhere else but if you just need a place to lay your head at night and to wake up to the sound of the ocean then this is your place!! My only suggestion is that there be screen doors installed on balcony so that the doors can be left open all night without fear of pigeons deciding to room with you!

This hotel has a fantastic location. It's right on the Pacific Coast Highway in Sunset Beach, Orange County, CA. The room was spacious with comfortable beds and a good shower. The service was great and very prompt. The only drawback was the breakfast. They offered small boxes of cereal, oatmeal, small yogurts and packaged pastries. They did have fresh fruit but only tiny cartons of orange and apple juice. They ran out of items and you had to ask for more to be put on the buffet.

My friend told me about this place and that it was really on the beach and for the price, I had to check it out for myself.  She was right! You walk out, across a parking lot and you are on the beach!  That in itself may be enough for you.  The hotel was recently renovated, I believe.  Our room was nice and I loved the bed!  The bathroom was very small with the sink on the outside of the toilet/shower area, which was fine for me.  Our room faced the street which was very noisy and nothing worth looking at!  However I know they have some rooms that face the ocean so I would probably guess the view is far better from those rooms.  The breakfast was good...lots of variety and breakfast sandwiches that could be heated in the microwave.  I would definitely stay here again!

This is an excellent location for the beach and plenty of nearby things to do. The staff and management were excellent and very accommodating for our requests. There is a nice breakfast bar and a safe place to park your vehicle.  The only negative is the handicap room lacks safety features and the electric outlets need replaced to hold the plug in place. It is very difficult to get in and out of the shower and the stool is too low.  The overall compliments are good.

Summary Heading: location to beach is the only positive
Summary: This hotel has minimal offerings.  It is very, very basic with poor service.  Upon greeting, I was offered an upgraded room for a significant price increase.  The breakfast was fair, typical confidential breakfast with only packaged pastries and some cold cereals.  The room are very outdated with significant mold and mildew.  As for the nonsmoking, not so much.  The staff and guests smoke in the stairwell which seeps into the ac air intake.  I suggest this hotel for beach access only but you could find a lot better bang for your buck just up the road just as convienent  beach location

Summary Heading: Nice location, hotel needs some updates
Summary: Good value for location/cost.  The facade and interior of a property like this could use updating and the bathroom is really small.

Summary Heading: Alright Place; Manager does not know customer service
Summary: The room was ok; great view of the ocean. YOU HAVE TO STAY ON THE OCEAN SIDE DON'T EVEN BOTHER STAYING ON THE OTHER SIDE WAY TOO LOUD FROM THE ROAD AT NIGHT.   The Manager needs to take some customer service courses; he is rude.   The rest of the staff was really nice.   The cleaning service came everyday and pretty much only made the bed and replaced the towels. They did not clean up the balcony or obvious trash.

Very nice staff and helpful. The room we had had private balcony over looking the beach. The hotel is nothing fancy and old style but so is everything else in Sunset Beach. If your looking for fancy your gona pay a very high price but if your there to enjoy the beach and down home people you will love it..And parking very safe and close.

I stay here every time I need my beach fix. The easy access to the ocean is perfect for my kids and I to hit the beach. Staff is friendly. Rooms are good enough for us. Its a little older property, but it is always clean and comfortable. There are food options within walking distance and their continental breakfast is just right to start the day. I highly reccomend the oceanfront rooms, as the ones facing the street are noisier at night. The views are great and being able to relax on the patio after the kids go to sleep is the perfect end to the day. If you are looking for something budget friendly with beach access, this place is a hidden gem.

Hotel is very tired and in need of a re-do inside and out. However, a great location and a very good price for the location! We were there for a wedding and it definitely met our needs. I would recommend for location and the best price! It could rate much higher and demand a higher price with a facelift. If you are looking for location, location, location this is your place. If you're looking for luxury look elsewhere!

This hotel is badly in need of renovations. I stayed here twice about a month apart when my house was being remodeled. The rooms are old and out dated the beds uncomfortable no amenities but who complains about a view of the beach from the ocean side rooms?   The only reason to stay is the location the staff for the most part are fairly pleasant.  The fridge did not work half the light bulbs burned out you might as well forget about heating (a rusty radiator on the wall). But step out on to the balcony and enjoy the view!   Where can you get an ocean view room for under $200 a night?  Advice stay here for the location,  go out a lot.

Location is great, had parking garage, cant beat the price for being on the beach  I would like to see the rooms with new carpet and drapes . Nice new flat screen tv. Kids loved the breakfast and it was free. If they do upgrade the rooms, rhe prices would probably go up aa well. Staff was very friendly

We booked this stay online about 5 days prior to arriving. When we got there, they let us know the electricity would be out from 10 pm - 6 am and we were welcome to go elsewhere if we wanted. Where were we going to go after we were already there? The guy at the desk told us they had originally taken the date down from the website but the owner told them to put them back up to still get guests to come despite lack of electricity. I felt tricked. Their computer systems are antiquated, the elevator inspection date expired, and the next day breakfast was served with the milk, yogurt, etc. that had been in refrigerators that had no electricity from 10-6. The location is nice, but the owner does not care about the guests - that was made very clear.

Other than the fact that the hotel is next to the beach...its was HORRIBLE. The hotel itself was outdated, dark and damp. The rooms that I booked were by the pacific highway, so during the day you were able to hear the traffic, especially in the morning, when you're trying to sleep in. The rooms were dark and 1 out of the 2 rooms that I booked smelled like wet, damp dirty feet/carpet....GROSS....There aren't really any good place to eat nearby, I drove 30mins to downtown Disney for a meal with my family. Don't get fooled by the "Breakfast" offered, it was all prepackaged pastry similar to the ones found in a gas station. If you're looking for a cheap one-night stay just for the beach, then its probably a good choice, I would probably make sure its a room away from the main
Overall the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom need a little TLC. The tub needed some help with the plumbing. Location was great.
I did not see not one room.cleaner ..i stay for 4 nights not one person cleaned my room or change my towels ..the room smelled horrible.i had to go buy airfreshener ..worst vacation of my life

The location worked great being close to Bolsa Chica State Beach and ecological reserve but if you need a wheelchair accessible room I don't suggest the travel lodge. Aside from the Decore being outdated the Access features were very limited. Probably one of the least accessible rooms I stayed in and I stayed in hundreds
This hotel was fantastic for the price!  We were right on the beach with a balcony to watch the sunset from.  We really enjoyed the location and had a great affordable vacation.

This was definitely one of the most interesting hotel stays I’ve ever had.  When we checked in, we were told that So Cal Edison would be turning off the power between the hours of 10PM and 5:45 AM, and were handed a package of “glow sticks” in order to maneuver around our hotel in the dark.  Having made our reservations month in advance, I found it a bit disappointing that we had not been forewarned.   The man at the front desk told me I had reserved my room online for only one person (it was a room with a king size bed), and since there was two of us staying in the room there was supposed to be an extra charge, but he would waive the extra charge because of the power issues.  Since when is there EVER an extra charge for a second person in a king room?  It’s one thing to not

This hotel is great for the price.  The manager Nazrul is really nice and helpful. It's an older hotel but the accommodations are still more than adequate and comfortable.  I was hoping the beach was closer, I thought this hotel was literally on the sand but it's set farther back.  Still, it's a quick 2 min walk to the water and the views are great.

The bathrooms were tiny but who cares when your main objective is to enjoy the amazing views and relax. Could have had an extra outlet and alternate switches for lighting. One of the best hotels out of the 4 we stayed at. No complaints just a little helpful hint on making the stay and rooms even better! Maybe a sliding screen door so the balcony door can remain open for listening to waves at night and takin in the ocean view

Right on the beach and at the head of a bike/walking/jogging trail.  Very relaxing stay with ocean view on patio.  Nice breakfast and great parking.  Close to many stores/restaurants.  Had a great time.
great location, clean, staff polite and accommodating, older structure but well maintained, parking convenient.

Summary Heading: Great/Fantastic Location!  You can't beat it for the price...
Summary: Great/Fantastic Location!  You can't beat it for the price!  Great front desk clerk, Khan, and maid service so nice.  Really nice breakfast too - could use more coffee in the room though but otherwise terrific place!

Summary Heading: the only reason to stay here is for the closeness to Sunset...
Summary: the only reason to stay here is for the closeness to Sunset Beach.  we were in the area for the funeral and thought the beach would be comforting, which it was.  the furniture was dusty and the room smelled horrible until we aired it out.  I'm sure the age of the hotel and the moisture contribute to the smell .  we were not expecting a great place as I had stayed here before while attending another funeral.  the beach is the only reason to be here.

We had an oceanview room but our view also overlooked the busy parking lot along with the circle drive where all the buses stop.  We stayed over a weekend and you could hear noise from the parking lot from very early hours to very late hours.  On the positive side, it is a quick walk to the beach.  Our room was big enough for a rollaway, however, the bathroom was like a closet.  All appeared to be clean which is most important to me.  One of the outlets did spark when we attempted to plug in our electronics.  We asked to have a couple of extra blankets but all they had was one.  Staff was always pleasant and one of the ladies running the morning breakfast was very friendly and continually kept everything stocked.  The other breakfast staff we encountered did not.  Overall, it
Recently stayed at the Travelodge Huntington Sunset Beach.  Had a nice big room and balcony with a perfect ocean view.  The staff were all nice and helpful.  I will definitely stay there again !!

If you want on the beach accommodations this is it. If you are looking for posh socal hotel...... Keep looking. Rooms are dated but are clean and well appointed.  Being right on the PCH its noisy but not soo much so that it effects sleep. Overall very satisfied with the room and hotel. Oh yea and killer continental b-fast.
Great place to stay, I recomend that you get a room with the balcony, the views are great. Close to the beach. Enjoy

Summary Heading: A great, peaceful place to stay!
Summary: The decor is dated, but I wasn't expecting The Ritz. Everything (the room, the inside, the outside) was in great working condition. The bed was comfortable and everything was pretty clean. I'm not sure about the carpet though because I am in the habit of always wearing slippers in the room. The beachfront room was so peaceful. It's amazing to walk out of the room, walk for two minutes (if even that) and be on a beautiful beach. Sunset beach was quiet - just what I was looking for. If you need a city bus, it's right there too. The breakfast provided by the hotel was nothing fancy, but it was displayed nicely and lots of variety. I really appreciated a place with free breakfast because it saved our family about $25 that we'd have to spend on food elsewhere. It's a great spot,
The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and the staff were very friendly & accommodating.

Can of the sea exposed funky motels you don't see much anymore bt the sercie was great and it is on the beach for all intents and purposes. Balcony view of the sunset and perfect starting point for beach run or walk. Would do it again if the need to stay over in that area came up.

There was a very loud noise with the toilet flush.The outside of the building could use some attention to wires and missing fixtures.  Great location next to the beach.  Good value for the price.  We will return.

yes it is right by the beach....but was too uncomfortable to enjoy. could not wait to get out of there. has probably never been updated. hotel  was extremely ooutdated. bathroom small as an airplane bathroom..good luck taking a shower if you are over 5 ft tall. will not recommend to anyone and will never think about staying here again..unfortunate because the location is convenient.

Summary Heading: Staff was not personable or caring at all upon check in...
Summary: Staff was not personable or caring at all upon check in, nor informative. Rooms not in acceptable cleanliness order. Bedding and carpet need to be replaced. Breakfast option idea is good, but coffee and pastry quality are poor. Asked for 2 extra blankets  after bout 5-10 minutes, was given one, as staff could not locate another. Location is the greatest. Suggest better qualified staff & a bit of updating in order to recive more business. Frequented other products of Wyndham & they were no where near this poor of quality. Have photos if needed. Believe we were double charged additional for ocean front room, as previously booked on phone prior to check in.
Could be updated with new furniture and appliances. Check in was a negative experience. Clean/average room
Good, clean room. Great size and a lovely view of the beach. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast offers a fantastic selection too

The Travelodge is an old gal that is beginning to show her age.  However she still sits on the best beach location in the area.  Two minutes from motel steps to the sand.  This appears the thing that most guests overlook when it comes to appearence.  Staff very friendly.  Beds comfy.Breakfast basic with large selection. Downside:  The hard to operate T.V. sets in each room takes you back to the dawn of television.Nothing has been improved.  The sets are small and old.  This is the second time our group has stayed at the Travelodge so there is enough upturns to keep us coming back.

Summary Heading: Very nice location and friendly staff.  Older rooms but...
Summary: Very nice location and friendly staff.  Older rooms but clean. This travelodge has been there since I was a kid.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay by the beach with ocean view!
Summary: Great spot with a fabulous view of the ocean, large balcony, large room and fantastic breakfast in the morning.  The sink is outside of the bathroom and right in the room.  That was the only downside.  And, the switch to the bathroom was outside by the front door - a little odd.  But, overall, for the price, it was a great stay.  Nice firm beds and quick getaway.  We were walking distance to many restaurants and bars in Sunset Beach.

This Travelodge property is well maintained, very comfortable and the Staff is friendly.  The bed was really comfortable.  The location is marvelous, we could sit on our small balcony or lay in bed and enjoy a beautiful view of the ocean and the surfers waiting to catch a wave.  We only have a few yards to walk in order to get our feet wet in the Pacific Ocean.  We loved it!  Great getaway.

This hotel is right on the beach in beautiful, Southern California.  It is an old hotel and pretty out dated but clean and comfortable, especially for the price.  My family, of 2 adults and 4 children, got 2 rooms here, with 2 queen beds in each.  The hotel provides a free breakfast which we took out to the beach every morning to watch the surfers, pelicans and even dolphins.  The hotel has free parking and free internet.  There is a small shopping center across the street that has a couple small restaurants, a surf shop, gas station, and liquor store.  The restaurant, Tsumani's, across the street, is fantastic.

We chose the Sunset Beach location  because it was close to the beach and the other things we wanted to do during our trip. Rooms are nice and clean with the basic things. The best part was the balcony looking out to the ocean. We got an upgrade because we wnted to see the ocean. We went down for our complimentary breakfast every morning and brought it back  to eat on the balcony. Beautiful. Definitely would come back.
Enjoyed our stay, staff was great. Loved the location. First time at a Travelodge will stay here again.

Summary Heading: My first time to Long Beach..
Summary: This hotel is an older down to earth place. The location was super.. I had a great time at nearby restuarants n clubs.. It was within a rocks throw of the beach.. I used my reward points for my stay so I was ever so happy with my stay..

This is an older structure and could use some upgrades to the units like the TV's and plumbing fixtures (had trouble with sink faucet and shower head is really low on the wall) but having the beach within walking distance is great!

Summary Heading: We found a perfect little get away!
Summary: This place was great! It's a older hotel so don't expect the Hilton. View was spectacular! Breakfast bar was great! Staff goes way beyond what they are paid to do! We're going back for two weeks next time!!
I love this hotel and stay here every time I visit. The view is wonderful, manager and staff always polite and efficient and helpful, and the rooms clean and comfortable.

I was looking for an affordable hotel near the beach and I came across Travelodge. Upon reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I decided to give this hotel a try.  I am so pleased with this Travelodge!  My stay here was great!  The room was quite large and we had at wonderful oceanfront view, with a spacious balcony overlooking the Sunset Beach.  The continental breakfast was awesome and the hotel was in a great location, conveniently near other local restaurants and other points of interest.    I'm very happy with my stay here and will definitely stay here again!

Its pretty much what I expected. Just a parking lot away from the beach. Cant get closer than that for the price! The hotel itself is old and in desperate need of a makeover/paint job and good deep cleaning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And we know for a fact they patrol the parking garage at night which is nice to know your car is safe.

The location is great. Hotel is old and looks old. The tubs look dirty. Tiolets do not flush well. I stay quite often due to location. They want you checking out of the room before 11am. They will call room a few minutes after 11am to get you out.

Yes its an older hotel and has a slight mustie smell to it but just open up the sliding glass door and let the beach air in.  Ordor goes away when windows are openl Hotel is at the beach plenty of places to walk to for fun, food and adult drinks. Staff was extremely helpfull and very nice...Sarah was awesome.  Will be back soon.

There were 2 blood stains on the carpet.  There were rat droppings each morning.  The stench of the sewer reeked throughout the Hotel.  The only ice machine would run out everyday.  The bathroom smelled of cigarette smoke.  We left 1 day early.

The hotel, the staff (especially Ms. Healy) and the view (even from the first floor) were better than expexted.  The only problems were with Mapquest sending us about a quarter mile from the hotel and the TV had no sound.

Have been coming to this location on and off for many years. I really like the location and rates when pay in advance.could use a restaurant guide in room....only needed or requested one thing which was the room coffee refill, when I did locate housekeeping she was pleasant.Love the ocean view and balcony

Summary Heading: Not the best room or cleaning crew but you can't beat the location!
Summary: Love this location as it is right on the beach and you can leave the sliding door open on your balcony and listen to the waves all night. One night was hard to sleep because the ocean was so loud but still gorgeous sound to sleep or try to sleep to! The room wasn;t super clean and the heater sucked but the room was a good size. Only 2 beds available for a late night booking but that's what you get for checking in at 2AM! Not the best for the price for the quality of the room but the location again, can not be beat!

Summary Heading: Convienient, however, the carpet was dirty, and there was...
Summary: Convienient, however, the carpet was dirty, and there was alot of noise in the area in the early morning hours - 6:15 am.  - buses running, a lawnmower, could hear the showers and toilet flusing from the rooms next door. The place desperately needs updating.  Could be a great place.

We rented three rooms last weekend for a mini family vacation with 12 adults and kids. This property is literally steps from the sand. You cannot beat it for the price and value. They also have a breakfast room on the first floor with cereals, pastries, and breakfast sandwiches, juices, coffee, tea, etc. It is an old property, but it is clean. This is about location, location, location. When my husband and I want a romantic getaway, I admit, we travel south a few more miles to a hotel that is newer but also 2 to 3 times the price!  For a weekend or week at the beach, to surf, play in the water, picnic on the beach, this location will work great! The management is very nice. We even left a small computer behind and they had it in the office when we called a few days later. How

Summary Heading: WE WERE UNHAPPY WITH A FEW SMALL ISSUES.  ONE ISSUE WAS THE...
Summary: We were unhappy with a few small issues.  One issue was the sunset travelodge webpage claimed that the guest rooms were equipped with a microwave.  Here is the copied text from the webpage:   Feel the ocean breeze from your balcony or take advantage of free Wi-Fi internet access in the comfort of your hotel room, where you will find convenient amenities like a microwave and refrigerator. Before hitting the beach, get your day off to a great start with our free Bear Bites continental breakfast and catch up on the latest news with your free newspaper. We offer free covered parking with a 6-foot clearance, as well as non-smoking and handicapped-accessible rooms.            The site clearly states there is a microwave in the room, we did not have one.  Also there needs to be another

Summary Heading: Hotel needs a face lift, staff was unfriendly. Stayed 3...
Summary: Hotel needs a face lift, staff was unfriendly. Stayed 3 days, room was cleaned only once and not that throughly. Location was great, would only stay again because of the location.
Accommodations were okay. Not sure if I would stay there again. It’s nice to be by the beach, but the plumbing could use some upgrades as well as the carpets and overall décor.

Summary Heading: We have been in this hotel for many yours, to begin our...
Summary: We have been in this hotel for many yours, to begin our summer vacation. The location is unbeatable, only a few steps from the beach. The room quality is certainly more than o.k., check-in and check-out fast and professional. We will certainly come back!

We had a great time. The room was well worth the money. Very spacious. The breakfast was good. The room was clean and the service was excellent. We would definitely stay here again. The only down fall was the beach. My son was stung by a sting ray and we were told by the lifeguards that this beach gets 15 to 20 stings a day. Obviously a lot of sting rays in the water but that has nothing to do with the hotel. However, if you want to be able to stay on the beach and get in the water I would suggest a different beach or be careful when in the water.
I have stayed here before and always like the fact that I'm so close to the beach...I can get up early, grab a cup of coffee and head out to the sand.

The location is perfect.  Walked to the beach in a flash.  Walked to Captain Jack's for dinner...fabulous.  The hotel is not fancy, but has everything you need and I will plan to stay again.  Next time kayaking!
We enjoyed our stay, the staff was friendly. We really liked that we were only steps from the beach.

This hotel was a great value.  We had a pleasant experience.  I definitely recommend a room with a balcony view of the ocean!  Got to see the dolphins swim by in the mornings! You cannot find any affordable hotel close to this deal.  Edgar, at the front desk was efficient and friendly.

The Travelodge provided what my family and I needed, a place right by the beach! We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and that saved a TON of money! You can go from Sunrise to Sunset on the beach without having to worry about driving back to your hotel. The Travelodge wasn't noisy at all. And every night my family and I would sit on the balcony of our room and watch and listen to the ocean. What can I say, if you love the ocean as much as I do, you'll love this hotel.

This hotel is in desperate need of some serious property improvements!! We have been visiting this hotel location for over 30 years and have watched it change hands and slowly deteriorate over the years. This last visit will be our last visit! Here are a few reasons why: strong sewer smell in the evenings, bug infestation (little flying bugs everywhere), rotting wood/mildew smell under the sink cupboard, balcony railing rotting and falling apart, super old carpet, bedspreads, décor, furniture…you get the idea. Sunset beach is not combed daily and we even found a hypodermic needle on the beach…YIKES!!!!!

The hotel was in much better condition when it was a Ramada. The walls were dirty, the rugs were disgusting and need replacing along with the beds. All the faucets, plumbing hardware, and shower doors need replacing also.   The whole interior hasn't had the TV's, radio's, carpet, walls, plumbing, or furniture upgraded, cleaned or painted in over 20 years and it's well over due. It's getting real disgusting to stay at and it used to be real nice to stay at.

Summary Heading: The location was across from the beach parking entrance...
Summary: The location was across from the beach parking entrance which was great. Other than that, it was very old and run down so I'd definitely not spend that kind of money for an old run down motel. I reserved a place a couple miles away and a friend suggested I switch to Travelodge as it's closer to the beach so I did. I still had to drive as the part of the beach we were going to was 1-2 miles down so I would have preferred a nice hotel for $360 (2 nights)!

Summary Heading: Great Location BUT needs cleaning and updating
Summary: Upon check in we went to our room.  Within five minutes we noticed a large bug come out from under the vanity and then run under the carpet in front of the vanity, which was pulling away and not secure.  We contacted the manager who came to our room.  She also saw the bug and moved us to a different room.  Both rooms needed some deep cleaning.  Carpets had stains and the walls also had stains.  Corners and edges of room were not clean and had cobwebs.  We also noticed a prior guest’s pill and peanuts along the edge of the room.  Fixtures in the bathroom were old and the fiberglass bathtub had indentations from years of use.  Air conditioner in the room had a musty smell when turned on.  Had an old tube TV in the room.  The hotel is very convenient to the beach as it is a very

our st ay was very nice,i love the location and the balcony in our room,the front desk manager was great and the breakfast hit the spot.The only thing I didn't like about the room was the bathroom,it was to small.Other than that we would love to go stay there again.

Summary Heading: The best location but not the best service
Summary: I made my reversion by phone. I got one price when I call but different price when we arrived, we paid almost 100$ more then what it should have. The front desk service not very friendly at all. The room we stayed had a sofa bed was the most uncomfortable sofa bed my son has ever slept on!But the only best thing for sure is the beach is just steps away from the hotel. The beds are ok...we won't stay here again. For the price we paid I rather rent a beach house..

A great location should mean, a decent room. This place is an embarrassment to the Pacific Ocean. It looks like an old nursing home/apartment building that was turned into a motel in 1990 and someone has been making a fortune off of poor, tired, and unexpecting tourists ever since. The room we had, #203, was a celebration of 1970's, 80's, & 90's styling nightmares. It had this ridiculous "storage room" in it. Broken picture frames, broken lamp switches, broken sliding closet doors. This place is unacceptable. Do not stay here this place is not worth your pride nor money.

This is my second year staying here with my kids. Nothing like waking up to see the beach and within walking distance, no roads to cross and no parking hassles. Looks like the bathrooms were updated, yaaaay! Staff is always very friendly. I will be back next year.

Summary Heading: Great location, little bit dated property
Summary: This hotel has been aound a while and is a little bit dated, but the location is 1 block from the beach and the ocean side has nice little patios with a view of the water. Breakfast is continental with a couple microwavable foods, not very good for healthy eaters. The amount we paid was extremely high for the quality of the actual prioperty. so the value is not all that good, but overall the property is in a great location and if you have a room on the ocean side it is certainly quieter and with a better view from the small patio...

Clean Hotel.  Steps from Sunset Beach.  We had a view of the ocean from our room.  Some things could be "updated", but everything worked and was clean.  Breakfast was mostly packaged goods (muffins, rolls, bars).  The noise from the beach goers died down just after sunset.  Overall a comfortable stay. Careful if you drive a high profile vehicle - the parking garage is only 6' high!

Summary Heading: Pleasant staff, old building, needs ceiling repair in room...
Summary: Pleasant staff, old building, needs ceiling repair in room 125. Unfortunately. I just noticed that I had a code for 20% off USE OFFER CODE : 8000002357 I requested an early check in so we could get ready for the beach and the staff accommidated me :)

Summary Heading: The free covered parking was a nice "extra", everything was...
Summary: The free covered parking was a nice "extra", everything was clean and quiet.  We didn't try the breakfast.  We arrived early and asked about possible early check in and the man at the desk just about bit my head off!  A different man later was much nicer though.

Summary Heading: Safe, secure, decent stay for price/location
Summary: its a Travelodge, not a Waldorf Astoria hotel. It was a clean, safe, secure place to sleep/shower/rest in - perfect for our family. Arrived the 4th of July in the early morning. Though our room wasn't available and we couldn't check-in (11am), we were allowed to park on the premises which was AWESOME considering all nearby public parking was already packed/taken (this wasn't ONLY because it was a holiday, seemed to be this way every day we were there). We had already decided to have a day at the beach any way (did i mention, the beach was mere STEPS outside of the hotel??? I timed it and agree with the other posts: 2-3 minute walk before having the sand kiss your feet & the waves greeting you "hello."). After the check-in time (3pm), checking in took no time at all -

I am a single mom who was traveling with three daughters ages 19, 18, and 16. We stayed at this Travelodge for 5 nights in the 2-queen room which was spacious enough to comfortably add a rollaway bed.  Although it is not a fancy hotel, this Travelodge exceeded our expectations. The ocean view from the balcony was great for eating breakfast and having the beach right there was wonderful for leisure time.  The location was good for us as we traveled to Santa Monica, Los Angeles, and Irvine for different activities.  The onsite parking garage was clean and felt safe and secure.  And with teenagers who wanted to eat at all hours it helps to have a jack in the box next door. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we'll stay here the next time we're in Southern California.

We stayed one night and was very pleased with the overall value.  This was our second stay (our initial visit was in June 2012) and we found this motel/hotel to be an overall very good value as compared to the very pricey places in Huntington and Newport Beach areas.  The rooms are quite large, it is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful.  It is listed as a beach front location which is not completely the case because it is separated from the beach by a public parking lot.  If you are looking for a great value this is a good choice.  Conversely if you are expecting a glitzy high class hotel you may be disappointed.  It is an short drive to the high class beach areas.

Booked this hotel because it was right on the beach and was not disappointed. The manager on duty was great, very nice and helpful. Our room was on the second floor with a view of the ocean. The only downside is it also has a view of a major bus stop connection. The room was bigger than expected, with an extra table and chairs and also a patio set on the balcony. Beds were fine, flat screen tv. My only complaint would be the hair dryer which was from the early 70's. The morning breakfast was enough to get you going, frozen sausage biscuits, oatmeal, juice, milk, assorted danish. They could use another microwave and a lady who works without a scowl, but.....

Summary Heading: Room was OK.    Carpet could use a cleaning but it's a...
Summary: Room was OK.    Carpet could use a cleaning but it's a shore point location so why should they bother.   Most customers sure don't care how they treat the place.  They do have Wi-Fi and that is great.  But the room had only one place to plug into and it was not where the table was.  I had to borrow a extension cord from my daughter who lives in Huntington Beach.   Also to plug in the extension cord I had to unplug the light.    That outlet was also where the frig was plugged into.

Summary Heading: what a great place to stay
Summary: The location of this Travelodge couldn't be better.  In one minute you can be out of your room and on the beach.  The staff is super, the rooms are spotless, the beds extremely comfy, the parking very convenient, the breakfast just great.  I have nothing bad to say about this location and we will definitely be back.  It is peaceful and a wonderful place for a getaway

This motel has been in the same location since at least the 1960's.  I grew up in HB, just a mile or so west of sunset beach.  The motel has been there as long as I can remember.  Right next to the Jack in the Box on the corner.    I think the rooms haven't been updated since I left over 40 years ago.  They're decent, but really plain.    Just your basic motel room with a bed, fridge, bathroom, and funky, broke down air con unit.  You can get it to work if you spend 10 or 15 minutes experimenting with the knobs and buttons.  The truth be told, though, you don't really need A/C in Sunset Beach.  We didn't find any bugs, and that's a plus.  Flat screen TV and really limited cable programs.  About 40 stations.  Many of them are in Spanish.    It's just a hundred or so yards to the

Summary Heading: Just another weekend at the Travel Lodge
Summary: Made the reservation over a month ago requesting room #207, our favorite room, only to be told it was taken. The desk clerk tried to sway us that room 209 was "better" (How?). No, it's not.
