It's a single balcony as opposed to room 207's double balcony.....Didn't care for the timed bathroom switch. Took 3 showers in the dark. No reading lamps at the work tables....Not a great stay!

We went for a soccer beach tournament. The only draw back for this hotel is when I did the reservation it allowed me to put 2 adults 3 kids. When we arrived only 2 queen beds were there and I had to ask for an extra bed that cost $10 a . Except that, everything was perfect.

The hotel staff was exceptionally nice, friendly, informative and helpful from desk mgmt to housekeeping.  Location & value was excellent. Very quiet..no problem w/noisy neighbors. What I was disappointed in was the cleanliness of the rooms and exterior of bldg.  The room was musty and visibly dusty upon our arrival. The grounds could be in better shape not to mention a new coat of paint. Plus, the continental breakfast could be improved upon. Better variety of cereal, more fresh fruit and better coffee...too strong.

My son and I were traveling and checked in really late. The staff was wonderful and the ocean front room was perfect. We even got up early to watch the sunrise. The rooms are very roomy and there are plenty of restaurants that the hotel staff directed us to after the traditional dinner hour. We forgot our airline tickets in the room and when we called the manager sent them to us right away. Unbelieveable customer service.
Clean but needs some upgrading. Food for breakfast was great. Housekeeping did a very nice job. But, bathrooms old. Tub doesn't drain, or sink. But, then you can't beat the view from the balcony.

Summary Heading: Economical Beach Front Property near Huntington Beach
Summary: Why pay 200 to 400 dollars per night for beach view hotel stay in Huntington Beach when just a few blocks up the beach you can have a beach view at a fraction of the cost. We stayed one night on the Memorial Day Weekend. My wife and I occupied a single room with King size bed and were very comfortable. There was a small refrigerator and a coffee maker in the room. Yes, this is an older refurbished hotel, but quite serviceable for my wife and I. We were just a couple of miles from all the hopping activities in Huntington Beach area as well. There breakfast was a cut above the average hotel fare. We were very happy.
Hotel was clean, quiet, I felt safe, friendly staff, towels were rough, bed was great and the ocean view was just right.  A 2 minute walk to the water if you walk slowly.

Summary Heading: Mirror, mirror on the wall how many mirrors are in this motel in all???
Summary: We had a decent time at this hotel.  Not knowing the area at all I wanted to find a hotel where I could walk to the beach.  You can walk there very easily.  There are also places to eat close by and a trader joes just 2 miles away.    The motel is older and shows its age.  It's pretty clean.  The carpet was not the cleanest, but it could have also had sea air on it too.  We paid extra for a beach view balcony room because people recommended that side of the building on review websites.  For us it really wasn't worth the extra money.  Our room was right next to the bus stop intersection and a fast food restaurant so all we heard all day and evening were the busses and cars driving over a loose pot hole.  Then one night at about 4am a tractor trailer truck showed up to make a

I have driven passed this hotel for years and always wanted to stay...I am glad that I did. The view overlooking the beach from the room was fabulous. Hotel is clean and appears recently updated. The rooms are spacious and plenty of storage. We will be back to this hotel for sure.

The location is excellent for the beach. Don't plan on breakfast as the selection is sparce. The bed was unexpectedly comfortable, but the bathroom is lacking sink is in the bedroom and the shower is for people 5' 2" and under.  Overall though its a travelodge in a great location. Also if you get there late at night there may be no parking, we were told just to park handicap, slightly unacceptable

If you are a young family with small children and must be by the beach this is perhaps a good stay but if you are a senior citizen moving a little slower these days stay away.  The odd layout of this motel are just one stairway upon another.  There is one elevator for the entire motel..very slow...very small.  The staff was most rude with my questions and needs and seemed to be be bothered by our group.  The staff had no idea regarding nearby pubs or restaurants.  Breakfast was very basic pastries/cold cereal.  Breakfast apparently was meant to be taken to your room in that there is no seating area at the breaskast bar. No lobby area anywhere.  Carpets stained throughout.  If website is correct and motel built in 1999--it has taken a beating.  Pacific Coast Highway right under

This hotel had a lot of positives, great location, good size room, and a large balcony with a great view of the ocean.  The only negative comment I have is that they need to replace/remove the old carpet.  It has seen way too many wet feet/bodies from the ocean and never really dries, which gives the whole room (actually, the whole hotel) a musty, old smell that got my allergies going.  Other than the smell, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Summary Heading: We were very pleased with our stay here.  Rooms were clean...
Summary: We were very pleased with our stay here.  Rooms were clean, staff very friendly, was nice and quiet as was the surrounding area and our balcony room had a very nice view of the beach and ocean.  Nice assortment of breakfast items including sausage and egg biscuits and muffins and was available early.  Parking was under the building and very clean and well lit and the small daily, no charge parking area was kept clean throughout the day. Not far from the main part of town.  Definitely would stay here again.

I really enjoy this home away from home.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  The location could not be better.  I love setting on the porch and watching the waves, birds, people and sky.  Taking a walk along the beach is a daily event.  The day we were there they were filming a scene for a T.V. show that was suppose to be in Florida.  HA!  Also, the rooms are quiet and the parking is easy.  My only complaint is that the breakfast is all packaged and not the food I choose to eat.  I use the hot water and make my own tea in my room.  I also appreciated the fruit provided.

Summary Heading: I have utilized this facility numerous times in the past as...
Summary: I have utilized this facility numerous times in the past as we enjoy the area. We up graded to a view room but were not informed that construction was in progress in the rooms above us. When we asked about it we were told that it would be completed that day. That day never came until the day we checked out. Staff were surly upon check in and less than helpful through out our stay. A great departure from previous visits. It was nice to get home and relax.

Summary Heading: I like that I feel safe when travelling alone and the staff...
Summary: I like that I feel safe when travelling alone and the staff remember me. It is older but nicely maintained and clean.

Summary Heading: We have stayed here before, and it is always a first choice...
Summary: We have stayed here before, and it is always a first choice for beach stays. The hotel needs a bit of updating, but still a really plesent stay.

What's so hard about having sheets that fit the bed? King size bed = King size sheets not Queen size The sheet came untucked in the middle of the night then the mattress pad, that's not a comfortable nights sleep laying on a pile of sheets. What's wrong with fitted sheets? They don't come untucked! Several of the outlets did not respond to my cell phone charger. I had to unplug a lamp to charge my phone.

Great price and location, with easy access to beach. I wasn't expecting much when I got there, so was delighted with what we got. A clean room and an AMAZING shower. Covered parking was a plus. Would definitely choose this hotel again on a return trip.

This was our second stay at this location.  We like it because of its proximity to the beach.  We were in Southern California for a Disneyland vacation and rather than stay at a hotel near the theme park, we chose this one so we could come home at the end of a long day and enjoy sitting out on the balcony watching the people on the beach.  Peace & quiet.  We really enjoy the area and would stay again.  Yes, the building is older but the beds are very comfortable and we had everything we needed there.  The free parking is a plus.
The bed covers were dated. Room was nice size. Would have liked more room in the bathroom, very small.

Summary Heading: Amazing access to the beach for an affordable price
Summary: This hotel, although not the newest facility, provided amazing access to the beach. Even though I did not stay in an ocean view room, there were great views from the corridor and it was less than a minute to walk from the hotel to the sand. Very comfortable accommodations, nothing too fancy. The hotel has covered parking, is located close to gas stations, convenience stores and many restaurants and specialty shops. On the "main drag" so walking to your destination is fun and easy. The only complaint I would have is that the bathroom was extremely small. The continental breakfast offered a variety of foods and drinks and was accessible to everyone.

The room was nothing to write home about, but it had an ocean view and a little patio with a small plastic table and two chairs. We were able to sit out there and watch the people come and go from the ocean (there was a free parking lot next to the hotel that lots of local people used). We were able to walk from our room to the ocean, which was nice. The location was great, but the hotel was very much in need of updates. There was a continental breakfast which had more choices than some hotels. The elevator was not working which made it a bit hard to carry your things upstairs to where the rooms are. We are seniors, but we made it.

Summary Heading: The location was great and price somewhat reasonable. VERY...
Summary: The location was great and price somewhat reasonable. VERY outdated and old. There was a bad smell as well. Breakfast was ok and service was great!

Summary Heading: Check in was quick and easy. Beds were good, pillows to...
Summary: Check in was quick and easy. Beds were good, pillows to thick and my Grandaughters and I had sore necks the next morning.  The contintebntal breakfast was good except we would have liked some juices. The worst thing was the carpet in the room. 10 minutes after our showers, we had black feet!  We had to wear shoes or we had to wash them every time we entered bed or put our socks or shoes on.  The carpet is dark blue so you cant tell how dirty it is.  I complained on check out.  Hopefully they correct the problem for future guests.  There was also mold in the bath tub and the water was very hard to adjust the temp due to a non working faucet.  There was a young child staying above us who ran back and forth the length of the room for hours, :(. The room did not smell very clean &

This is the first review I have written, however,  I tend to base my decision on what reviews have been left. With that said, this hotel is not great and the other reviews are pretty accurate.  If you are looking for a hotel with a boardwalk and a lot of things to do within walking distance, this is not the hotel for you. While the hotel is close to the beach, there is no boardwalk or beach shops within walking distance. The beach is lined with private homes.  There is Jack and the box right next store with a gas station and few places to eat directly across the street. Everything else you would need a car to go to. Huntington Beach is the cloest for shopping it is about a 5 min drive down the coast.  The rooms are old and smelly.  They have a strong smell of funk.. This hotel

This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was close to everything and the view from our room was gorgeous. The bathroom is a bit small but i didnt plan the trip around that   :-) I would definately stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!  Carla

Summary Heading: great beach view and location for the money
Summary: Great value.  Balcony facing ocean but parking lot was between the hotel and the beach but it was okay considering the low price.  I enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the surfers walk to the beach, etc.  Woke up Easter morning to the sound of the beach church music right on the beach--it was nice!! The breakfast had great variety with Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, various breakfast bars, variety of fresh fruit, oatmeal, variety of milk and juices, coffee, tea, poptarts.  My first impression of the place was a bit of a let down, I was worried that it looked too run down and shabby, but the rooms were clean and quite large, beds were comfortable with nice clean sheets all white and new linens made it seem nicer than you would think at first.  Staff was nice.

Summary Heading: ocean view w/ balcony ON THE OCEAN SIDE OF PCH, steps to the water~
Summary: FREE underground parking unlike HB, nice balcony with table end chairs to enjoy meals while watching the surf and you can't beat the price! most hotels with views in the area are across the street from the beach so to me being on the same side was a huge plus! also like the fact of having a mini fridge in the room and a decent complimentary breakfast. Definitely not the fanciest of hotels BUT who stays in the room when you are at the beach anyway?  I am not a big fan of crowds so I LOVE the fact that I'm minutes away from HB and can choose to be in the fray. Also the Bolsa Chica walking/biking trail starts right where the hotel is.   Staff is very accomodating too- let us check out late and a friend was driving up to have dinner and drinks so they let her park in the garage.  My

Summary Heading: the hotel is in a great location. the set up of the hotel...
Summary: the hotel is in a great location. the set up of the hotel and rooms are a bit odd but the beds are comfy.

OK This is not a 5 star hotel, but for the price and location it felt like it could be.  IT IS RIGHT ON THE BEACH. GREAT VIEW. staff was friendly and the breakfast selection was better than any other hotel i've stayed at.  I WOULD DEFINATLY STAY THERE AGAIN. NEXT TIME I WILL STAY ON THE OCEAN SIDE OF THE HOTEL. THE VIEW WAS PERFECT

When we checked in the guy at the front desk was pretty nice, but he was the only one with any manners what so ever.  Our key card would not work to get into the door from the outside for either my husband or myself and when we told them about it they were very rude and told us we must have left it next to our cell phones.  (we kept them no where near our cell phones)  Then on our second day the toilet backed up in our room, and when we told them about it they wanted us to stay there until the maintenance man could come look at it, we were visiting from Missouri and were only in town a short time and had plans with friends, and they acted again as if we had done something to sabotage the toilet.  Then when we went to the parking garage there was a busted sewer pipe, so my

The man at front desk was very nice upon check in. When entering the room there was an unpleasant odor in room. There were water stains on the popcorn ceiling and down walls. Baseboards were absolutely filthy. Room was very outdated but bed linens looked and smelled clean. Bathroom was relatively clean, clean towels, floor & toilet but there was a sewer stench coming from the toilet. Girl at front desk the next day was very rude but on the other hand location could not have been better. Beautiful ocean views, only steps to the sand and restaurants next door. Probably would not stay again until place was fixed up. But you get what you pay for

Horrible horrible experience!  Upon checking in, had to endure pressure for "room upgrade to ocean view"; which we declined.  We were not there on vacation but to visit a terminally ill relative and wouldn't really be enjoying the ocean view.  Then we were told we had to upgrade to get the accessible room we had reserved since it has an ocean view!!  To top it off, the only 2 "accessible rooms" were right (and I mean immediately) by the tables used for the breakfast buffet starting at 6:30 am.  I was assured that if this was a problem (since these were the only accessible rooms and I was with my 95 year old mother, my options were limited) that I could call the front desk and they would tell the breakfasters to keep the noise level down.  Guess what...next morning...when it was

Property was selected based on location - but more importantly - because if listed in room refrigerators & microwaves.  traveling solo got R&R - I wanted to be able to heat take out orders for meals - and this was not possible as the hotel staff stated the microwave in the common breakfast area fulfilled the "in room" requirement.  Very disappointed and will not book another Travelodge.

I have stayed at this location at least 6 or 7 different times.  The price has gone up $50, because they said that they remodeled?  My room looked exactly the same!  I requested 2nd floor, King.  I was given 1st floor, 2 queens.  I was checking out on Sunday, with the time change, I did not realize what time it was, I was called twice within 15 minutes.  Once at 11:15 and again at 11:30am, asking when I would be leaving!  At least they could offer a late check out or something?!  Not very friendly at the desk either!

My family and I drove in from Las Vegas to go to Disneyland and since we were in Cali we figured we would stay by the water.  Travel Lodge was a great choice. The price was very reasonable and we had a great two nights there.  There was construction going on across the hall from us but we never even heard them. The morning breakfast was great too. Not the dinky breakfasts some hotels give you but there was plenty of variety for my picky two year old and for my husband who has a sweet tooth :) We would most definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great few days!

Summary Heading: Average to below average rooms, above average location, good service
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights to visit family in Long Beach. It was fairly close to everything we wanted to do and you couldn't get a better location next to beach. The rooms are very run down and the cleanliness is not what it should be. I don't mind staying in an older basic hotel room as long as its kept uber clean. Here not quite. I actually bought cleaning wipes and wiped everything down including the bathtub where I found 2 hairs... ick... Also there was leftover coffee in the coffee pot when we got to room, ick, ick. So we did not use coffee pot. I also am not sure why they have the most ancient hair dryers I've ever seen yet the room had flat screen tv's. Huh?  So after my complaints I do have to say for the price, about $120/night, we had a very good size room with a

Glad that some of the reviews of this place did not deter us from staying here.  If you are looking for something modern with a pool, hot tub and located near the tourists amusement parks, you will probably want to book somewhere else and pay the price for it.  This place has not been updated for some time but it was clean and it felt like home to us.  The rooms were huge and we found that although the sink placement outside of the bathroom was odd, it was very convenient for one person to get ready when another was showering (no steamy mirrors).  The beds were large and comfortable.  The room included TV with many channels but no sleep timer, a small fridge, hair dryer, ironing board and iron.  Staff at hotel were very friendly and the services offered were free WiFi, a

The Travelodge in Huntington Beach was in a good location, with restaurants and bars in walking distance.  Ask for an ocean view.  Main street in Huntington Beach is not far.  There are many restaurants and the pier is always nice.

Drove from Nor. Cal to Sunset Beach on a Friday. Was allowed to check in early. Location of motel could not be better for the price. No crossing main street. Just a walk across the parking lot and you are on the beach. Room was fine for the price. Breakfast was included and I thought it was good. It included Jimmy Dean sausage bisquits and all the juices, fruits, coffee, and danishes, and cereals that you usually get. The gal at the desk was very kind and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Glad I ignored the two star rating, this place is charming and worthy
Summary: The hotel manager, seeing on my iID that is was my birthday, checked me into the hotel three hours early so I could get settled in and go enjoy the beach. Comfy beds, free wifi, breakfast items including good coffee, fresh fruit. Certainly the hotel could use some updates, but to me what was important was there- a commitment from management for security, fridge in the room, hot water, kind staff.  I'll stay here again.

Summary Heading: Elevator expired 2 years ago. Walked into large plate...
Summary: Elevator expired 2 years ago.  Walked into large plate glass window twice at one of the exits. For safety needs to be something on the window.  Very basic hotel. Adequate for price. Nice location. Close to the beach.

This is a great place to stay if you want a hotel close to the beach.  It may not look like a great place to stay but don't let the pictures fool you. We had two beach front rooms with balconies that faced the beaches. We had a great time. I would stay there again.

What a tired, run-down property this is! It was clean enough, don't get me wrong. But it was desperatly in need ofmaintenance -- paint, new carpet, new draperies (there were holes in the curtains in room 203). Yucky box springs visible, but the mattresses seemed fine. Very worn bed covers (they were the same vintage as the curtains). Staff was nice. Cannot beat the location or the price for being right at the water. Breakfast was all packaged foods, but they were fresh, as was the fruit. Coffee was like sludge when they used the big coffee urn, fine when it was made in just the coffee pot. Glass everywhere -- doors, windows -- looked like it had not been cleaned in years.

We got the hotel because of the location and that is the only positive thing about this place... Not sure where to start: 1. the beds are flimsy - at awakening the whole body was hurting; 2. the shower is built for midgets - you would have to stand with your knees bent under it to wash your head; 3. if you intend to get King bed room, be advised your windows will be overlooking PCH with no rest day or night from traffic; 4. rooms are very small and carpet is very old and dirty - don't forget your slippers. 5. breakfast... just go to Ihop!  Overall it is a very distressed hotel!

I'm less than 100 feet from the sand! The room is clean; the bed is comfortable; the ocean view is amazing! I recommend spending a bit more for the ocean view rooms, aside from the view they are quieter since they don't face the PCH.  Sure the decor is outdated and could use a renovation but I'm here for the beach; a clean room; comfortable bed and working amenities are what I require. My only con is the small bathroom but most importantly it was clean.  I'm already booking my next stay!

Hotel had great location! For the quality of hotel, it was very good. I didn't expect 5 star quality. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Staff was excellent. We are definitely staying here again.

Summary Heading: great location with the best location very close to the beach
Summary: Great location especially ocean side rooms (worth the upgrade price).  Not the country club but worth the effort  very close to beach.   Kind of a retro 70's motel Clean, comfy rooms.   Slept with the sliding door open for ocean  sounds, Only draw back is the small bathroom

What realy attracted us to this property was the view of the beach and the morning surfers carrying their surf boards. The location also offered plenty of restaurants and shopping and easy access to other areas along the coast
smelly room, rundown look, low quality breakfast. that's all I have to say - should not have to use 100 characters when it could all be said with twenty or less.

staff was NEVER at front desk! Hotel is outdated. when asked to move to either a different floor or opposite side of building because 1st floor on PCH side was TOO loud was denied.... was told i should of asked when reservation was made... how would i know it was on a busy highway so close to the street where the cars driving down the street could littererally look into my room. ended up sucking it up spending $30 fraking dollars extra to move to the other side. all in all RUDE staff thats never at desk, cheap "breakfast" if you want to call it that, RUNDOWN musty smelling rooms that are dirty! DO NOT walk barefoot your feet will be black! NEVER AGAIN

Summary Heading: Good Location but everything else is BAD!
Summary: This a great location, litterally steps from the beach. However, the hotel is nasty, old and run down. It is not worth the discount. You can pay a little more for a nice play to sleep.

The hotel itself was in very poor condition and extremely out dated. The mildew smell was so bad that we spent most of our time outside the hotel. The only nice thing was that the beach was in walking distance, but probably not worth putting up with the crummy hotel.

The room was spacious, nice view of ocean but there was a terrible stench which we finally reported to the night manager. We were told it was from a oil or gas tank that emits gas to release pressure.  It smelled like a sewer. We were told to close our sliding door and turn on the air conditioner. Not what I wanted to hear, the sound of the ocean is part of the experience but we did that so we could sleep. In the morning the smell was there again. I told the next manager and he said someone was checking it out. Didn't say he was sorry about it. No one offered to move us or do anything about the problem. We have stayed here before and didn't have any problem which is why we went back but it isn't worth it to chance that the tank will be "emitting" again.  I know stuff happens but

Summary Heading: A Great Value for an Amazing Location
Summary: The Travelodge at Sunset Beach was a great little hotel at an amazing location.  The amenities at this hotel (free wifi Internet and fridges in the room)  were better than those at the Hilton I stayed at the following night.  I would recommend paying a little extra for a beach side room.  Mine faced the PCH and a gas station.  Both were quite noisy all night.  The walls were solid, so I did not hear anything from the rooms next to me, above or below.  The fixtures in the room were a bit outdated.  The toilet handle in my bathroom was cracked and difficult to flush.  The floors were a bit stained, but nothing too scary.  Comcast cable with guide, HBO and many channels.  I did not do the continental breakfast, so I cannot comment on that.  Parking was very convenient.  The beack
good nice stay employees were nice and our view from our room was amazing. Breakfast was delicious, and check in was fast

Pros---  Continental breakfast from 6:30am-10am                Friendly staff                In room refrigerator, coffee maker, and blow dryer                Cleaning service was excellent                Just a hundred steps to the beach                Fun bars and restaurants within walking distance                Easy to find, easy to get to freeways, it's right on PCH  Cons---  Rooms are not modern or immaculate.

Please do not take this as a gripe session, but genuine feedback on how this hotel can improve.  This hotel has a great location, and I knew I was not getting the Ritz for $100/night.  However, here is some feedback for improvement.   The View/Location was why I chose the hotel in the first place, as I only live 2 miles inland.   Booking on-line: The booking was easy until I saw the cancelation policy.  Basically, I was told there is no cancelation EVER or any reason.  No 72 hour policy, nothing.  This fact alone made me think twice about even staying in this hotel.  My schedule changes frequently and sometimes must cancel activities.  This began my second guessing of this hotel from that moment.   Hotel Appearance: The exterior of the hotel looks updated and well kept.  The

Hotel was ok.  Plenty of foods to choose from at breakfast even though we got there   about 10 am.  Room was quiet.  Thought it was a little expensive for the street view.  5 yr old granddaughter got ill during the night, had to call 911.  Manager didn't know the address of the hotel so I could tell the person on the phone.  The Manager and the Maintainence person did come to the room and the Maintainence man helped me get my other grandchildren to the car so we could follow the ambulance.  Elevator wasn't working when we got there, but manager was able to fix it right away.

nice enough,  near the ocean,  that was most important to us.  have stayed at this hotel 4 times.  no pool, nothing fancy, and can hear the traffic on non ocean side, traffic does die down late at night.  but again,  very near the ocean!

Since I've discovered this place, I love it.  You can walk about 50 yards and be at the ocean.  Other motels are located on the inland side of Pacific Coast Highway which makes it more difficult to get to the ocean.

We stayed at this hotel because the beach is right there!  The bike trail starts right there also.  A great beach with kids...shallow and clean.  The staff was very accommadating!  The hotel is older but clean.
I loved the servise and the Disneyland discount that helped out a lot! The view from my room was breathtaking! I will totally recommend to family and friends. And stay there more often!
Great spot! Just a few steps to the beach. Provided us with a pack n play which was most appreciated! Would recommend for any beach getaway on a budget!
Very clean! great location And the staff was very helpful! we are coming back for a week for Spring Break.

Hotel is older but well taken care of and in a great location. If you can be sure and get a room with balcony and view of the beach.  Don't  let the underground parking and need to take the stairs for registration bother you once you get in the room and check out the you will be thrilled.

The 3rd star is for the location, which is excellent. Otherwise this is your typical 2-star Travelodge. Motel is old and rooms are a bit outdated, but the view, location and easy beach access more than makes up for all that. The continenal breakfast is the usual for a Travelodge... I had no complaints about it. Underground parking garage is a big plus. I would highly recommend an ocean-side room as the street side rooms do not have balconies. The balconies are actually quite large. The 2-queen bed rooms are much larger than the king rooms, perfect for people traveling with small children. As some other travelers had mentioned, the beds are comfortable but not the pillows...but again this is normal for a 2-star. Be sure to bring your own hair dryer as the dryers in the rooms have
From the location to the service to the clean room to the simple breakfast was perfect Would recommend this hotel to everyone and will be heading back here on our next visit to the area.  Thanks

Summary Heading: a getaway from the hot inland empire
Summary: Our room had a beautiful view of Sunset beach from our private balcony. The beach was very close to walk to. The beds were very comfortable and the room very clean and roomy for being quite old. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful.

Hotel is old and dated; however, they have upgraded the beds. Beds-good, pillows-not good, like sleeping on a board, room size-big, TV-terrible, channel selection-good, air conditioner - old, loud, turned on and off frequently (sometimes on for less than 1 minute) did cool the room well, beach access-excellent, continental breakfast-below average (cold cereal, fruit, crappy store bought individually wrapped pastries, bathroom-clean, water pressure-okay, shower head height terrible unless you're 4'6'', refrigerator-worked well. This hotel is early 1970's and it still looks like it. The fact that they have upgraded the beds made the place comfortable although they need to offer several different pillows instead of 4 or 5 which are thick and hard. They have a parking garage under

The hotel is nicely located. I had a bit of a time parking a full size truck though. The Lady who checked us in was very patient and pleasant, and had also done her best to help with my special requests. (she made sure there were no sharks in the room)

My two children and I stayed at the Travelodge, Sunset beach, for a total of 3 nights.  The location was perfect as I wanted something close to the beach but affordable.  The staff was very courteous and efficient.  Parking was easy and we enjoyed our stay very much. We will definitely be going back!

Don't expect 4 star service here, you get what you pay for.   It is old and outdated, but clean enough.True definition of a 2 star hotel.  Location is ideal for going back and forth from beach.   I would stay here again when looking for a beach vacation on a budget. Price is right!  15 min drive to Disney.

The two stars are ONLY for the location - right on the beach.  Location, location, location.....that is ALL that this place has going for it!  We did have an ocean-side room as requested, but the plastic "rubbermaid" type furniture on the patio was cracked, cutting my child's leg.  Avoid room 106 at all costs!  When we checked in we expressed concern about sharing a wall with the breakfast area, but was told that it was not a problem and there had never been any complaints.  Needless to say, at 5:30 AM the next morning, my husband was out in the hallway telling the kid setting up breakfast to stop slamming the cabinets doors over and over again.  The headboards for the beds share a common wall with the breakfast area cabinets and sink. Joy of joys, our entire family was awake at

Summary Heading: Only place we will stay when in Huntington/Sunset area!
Summary: I found this gem when my husband deployed in 2008 (when it was a Ramada) and I was looking for a get-a-way from Las Vegas. Since then, we always come back the same time every year. It's the only hotel located on the beach-side of PCH, and you cannot beat the prices! The staff is always very friendly and accomodating. No huge crowds, like in Huntington, and the beach is usually pretty sparsely populated. Huntington (and Fred's) is just a short drive away. I don't care about how outdated the rooms are, compared to other nearby hotels; I'm not there to stay in my room. I love that we can wake up, and hit the beach with ease (no crossing busy PCH). I consider this to be the best diamond in the rough I've ever found!

We found this hotel in the worst of situations, Our old standby the Hyatt Huntington Beach was fully booked and it was 11:45pm. When we first pulled up...I have to say I was disappointed...the hotel seemed old, I didn't think I could see the ocean and my wife and kids were freaking out, After a quick check in with the AMAZING front desk staff, I started feeling better...He said he gave us the best view...but then my family walked into the rooms, Older rooms...definitely time for an upgrade, but the room was large and we all decided to get some sleep...BAM Morning time! Open the patio door and the best view of any hotel in HBC, Hands down...we pay 2x the amount we paid to stay at other hotels and we are not nearly as close to the beach, after that...everything else was worth it!

Summary Heading: Best value in Sunset Beach/Huntington Beach
Summary: The rooms were gorgeous, overlooking the beautiful Pacific Ocean.  Our room had a large balcony!  We had a fridge, comfy beds and the ocean breeze at our fingertips.  Our continental breakfast was wonderful.  We had coffee, baked goods, fresh fruit and cereal.  So convenient!

I was here just last week,the staff are great very friendly and helpful, The hotel is a little run down and could use a face lift. you couldn't ask for a better location. this is a non smoking hotel but i think they could use the front area patio and have a few tables and chairs to turn that into a smoking area, The back side of the hotel is very dark and for a women to travel alone you didn't feel very safe when you step out at night but if they utilized that front patio then there guest would feel safer. I also think that there front entrance should have a different set up system for when you arrive after dark,Not knowing about that back entrance i was standing outside in the middle of the night waiting to get into the hotel,so when I do return i hope they have made a few

I stayed here by myself on a Sunday and Monday night. When I checked in at 2:10 I was told I could not check in early that I had to wait until after 3:00. Was not very happy about this one. I have traveled over the years and this was the first time at a hotel that told me to come back. My room ended up being right next to breakfast area. Do NOT stay in room 104! The microwave was right outside my door and every time someone heated something up I could hear the microwave door being slammed and the beeping it made. Room is really old and sink was in room not in the bathroom with light switches on other side of room. Big balcony which was nice but I was looking out over the parking lot but could still see the beach. Very noisy even on this side of hotel. There is a street and

Summary Heading: Proximity to Beach All Worth It!
Summary: Yes, it is very outdated. But we're not too picky when that means we can afford to stay in a hotel on the beach. My teens were thrilled and went boogie boarding first thing in the morning. The beds were fine for us and we were grateful they brought a roll out bed without charge. Yes, the traffic noise is LOUD, but if you put the fan on high that pretty much drowns out the noise, along with ear plugs.  Next time, I will pay the extra $20 for the beachside now that I know it includes a balcony, which looks very relaxing.  The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the variety of breakfast compared to a couple of other hotels we were at on this trip. Oatmeal, fruit, muffins, yogurt, breakfast sandwiches to warm up in microwave---no complaints on the coffee.  Our Yukon XL even with

Great location Pleasant staff, good housekeeping. Older facility. Torn carpet. VERY UNCOMFORTABLE bed. SMALL room. Facility looks well used, worn. INTRUSIVE policies: Want credit card or $250 cash deposit, even for prepaid rooms. BE CAREFUL about smoking or bringing pets (DON'T). EXPENSIVE telephone use - bring your cell phone. Parking adequate (NOT for tall vehicles at all! NO Campers!). Very POOR continental breakfast. Coffee is TERRIBLE - use it in your car battery; dissolves metal spoons, probably: NASTY. Security is likely good. Fresh linens every day, upon request. Stairs seem dangerous; top of stairs is TOO CLOSE to the landing/ access door - one could fall down the stairs with little trouble. Access to the beach couldn't be any better: OUTSTANDING LOCATION
This hotel is 2 minutes from the beach.  We had an ocean view room c/w breakfast for less than $120/night.  It does'nt get any better than that!!
The hotel is very old and outdated. The staff is really nice and friendly though. It seems to be a good hotel not too quiet cause of the street right outside.

The room was clean, spacious and the beds are comfortable.  This is an older hotel and if you goal is to stay by the beach at a budget price, this is a good choice.  One definate possitive is there is not only "free" parking, it is also covered.  We stayed here because of the lower price, but be aware the general area is very different than Laguna or Newport Beach even though they are not that far apart.  Around Hunnington Beach, the coastline begins to look somewhat industrial.  To be more specific, there is what appears to be oil platforms in the water, oil containers and drilling operations along side Pacific Coast Highway after leaving the Newport Beach area.   There are quite a few good places to eat close by and just up the road in Seal Beach, there is a quaint

Arrived after requesting beach side room. Put me in a street side. HOLLY CRAP! After my keys not working for the SECOND time and finally getting into room.My son and I got no sleep. It has to be the loudest room I have ever stayed in. Breakfast consists of pre packaged doughnuts.  Tried to print boarding pass. Didnt work. Printer hasnt worked for months.
The only thing that was a bit of a problem was the lighting in the room the controls are all by the door otherwise it was perfect for our needs and so close to a great beach.

Summary Heading: Good budget option at a great location
Summary: Stayed here on a last minute business trip, and was fairly pleased.    The hotel literally is on/by the beach, and it provided a wonderful jog in the morning.  Also, it is close to some pretty good local restaurants.  The hotel itself is nothing luxurious, however, my room was very comfortable and clean.  Again, for the price, I thought it was a great option.

Summary Heading: Great locale for a hotel and without all the extras & $$$!
Summary: Took my two daughters 15 & 17 to this basic hotel and we were VERY satisfied for the price. They loved watching (from our ocean front balcony with outside entrance) all the guy surfers hitting the waves each morning & I loved the locale, cleanliness, quiet and free continental breakfast. Beaches are closed by 10pm ish so little/no noise at night (nor trouble for my teens!:)). Hotel is basically on the beach but next to the Warner ave bus turnaround & state beach but was pretty quiet overall. We ran the ac through the the night just in case. Hotel was pretty full and quiet as well, free parking underneath hotel & computer usage. Staff was friendly, so you should be too!  Be sure to drive up to Seal Beach by day, down to Huntington Beach (hot spot!) and Newport/Balboa (somewhat
For the price, not bad.  Older hotel that is clean.  Across the parking lot from the beach. Great Mexican restaurant directly across the street--Super Mex!

Summary Heading: Leave the light on, we will be back!!!!
Summary: Clean spacious room. The bedding new , and the pillows very fluffy, comfortable beds.Great location If it wasn't for the driveway we would be up on the sand. They served continental breakfast  great variety, something for everyone , i was amazed.The staff was friendly and very helpful. We rented bikes and rode to Huntington Beach  and on to Newport Beach . Everything is so close shops, resturants.They have underground parking well lite with security cameras.We will be back!!!

This is a two-star hotel, so if you're expecting Embassy Suite quality you're in for a disappointment, but if you're like my family who loves the convenience of a hotel right next to the beach then this is it!  It's a short walk across a parking lot and you hit sand!  The hotel is old, but they keep it clean.  Breakfast is nothing fancy, but it's food and it's comes free with the room.  The room has a small refrigerator for keeping snacks.  The staff was friendly.  Parking is free and covered.  If you get an ocean view room, you get a balcony.  Free internet is included.  There is not a pool, but we came for the ocean, not a pool.  This is our second stay in two years and we will definitely be back!

We stayed here for a weekend in may and thought it was a great location, but the hotel was nothing special.  we paid about $115 per night  Service: Check-in at the front desk was one of the slowest check-ins i've ever experienced...and we had reservations.  the front desk attendant wasn't the friendliest and didn't seem to completely know what he was doing.  once we finally got the key to our room, it didn't even work...we had to go back up to the front desk and wait another 15 minutes for him to finally get us a working key. (side note - we've traveled a fair amount internationally and are used to signs translated into English with grammatical errors -  surprisingly there were several signs - in English - that were grammatically incorrect - made me feel like i was in a foreign

Summary Heading: Oceanview and Walk to the Beach
Summary: A reasonable older hotel.  The ocean atmosphere is taking it toll but the place was clean and acceptable.  It does have an ocean view but you are not directly on the beach.  See google satellite view to see location.  Breakfast was simple but sufficient.  Rate was reasonble for location.

we stayed for two nights. May 12 checked out the 15th. First compliant, when arrived after a 6 hour flight with 3 small children, i rang the front desk. The man appeared around the corner, and said "I'm on an important call, you will have to wait!" Shocked, i rolled my eyes. Okay thats strike one. I'm paying you  money, a please and thank you would help. Second complaint, that night i asked for extra blankets, a different man at the front desk told me "no, then I will have to look for extra blankets." I mention this hotel is not full, pull some from a vacant room. He hung up on me. One positive, is the view of the ocean.  I have to say we will never stay there again, and this Ramada is truly "Limited" dont waste you money!

Summary Heading: First Time In California........................and On The Beach
Summary: The staff, the hotel and the location are all awesome.  They even offer a free continental breakfast that has a great variety of different foods to choose from.  This hotel is in a great location, nice and clean and everybody there was so pleasant.  We will definetly return and definetly recommend it to all of our friends and family.  Thank you!

Had a wonderful visit at the Oceanfront Ramada. I stayed here once before, about 18 years ago and it was a good experience as well. For a two star hotel, I have to say, I was very pleasantly suprised. It was clean, comforatable and in an ideal location...in fact, one of the few hotels actually on the beach. I plan to return yearly with my kids. Perfect place for families and a girls weekend...also, the breakfast was very nice: fruit, pastries, sausage/egg sandwiches, cereal, coffee and juice... more than adequate. The front desk staff was also exceptionally friendly and helpful. Oh, be sure to get a room with a balcony.

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money , wost service I ever had in this great state!
Summary: I was looking for milk for my 13 month old daughter, I asked the front desk & she told me there was some milk in the fridge in the breakfast area. I opened the door to get some milk I had the baby bottle in my hand to fill, the manager came out of his office & told me not to take the milk. I explained it was for my baby but he said no still. I checked out the same day! They manager/owner is cheap! I only wanted milk for my daughter. This is not a good hotel for family's.

We are driving from WA to SoCal and wanted a place along the beach. We are on the top floor 2 rooms from the Jack in the Box and have an amazing view of the ocean. The room is very large and has a great balcony. The parking is great and location can't be beat, we love Huntington beach and it's really close. The hotel was a little costly but overall was nice. And the pillows were very fluffy, just wanted to add that since the last couple places we stayed  had lousy pillows.

Summary Heading: Hubs business trip my leisure trip...right on the beach- friendly people
Summary: OK for a business trip or quick overnight. I like the beach location.

Summary Heading: Better than I'd thought it would be
Summary: Having seen some if the other reviews, I was quite worried about what to expect.  Ultimately - it was cheap, had free covered parking, free wifi, free breakfast, was handy for the PCH and right on the beach. The girl at check in was pleasant/ polite and helpful, we had no other need to speak to staff until checkout. We had the second floor room at the end nearest the Jack in the box. We didn't notice noise from there, or the bus stop, that caused us or the kids any problem. We didn't notice any kids or strange people hanging around to cause us any concern. The room was a really good size, with a good size fridge, and was clean. I managed to get a 2010 town & country in and around the garage, parked, and the tailgate up without hitting the walls or ceiling or crashing into

We had a girls weekend and we stayed here. Wish we had gotten a room with a balconey, but we did have a corner room not near the street. It did overlook a dumpy house. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, could use better lighting. I must say that they do get kudos for extras mirrors, something you need when you have more than one female in a room.  The contintental breakfast was what you expect, but what do you want for free? It was just a short walk to the beach and a short drive to the pier. I would stay again.

Relatively cheap room at $150, but would have rather spent twice that for a better environment. Parking was covered, but unsecured and a creepy guy hanging out in his beat up car was, well, creepy.  Do yourself a favor and pass.

Summary Heading: Worst Service Ever Ruined my 50th Birthday
Summary: Went for 50th Birthday picture on webb must have be taken years ago.  Hotel was run down . But the worse thing was the front desk service or the lack of.  I have been in the service business over 30 years and never be treat like this.  The gentemen ( pig) at the front desk made my wife cry after yelling at her.  When I step in he did not dare say another word.  Are plan was to stay extra 2 days but we left and check in to another hotel in Newport Beach.  Beleive me the exrta $ was worth every penny.  Would never stay or recommend this hotle from hell to anyone.  Beware

After reading some reviews that made this place sound like a dump, I was kind of afraid to stay here, but we got a special deal, so we decided to go ahead, and if it was too horrible, we just wouldn't stay.    I've got to say that previous reviewers must have been expecting the Embassy Suites breakfast or a room at the Omni.  This is the Ramada Limited, folks!  ROOM:  Clean and large, with good-size refrigerator BEDS:  Comfortable, lots of pillows, high off the floor TOWELS:  Soft and fluffy BALCONY:  Wonderful, with ocean view  BREAKFAST:  Very adequate with fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, and microwavable breakfast sandwiches (much nicer than most continentals)   LOCATION:  Terrific, right next to the beach  Outside of a little problem with a sticky door lock and a carpet

Summary Heading: You stay at Ramada, you get Ramada
Summary: I don't know what the bad reviews are about. It's a Ramada Inn. Period. No big surprises one way or the other. It is probably in the lower 1/3 of Ramada Inns, but it's not a flea bag. The bathrooms were quite clean. Carpets a little worn but not horrible. Bedding was clean, plenty of pillows, bed was firm. The frig in the room was handy, temperature control was a little tricky to find...it's on the outside of the frige, on top, toward the back. The breakfast was continental, muffins, milk juice, fresh fruit, coffee, and some microwavable egg, ham and cheese breakfast sandwiches. The walk to the beach is about 100 steps from the back of the hotel. You don't have to cross Pacific Coast Hwy to get there. One complaint was about the Jack in the Box next door, the night I was there

This motel is sandwiched between PCH and Pacific Ave so it has terrible traffic noise on the PCH side and they charge an extra $30 a night to be on the Pacific Ave side ostensibly for the 'Ocean View' which is non-existant for the majority of those rooms. The rooms that do have an ocean view are right next to the 24hour Jack-In-The-Box drive through so you get to listen to people bellowing their orders all night for $140 a night.  The motel amenities are practically non-existant with a small breakfast area that also has a computer with Internet access for guests. They have a compementary breakfast each morning which is best described as adequate. They really need to add a toaster and some bread and bagels. We couldn't use the amenities anyway because they kept the temperature at

This was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The Lobby was basically non-existant except for entering through the parking garage and taking the stairs/elevator to the front desk. They had a couple of old/ugly/dirty couches in the hallway (as the lobby). The place was super dusty and there were cob webs in the ceiling and railings of the second floor. The only good thing was that the rooms were a pretty descent size. The customer service was also non-existant. We tried to get a roll-away bed in our room all day. I called again at night to see if there was any luck, but none available. So then I asked for some extra blankets. The guy told me that I had to come down myself and get them and not till 11:00pm (the current time was 10:40pm). So I come down at 11:01pm and ask

I am from Long Beach but my husband is from Oklahoma and we were staying with my family for the holidays. We decided to go out with some friends and wanted to get a hotel. This was close to the beach and close to our friends. We did not make reservation we got the hotel that same night. The guy behind the counter gave us a great deal after talking with him for a little bit.  The room was big everything was a little old but clean, bathroom was very small but what made this a great place was the view. We were in room 313. In the morning we opened the window  and curtains. Made the coffee that was supplied in the room, watched the surfers and enjoyed the weather before returning to the family holiday stuff. Some inside information that I did have was that this place is only a short

Summary Heading: Mediocre, but close to the beach
Summary: The good news:   - The beach is very close; one block away.   - The rooms were large (except for the bathrooms).  The bad news:  - The hotel is loud; you overlook either public parking for the beach or the Pacific Coast Highway.  Every time someone in the hotel closed their door, our door would rattle. - We had issues with people running and yelling through the halls late at night.  The hotel did seem to attract a younger, beach-oriented crowd, which makes sense. - every time we drove in or out of the underground parking lot, there were people loitering (public parking for the beach is always full, so non-guests squat in the garage). - depressing breakfast buffet.  All prepackaged, vending-machine type food. - No external security; people can just come and go, and there were a

Summary Heading: Much better than the reviews led me to believe!
Summary: I was going to Huntington Beach on business and wanted to stay near the beach.  I found the Ramada Oceanfront and booked it.  After booking it, I saw the many less than stellar reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites and was about to cancel my reservation, but realized it was too late to do so without paying for the first night.  I decided to stay there one night and if it was terrible, to move somewhere else the next day.  First, the negatives:  1.  I arrived at 1pm on Sunday and after parking in the underground lot, went to the front desk to check in.  The clerk told me "Check in is at 3pm - come back in 2 hours".  I talked with him for awhile, but he told me the "hotel is fully booked, no clean rooms".  I asked if they could clean my assigned room (216) first, his response was

First off this is an older hotel and it does show around the property. The most positive thing I can say about this place is that it does have free internet and parking. It is a little on the grungy and dirty side and there is a bus stop right across the street so you hear constant traffic. It is right next to the beach however there is no decent surf in the immediate area and the beach is kind of gross.

This is the stay that never happened.  My fiance and I arrived here and passed it the first time.  I was hoping it wasn't the correct place.  We found the parking garage behind it.  It's underground and pretty nasty looking.  The front desk is accessed by walking up a stairwell.  When you finally get to it, it's dark, gloomy and very dingy looking.  Kind of like a modern day Bates motel, sorry to say.  I attempted to cancel the reservation, but was informed that I had booked through Orbitz and had to contact them.  I would have done so, but the hunt for another hotel was on and on a Friday no less.  I am going to make sure I get every penny back for a severely misrepresented property at Cheaptickets operated by Orbitz.  Although I never checked in, I just didn't see how they

This was a working vaction for me and I took my son, who has never been to Huntington, and  I regret, this was his first experience. The pictures presented by the web sites are a FAR cry from what you are going to find, on this particular strand of PCH. I flew in late to Orange County, rented my car, and when I got to PCH, Sunset Beach, I drove right by this hotel, cringing in fear that this WAS the place. After driving to Seal Beach, I turned around and realized that yes..how unfortunate it may be..THIS was the hotel. I couldnt figure out where to park. The parking is in the rear, underneath the hotel, and its a disgusting garage. Then theres the problem of NO parking available in the garage, so I had to park across the street, praying my car wouldnt get towed off.  There are

Summary Heading: Best Hotel For A beach Vacation
Summary: This was our second time staying here. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The room had a balcony that overlooked the ocean, which was awesome. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was very quiet and peaceful. A great family place. We were right on the beach. Nice not to have to load up everything in the car and drive to the beach. I have and will continue to recommend this hotel to everyone. The rates were not bad either. Be sure to take an evening walk along the beach. It is the best.

Summary Heading: Filthy Ripoff hotel BEWARE contracted scabies
Summary: Stayed here for one night last month, and i regret it in the worst way and is seriously one of the worst places i have ever stayed. When i first arrived the clerk took 30 minutes to appear!!! 30 friggen minutes! Other people showed up too as i was waiting and we were all standing around wondering if anyone even worked there. When he finally cruises in, there was a group of impatient annoyed people, and he acted like he didnt give a crap at all and even acted like we were disturbing him or something. Unfortunately it was the only place on PCH that had an open room that day so i had no choice. The place was a RIP-OFF and i was charged 140(!!!!) dollars for one night. on a room that was not even ocean-view and actually faced the miserable summer traffic on highway 1. So i got to

When  I Made A Reservations a month in advance, I had asked to see one of the rooms and was showed one immediately.  They even let me reserve that specific room.  The front dest was very helpful, courteous, professional in help making my husbands surprised  bday a memorable one. We had a very nice clean, spacious room.  The beds were very comfortable and yes there was not a sink directly in the bathrm area, but most beach hotels are like that.    It was truly home away from home.   Thanks  RAMADA, See you next year!! J & L  HUNTER

There was a lot of activity each night on the Public Parking lot between the hotel and the beach.  Teenagers and loud music blocked the sound of  the ocean.  There is a strip of several houses between the hotel and the beach.  Definitely NOT what is shown in the slide show.  I don't know where that hotel is, but it certainly is not Ramada Ocean in Sunset Beach.  We had to get our key cards reset 4 times.  The door would open with one but not with the other, resetting one card would cancel the other, so we had to keep getting 2 new cards... we were there 6 nights.  Shower head is about chest high for a 6 foot person.  If you have a bad back, be prepared to get on your elbows and knees to rinse off.

This was the cheapest beachside hotel we could find off the Pacific Coast Highway so we thought it would make for a pleasure stay enroute to LA during a business trip.  The hotel is very worn and the check in area and hallways could use a good cleaning-up. The rooms were clean but the bathroom was older and the shower / tub area did not feel clean.  There was free wireless and free parking which was a plus. The beach is pretty close but this part of town is pretty ugly compared to Huntington and Laguna areas so it is not much of a resort area.   The Oceanview rooms are not real ocean views. There are a bunch of houses in front of the hotel that block the ocean views. There are little balconies off the ocean view room and that is the best part of them.  Don't get a room on the

Aside from being 100 yards from the sand, there is no reason to stay at this place.  There are many reasons to avoid this place but here are the main ones:    -It is directly on the 6 lane-Pacific Coast Highway. (traffic 24/7). It was also under construction.   -Dirty, dirty, dirty. The lobby, the parking lot, the hallways, the room, the carpet, the walls all showed signs that this place is long overdue for a major overhaul/clean-up. It was bad. I did not dare sit down on the bed  -'Bait n switch' room rate. Quoted $89 on the internet but was told the rates were actually $99. Add $10 for the cold breakfast buffet, and add $15 if you want a room that faces the beach as opposed to the highway.    - VERY RUDE lobby staff.  Acted like they could care less when I brought these

This hotel is a little worn but overall clean.  The staff was very friendly.  There is a computer for use in the lobby to check email and view your digital pictures.  The breakfast was standard continental but quite acceptable.  We had connecting ocean view rooms # 207 & 208.  The sunset view was nice and the beach was only a few steps away.  The bike path is right there and the parking lot between the hotel and the beach seems quite common for beach access.  The balcony was nice.  It's great for a beach vacation or any other kind.  I would stay here again more for the location than anything else.  Room rate was $109 a night plus tax.  I would recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

Just steps from the beach (overlooking the beach parking lot) the location is great, but keep in mind it's not near downtown Huntington Beach, it is somewhat isolated along PCH.  We had polite service and the room was clean, outdated, but no problems.  We enjoyed eating breakfast out on the balcony, watching all the surfers suit up and go out.  We even had a fridge, and a microwave was available in the breakfast area, these are helpful with kids.  Also we had a lightning fast internet connection with a strong signal - better than some nicer hotels we've been to.  It's terrible that the other reviewer had their wallets stolen.  When we went out for the day, I put my new laptop in the car trunk.     We stay at a lot of hotels and for the price I would definitely stay here again.

Our room was broken into by house keeping. They took my wife's wallet and my own. There was a security camera pointed at our room's door and the staff refused to show the tape to us or the police. Management was very rude to us. I strongly recomend you don't stay at this hotel!

You can't beat the price and location of this hotel.  We had a good sized room with a spacious balcony that looked directly out to the beach and ocean.  Good sized fridge in room that was clean and oderless.  The front desk staff was friendly and quick to respond to our requests.  Parking was ample and covered.  The complimentary breakfast is coffee, juice. hot chocolate and muffins and pastries...nice and FREE!!!  You are less than a minute from your hotel room onto the sand.  Yes the busses come to the end of the line here, but we slept with the patio doors open each night and were not bothered by noise.  This hotel is a good value for the dollar, clean and "LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION".  We will definately be returning here.

Summary Heading: Hotel is much better than given credit for!
Summary: Have you ever stayed on a beach in CA? This hotel offers beautiful ocean view balcony rooms and is the only one on Huntington beach.  The rest are across the street. The room looked newly carpeted, new wall paper & paint, new sink area with granite counter tops, new furniture, nice clean smell, no smoking in any of the rooms, new curtains with matching border along the ceiling, new lamps and a nice comfortable bed. You can get some doozies on the beach that are dumps for $225 a night, such as in Del Mar, Ocean Beach or Newport.  This place was only $100 and well worth the money. You can tell it is an older property that has been redone but if you want a high dollar hotel down the street, less access to the ocean and no view there are plenty of them. I have seen much worse and

Summary Heading: Old and stuck in the 70's decore, but worth the $100/night
Summary: We stayed for the night for a party at Huntington Harbor Yacht Club to watch the parade of boats decorated with lights. We stayed here because of it’s location to the harbor. It is a run down hotel and I wouldn’t recommend it if you are planning a vacation stay. It is, however, walking distance to the beach and the Pacific Ocean.  We stayed on the PCH side of the hotel. This side is very noisy as this is a major highway. The room was large, but the bathroom was very small. The shower door was broken (and it looked like it has been broken for awhile). The free breakfast was ok and it was free, so considering that, it was pretty good. The room had a refrigerator, a coffee maker and a built in hair dryer, but the lack of a microwave was a negative.  The staff was very friendly.

This is a hotel offering excellent beach access. If you need upscale accomodations, look elsewhere. But if you like the idea of being able to walk directly from your room onto the Pacific sands and listen to the ocean from your balcony, this is a good choice. The hotel is adjacent to a huge state park (Bolsa Chica) - it's not in the "middle of nowhere." Sunset Beach has a little surf-town feel with crab restaurants and tattoo parlors, but you can still get to Disneyland in less than 30 minutes.  I did not find the staff to be rude. Summary Heading: This is a dump!--don't waste your money
Summary: Overpriced hotel for what is barely a 2*.  Hotel is outdated, and breakfast is not what was described on the Ramada web site (hot cooked waffles).  Beds were pretty comfortable, but sink is outside the bathroom that is smaller than the bathroom I had in my dorm room in college.  Absolutely no security as anyone can enter the side entrances from the beach without being stopped.  You can get much better for less expense on Priceline.  Really--don't waste your money. Free wireless internet is what saved my stay.

Summary Heading: Beware of breaking objects and grouchy deskstaff
Summary: I should have listened to the people from Stockholm that called this place The Bates Motel - it is! Two minutes into our stay, the shower handle literally came off in our hands - we had traveled for 10 hours to get here and really needed a shower. The front desk people gave us a hard time, insisting we broke the shower. We moved into another room that had other loose and broken items but at least the shower worked. We paid a fortune for the seaside view - it certainly wasn't the quality of the room! Most unkept place we've ever stayed and most unfriendly staff as well.

We stumbled across the Ramada Limited while cruising the coast and felt we had found a treasure. Our spacious room had the hugest patio: large enough for a table and three lounging chairs as well as a 3 year old with a beach ball, that was facing the ocean just a short walk away. We did the family beach thing as much as we wanted and could go back and forth to the room easily. Our damp things then dried rapidly on our patio. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Both the Mexican and Sushi restaurants across the busy street were wonderful and convenient. The Continental breakfast was handy, as were the room refrig and the lobby microwave for heating kiddie foods. We have very fond thoughts of Sunset Beach and plan to return soon.
